This is a tropical getaway into a world of frothy waterfalls criss-crossed by rainbows in Argentina’s rainforest. It’s somewhere marked with a touch of magic. You’ll visit both the Argentinean and Brazilian side of the Falls, take an optional jet boat ride and get a close up encounter with the local coatis – small raccoon-like creatures. You'll head back to Buenos Aires for one more night before you make your own way to the airport to catch your flight back home.

tourName: Argentina holiday, Buenos Aires to Patagonia
placesVisited: Buenos Aires, Tango Class, Gaucho Party, El Calafate, Perito Moreno Glacier, Iguazu Falls
generalInfo:
This tailor made holiday takes you from Buenos Aires to Argentina in a mere 11 days, taking in everything from glaciers to waterfalls to big city lights, and with expert guides to help you get the most out of your experience.

Most trips to Argentina focus on the country’s outstanding natural wonders and this trip is no different. A visit to Iguazu Falls is firmly on the itinerary and it’s a breathtaking sight that you’re not likely to forget in a hurry. Recently listed as one of the new Seven Wonders of Nature, its thundering waters are surrounded by tropical jungle, and crisscrossed by walking trails designed to help you admire the falls from as many angles as possible, including from neighbouring Brazil. Also included is a visit to Patagonia, where you’ll have the chance to view (and perhaps hike on) the Perito Moreno Glacier.

Big city kicks come in the form of Buenos Aires, where you’ll tour the city’s historical heart, take an evening Tango lesson and enjoy some of the country’s legendary food and wine at one of the city’s best restaurants. You’ll also get to head out of town to a nearby ranch, where you’ll get a handle on the culture of the local Gauchos - horsemen descended from indigenous Indians and Spanish settlers who work the ranches of Argentina.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Buenos Aires. Met by Trip Planner at airport and transfer to hotel. One of Argentina’s top attractions is the leviathan metropolis of Buenos Aires, the most fascinating of all South American capitals. It’s a riveting place just to wander about, people-watching, shopping or simply soaking up the unique atmosphere. Its many barrios (neighborhoods) are startlingly different – some are decadently old-fashioned, others daringly modern – but all of them ooze character. Buenos Aires has got everything: night-life, tango, culture, football, excellent beef and the best local wines. Argentine Dinner Party Experience. You will take part in the Argentina Dinner Experience this evening . This unique dinner party's concept is to teach you the fundamentals of what being an Argentine is all about, whilst simply having more fun than is available anywhere else. Learn how to close your own empanada using the 'repulge' technique, to order steak your way in Spanish, to prepare your own 'mate' drink. During the experience you get to take part in the ritual of preparing an Argentina Asado with the best of Argentina beef whilst sampling the best of Argentine wines. This is a group experience and is a lot of fun and great way to meet fellow travelers.

Private City Tour. The city tour would be a mixture of driving and walking and would take in all the major sights of Buenos Aires. From the Flor Generica And the Rose gardens we would make our way to the park of memory . This park is dedicated to the 30,000 Argentine's who disappeared during the dictatorship between the years 1976 to 1983. We would then visit Recoleta and the final resting place of EVA (Evita) Peron. This would be followed by the plaza San Martin and the Plaza de Mayo. This plaza has a rich history and the mothers of the plaza de Mayo still march their every Thursday holding the pictures of their disappeared youngsters and wearing their iconic headscarves. This is also the sight of the Casa Rosada where Evita made her famous balcony speech. From there we would move on to take in San Telmo and la Boca with the famous Caminito. We would move on then to the Theatro Colon and the 9th of July Avenue which at 18 lanes wide is the worlds largest and quite a sight to be hold. Los Angelitos Dinner Show. Buenos Aires is the world capital of Tango and Los Angelitos experiences the nostalgic mood with intensity through dance, music, clothing and poetry. Lively and ethereal, El Cabaret is the vibrant dance of this award winning show. A dazzling live orchestra, great dancers, traditional Argentine cuisine, and a fine selection of local wines and cocktails, make it a must see production. Includes pick and transfer to and from show.

Gaucho Party at the Estancia Santa Susana. Today you will be taken out to the pampas of Buenos Aires to a typical ranch were you will be able to enjoy and gain an insight to the “Gaucho” culture. Gauchos are the famous horsemen (descended from the native Indians and Spanish settlers) who work the ranches of Argentina who have a clearly defined culture that manifests itself through folklore, music, dance and sport. At the Gaucho party the following activities take place: Wine and Empanada Reception; Visit to the Estancia museum and Church; Horse and sulky trips; Typical Argentine BBQ with wine; Folklore show with Malambo; Show of Gaucho horsemanship; & The services of a bilingual tour guide.

Transfer from hotel to airport to catch flight to Calafate. Transfer from airport to hotel. In the heart of Patagonia, next to the Andes, is one of Argentina’s most scenic areas, commonly referred to as Lago Argentino and the Perito Moreno Glacier, declared “Universal Heritage” by the UNESCO. The most renown of all the glaciers is the Perito Moreno Glacier. Situated 80 km (50 miles) from El Calafate, it is the most easily reached among them. This is an imposing ice river that descends from the Southern Patagonian Ice Cap down to the lake, at ‘Canal de los Témpanos’ (Icebergs’ Channel). It is the only glacier in the area which is considered to be in equilibrium, that is: not receding. It has always been the most important attraction of the region thanks to its spectacular beauty, but especially because of its unusual behavior. The glacier slowly advances down the mountain slope towards the lake, producing, as it spills down, thunderous noises and ruptures. Recommend visiting Laguna Nimez reserve, a short walk from the town center. This ecological environment lodges an educational circuit with trails and signposts laid up along over 2,500 meters. The guides await visitors at the entrance gate to assist them with the interpretation of the natural environment. Likewise, a complete herbarium that helps visitors identify the local plants is located in the entrance area. The reserve has good vantage points that enable visitors to watch how the flamingo's, geese, silvery grebes, black-necked swans, ibis, lapwings, ducks, coots, hawks and chimangos, among other 70 species, fed in the clump of rushes.

Full day Perito Moreno Glacier Tour. Experience the majestic icy expanse of the Perito Moreno Glacier on this full-day tour from El Calafate. Trek among the pristine streams, gullies and peaks of Los Glaciares National Park with a professional guide, and get an up-close perspective on the fantastic formation with a 1-hour boat ride through a glacial lagoon. You might even witness the glacier’s signature movement and cracking sounds from detaching icebergs! Perito Moreno Glacier has become a favorite Patagonian destination thanks to its impressive expanse, accessibility and continuous movement. Your icy adventure begins with pickup at your El Calafate hotel and a scenic drive to Los Glaciares National Park, so named for the abundance of glaciers found here, including Upsalla, Onelli and Spegazzini. Let your guide handle the driving while you soak up the splendor of Lago Argentino framed by majestic peaks and icy islands. Stretch your legs and take an easy hike along park pathways for diverse views of Perito Moreno’s 200-foot-(60-meter)-high, blue-tinged walls. Watch closely to see giant slabs of ice detach from the glacier and slide into the surrounding lagoon. Loud cracking noises are sure to alert you to any movement! For another perspective, enjoy a 1-hour cruise through the lagoon in front of Perito Moreno. Sail along the massive glacier wall and in between floating icebergs for an awe-inspiring watery perspective on this natural wonder. After exploring the park, relax on the return drive to El Calafate, where your 9-hour tour concludes in the early evening. or. Hiking Perito Moreno Glacier – age limit 65 years old. Hike El Perito Moreno Glacier on this full-day tour from El Cafate. This trip is a must-do for thrill-seekers and adventure travelers. This 11-hour expedition includes pickup and drop-off at your hotel in El Calafate, a boat ride from Bajo de las Sombras port as well as all the necessary glacier-hiking equipment like crampons and ice axes. A professional local guide ensures your safety and enjoyment. After being met at your El Calafate hotel, you'll be transferred to Bajo de las Sombras (Under the Shadows) port for your 20-minute sail to the glacier. Once you arrive at Perito Moreno Glacier, your expert guides will instruct you on the proper use of special winter hiking equipment, including crampons and ice axes. Wear appropriate gear such as wool socks, trekking boots, and cold weather clothing. Once you're all geared up, make your way along Rico Arm towards the glacier itself. During the 90-minute trek across Perito Moreno, your local guide will tell your group about the history and formation of the glacier. Surrounded by an otherworldly, white-on-white landscape, listen to the sound of your crampons crunching ice and feel the steam of your own breath. Once you reach the end of the walk, you'll stop and eat the lunch that you've brought along with you. Head back across the Rico Arm and over a footbridge that allows you one last parting view of the hulking glacier you just conquered. After a brief forest trek, you'll be picked up by bus and deposited at the glacier's most spectacular overlook, where spend an hour of free time to relaxing, enjoying the scenery and snapping some photos before heading back to your El Calafate hotel.

Full Day Upsala Glacier Tour. Experience the remote beauty of Patagonia’s Estancia Cristina and Upsala Glacier on a journey of discovery from El Calafate. Sail past icebergs across Lago Argentino and tour the historic Estancia Cristina ranch. In the afternoon, choose between a short and easy trek to a beautiful waterfall or an off-road tour to the beautiful Upsala Glacier. Our Patagonian adventure begins with pickup from your hotel in El Calafate. Relax on the 28-mile (45-kilometer) journey to the port at Punta Bandera, where your three-hour boat cruise departs. Enjoy croissants and hot drinks served on board the comfortable boat as you glide among icebergs, past the stunning scenery of snow-covered peaks. Sail to the western front of the Upsala Glacier, then cruise along Cristina Channel to Estancia Christina. Disembark at the historic estancia, and learn the history of the sheep and cattle ranch on a visit to the museum and old shearing shed. Enjoy a snack break before continuing your tour of the estancia. Take a short-guided walk up to Caterina River to visit the estancia’s chapel and other historic buildings. After lunch, take an off-road trip for fantastic views of the Upsala Glacier, or an easy trek to see the beautiful waterfall of Los Perros. The three-hour off-road trip takes you along a scenic mountain trail, following a route of great geological interest, until quite recently covered by glaciers. Reaching a mountain refuge, take a 20-minute walk over terrain eroded by glaciers to reach the Upsala Glacier. From here you can see amazing views of Lake William, the Patagonian ice field and the Andes mountains. If you choose the walk to the cascading waters of Los Perros waterfall, the two-hour trek takes you through beautiful woodlands for lofty views of Caterina River and the estancia below. or. Nibepo Aike Ranch with Horseriding. This full day tour takes to Estancia Nibepo Aike, a beautiful ranch located within Los Glaciares National Park. There you will experience the life at the Patagonian countryside, taste delicious local cuisine and explore the amazing natural landscapes that surround the ranch. After lunch, go on an exciting 3 hours horseback riding to end this incredible day. We begin with the departure from centrally located El Calafate Hotels at 08:30 am and travel through the gravel route No. 15. On the way, we might get to see some condors, foxes and hares. Enjoy the views of the amazing Patagonian scenery, with Cerro Frías as backdrop. After crossing the Rico River, the steppe landscape changes abruptly, becoming a mountain landscape. Arrival to the estancia after crossing the margin of Roca Lake and having entered to Los Glaciers. You will be greeted by the host guide, who will be waiting to welcome you with a hot drink accompanied by homemade pastry. While having breakfast, you can enjoy a magnificent view of the Cordillera de los Andes. Then, start the visit to the facilities of this typical Patagonian estancia, that used to be dedicated formerly to bovine production. Around noon lunch will be served, consisting of an exquisite lamb grilled on a traditional Patagonian cross stake. Once we have savored it, we will go on a three hour guided horseback ride. The guide will take you explore different path, each one as amazing as the one before, so that you get to know even better this beautiful region. At approximately 7:15 pm, we will be returning to El Calafate hotels. or. El Chalten Full day hiking. Hike from the village of El Chalten along the trails of Los Glaciares National Park Explore the hiking capital of Argentina at your own pace Enjoy fantastic views of Mt. Fitz Roy Discover extraordinary glaciers and Patagonian landscapes of Los Glaciares National park Spend some time exploring nature with a full-day in El Chalten, home to Los Glaciares National Park. Begin by departing El Calafate in the morning along Route 40, an iconic highway goes along the Argentino Lake up to the La Leona River. Passing the Cañadón La Leona, you will stop at an ancient hotel for a break to buy coffee and cakes. Continue along the Lake Viedma for magical views of glaciers, hidden lakes, and the glory that is Mt. Fitz Roy. After several photos stops, arrive in the Andean village El Chaltan, also known as the "The Capital of the Trekking." Here you will visit the Interpretation Centre before setting out on a hiking journey. From The Pudu Lodge, you will start a self-guided trek to one of the miradors of the Mount Fitz Roy and Mount Torre. You will be given a map and lunch to bring with you as you follow the clearly marked tracks. You may consider the DeAgostini base camp - Laguna Torre hike, one of the most classic treks. It takes you up to the Adela range and the incredible Lagoon Torre, where you might find a number of icebergs that have slid down from the face of the glacier Cerro Torre. If you are seeking something shorter, the Laguna Capri Trail is a great option that offers unforgettable views of Mt. Fitz Roy. Afterwards, return to Hotel in Calafate.

Transfer from hotel to airport to take flight to Iguazu Falls. Transfer from airport to hotel. Having recently been listed as one of the new 7 Wonders of Nature, Iguazu Falls is one of the most breathtaking sites to behold. With countless waterfalls surrounded by the tropical jungle of Argentina, Paraguay and Brazil, ones breath will be taken away by your proximity to nature. The vast majority of the Iguazu Falls lie on the Argentine side of the border, within the National Park Iguazu. This side offers the most extensive experience of the Falls thanks to its extensive system of trails and walkways that enable you to go both below and under the falls – most notably the Devils Throat. The surrounding forest also offers excellent opportunities to discover the regions wildlife.

Argentine Falls Tour. Today you will enjoy a full day tour of the Argentine side of the Iguazu Falls. During the tour you will get ‘up, close and intimate’ with views of this unforgettable section of the Iguazu River. Our guide will show you the hidden gems of this unique National Park in the lower and upper walkways and will take you off the beaten path to show you the best views. You are welcome to wonder off on your own whilst in the National Park. Trails through the 210 square mile reserve provide visitors with various views of the Falls, especially the largest one, Devil's Throat. The mist over the Devil's Throat is such that endless rainbows are formed. Expect to get wet today and fell exhilarated with the spray and close contact with the sheer power of the falls. The ecological train ride is included in the tour. So too is the Jet boat ride under the falls. Return to hotel early evening.

Brazilian Falls tour. In the morning, you will be picked up from your hotel and taken across the Argentine –Brazilian border and enter the Iguazu National Park on the Brazil side. Here you will enjoy a spectacular panoramic view of the Falls during a walking tour through the passages that connect the different observation points. Similar to football, the Brazilians and Argentine's argue which side has the best view of the Falls. What is clear is that both sides are different and spectacular in their own unique way. You can decide for yourself, which side you are most impressed with.
Transfer from hotel to airport to take flight to Buenos Aires and connecting flight home.

tourName: Argentina holiday, cities and national parks
generalInfo:
Visit Argentina´s most seductive cities- Buenos Aires, Mendoza and Bariloche, along with its most popular national parks- Iguazu Falls, Mount Aconcagua and Nahuel Huapi. This trip also features Mendoza wineries and a cruise to Victoria Island from Bariloche.

This is a tailor-made itinerary and may be adjusted to suit your interests, your budget and your schedule. Trips may depart any day of the week, upgrades are available and you may add new destinations or extra nights as you see fit.

For example, if you would like to add a visit to a ranch and horseback ride near Buenos Aires, explore Iguazu Falls or continue on to the glaciers of Patagonia, we are happy to help you plan your adventure.

dayInfo.description: Buenos Aires: Upon arrival you will be met at the airport and transferred by private service to your hotel, leaving you the remainder of the day to explore the historic neighborhoods and enjoy the cafe culture of Buenos Aires.

Buenos Aires City Tour & Tango Show: Breakfast. Our City Tour will provide you a great overview of the city and its diverse attractions. Over the course of three hours you will have the chance to visit Retiro, Avenida 9 de Julio, Downtown, Puerto Madero, San Telmo, Recoleta and La Boca. In the evening you will be picked up from your hotel to be driven to a mystical place where you’ll discover one of our most ancient traditions. Tango is more than our national dance. Tango is: our immigrant origins, the talent of our local artists, the sensuality of the Argentine woman and our way to deal with a broken heart, dancing our way through tragical and yet eternal love stories. Tonight you will enjoy a 3 hour long professional display of tango and music with a group of local artists onstage immersed in an elegant and alluring place. The manners, ambience, clothes and dance steps which tango lovers used to practice 100 years ago will come to life again and you will travel in time for a night. This spectacular demonstration of the finest local dancing will be accompanied by delicious Argentine and international cuisine. Dinner is à la carte, beverages included so you can lose yourself in the ethereal taste of Malbec wine. At the end of the evening, around midnight, you will be driven back to your hotel, fully in love with the bohemian spirit of our beloved Buenos Aires. Duration: 3-4 hours Included: transportation mentioned above Note: formal dress is not required

Buenos Aires to Puerto Iguazu: Breakfast. At appropriate time in the morning, you will have a private transfer to the domestic airport to take your flight to Puerto Iguazu. Upon arrival, you will enjoy half day private excursion to the Brazilian side of the Iguazu Falls where you will enjoy vast panoramic views of the Falls allowing you to take them in in their entirety. "Brazil requires that most tourists have a visa to visit the Brazilian side of Iguazu Falls. Please check with the Brazilian Consulate to ensure that you have the appropriate visa before traveling or you will not be allowed to enter Brazil. For example- US citizens, Canadians & Australians (as well as many other nationalities) need a visa to visit the Brazilian side of Iguazu Falls."

Iguazu National Park- Argentine Side: After breakfast you will depart on a private, full day tour to the Argentine side of the Iguazu Falls where you will have intimate views of this unforgettable section of the Iguazu River. Lower and upper walkways permit up close and personal experiences with this magnificent spectacle of nature. Trails through the 210 square mile reserve provide visitors with various views of the Falls, especially the largest one, Devil's Throat. The ecological train ride is included in the tour with an option to add the Safari Nautico boat trip ( for an additional cost ). The Iguazu boat trip takes you right up to the base of the Falls. This exciting excursion is highly recommended in order to experience the true power of Iguazu Falls. ( Please be aware- on the boat trip there is a 100% chance that you will get wet...the Falls provide a refreshing "natural shower". Be sure to take some extra clothes if you want to do this excursion). Return to the hotel in the late afternoon.

Puerto Iguazu to Mendoza: Breakfast. At the appropriate time you will have a private transfer to the airport for your flight to Mendoza. Upon arrival, you will be taken to your comfortable selected hotel. Private service.

Mendoza Wine Tours - In the morning you will be picked up from your hotel for a half day tour to the Mendoza Wine Country. The tour is in a small group and with a bilingual guide (semi-private service). During the day, you will visit two of the best wineries in the area where you will learn about their philosophy, the wine making process and have the chance to taste some delicious locally produced Cabernet and Malbec, far from the big buses that visit the most popular wineries this semi private tour is specially designed to visit some of the best vineyards accompanied by our local wine expert. Return to the hotel in the afternoon.

High Mountain Tour: After breakfast, you will have a full day tour to the nearby Andes Mountains where you will enjoy some panoramic views and the impressive Mount Aconcagua, the highest peak in the Americas. Before returning to the hotel late in the afternoon you will visit Uspallata, Penitentes and Puente del Inca (Inca Bridge), regular service.

Mendoza to Bariloche: At appropriate time, you will be picked up at your hotel and driven to the domestic airport for your flight to Bariloche. If the sky is clear, on landing, you will get to see the contrast of blue Nahuel Huapi Lake, white peaks of the Andes and the green of the forest. Upon arrival you will be transferred to your hotel (shared service) and have the afternoon at leisure. You can explore the Swiss-like town plaza, try some of the delicious, locally made chocolates or walk by the lake on you own to start feeling the magnificence of the Lake District.

Bariloche: Breakfast. This semi-private excursion shows the surroundings of San Carlos de Bariloche and Llao-Llao Natural Reserve. While visiting the most important viewpoints of the area, the guide tells us how this little mountain village changed into one of the most attractive tourist cities in Patagonia. We will appreciate the beauty of different lakes and mountains and we will do a nature oriented walk through a native forest. We finish the excursion by visiting a traditional Microbrewery. Box lunch and Cerro Campanario Hill lift-chair tickets included.

Full Day Blest port & Cantaros waterfall "Setting out by boat from Puerto Pañuelo (Pañuelo Port,) on the Llao Llao peninsula, and after one hour of sailing, you´ll arrive at Centinela Island, resting place of Perito Francisco Pascasio Moreno, father of National Parks in Argentina, followed by a visit to Cascada de los Cántaros (Cántaros Waterfall). Later on, a walk through the lush vegetation of the Valdivian rainforest, arriving at Lago Cántaros (Cántaros Lake,) the mouth of the waterfall, where you can witness the overwhelming sight of a 1,500-year-old larch tree. A short 5 minute sail later, you will finally arrive at Puerto Blest, a place that has amazed tourists from all over the world. From there, you´ll be able to tour the bay and the shores of Lago Frías (price not included) and its peculiar green waters, which originate at one of the glaciers on Cerro Tronador, the natural border between Argentina and Chile."
Bariloche to Buenos Aires: At appropriate time, you will be transferred to the airport for your flight to Buenos Aires. Upon arrival to Buenos Aires, you will have a private transfer to your hotel.

Buenos Aires: Breakfast. At appropriate time you will have a private transfer to the international airport for your flight back home. Have a great trip! NOTE: Iguazú Eco Fee: Mandatory tax to be paid once you get to your hotel in Iguazú. It's about 5 usd per guest, per night, and it varies according to your hotel category. Only cash is accepted.

tourName: Argentina holiday for nature lovers, 15 days
generalInfo:
Embark on a thrilling 15-day journey through Argentina, where you’ll explore the stunning glaciers rising over icy lakes in Patagonia

Hike through Ushuaia, the land of fire and snow. 

Travel north to experience the grandeur of Iguazú Falls from a unique boat trip beneath the waters.

Stop in Buenos Aires, where you’ll immerse yourself in the city’s lively barrios, marvel at its magnificent architecture, and enjoy an unforgettable evening of tango at a traditional milonga (tango house).

The best time to visit is from October to April, when the landscapes are at their most spectacular. This tour offers the perfect blend of natural wonders, urban charm, and cultural experiences, making it a dream for any traveler.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Argentina! Upon your arrival, a private transfer will take you to your hotel. After settling in, the rest of the day is yours to enjoy at your leisure. Buenos Aires, the capital of Argentina, is a vibrant cosmopolitan city renowned for its rich colors, diverse architecture, and lively culture. Often called the "Paris of South America," Buenos Aires proudly lives up to this title while showcasing a unique charm all its own. Argentines are famously warm and welcoming. If you’re exploring with a map in hand, don’t be surprised if a friendly local offers to help. That’s the Argentine spirit! On your first day, take time to wander the city’s picturesque cobblestone streets, relax at charming outdoor cafes, and savor the irresistible aroma of Argentine beef sizzling on an open “parrilla” (barbecue). Explore the bustling antique and artisan markets for unique finds, or immerse yourself in the local culture by visiting the trendy Palermo Soho district, known for its boutique shops and talented local designers. You might even discover the perfect leather jacket or handbag as a stylish souvenir!

Time to Explore the City - Dinner & Tango Show In the evening, you’ll be picked up from your hotel and transported to an iconic venue where you’ll immerse yourself in one of Argentina’s most cherished traditions. Experience a magical night in Buenos Aires, celebrating the passion and elegance of the Argentine tango. More than just a national dance, tango represents the soul of Argentina—its immigrant heritage, the artistry of its people, the sensuality of its women, and the resilience to dance through heartache and enduring love stories. Tonight, enjoy a breathtaking performance by talented local artists, set in an elegant and evocative atmosphere. The evening will transport you back in time, bringing to life the customs, ambiance, attire, and dance styles of tango enthusiasts from a century ago. As you watch this extraordinary display of skill and emotion, indulge in a gourmet dinner featuring both Argentine and international cuisine. Pair your meal with exquisite Malbec wine and let yourself be swept away by the flavors and rhythms of Buenos Aires. At the end of the night, you’ll be driven back to your hotel, captivated by the bohemian charm of this vibrant city. - Half-Day “Heart of the City” Bike Tour Today, meet your guide at our designated meeting point to embark on an exciting bike tour through the heart of Buenos Aires. With our fleet of bikes ready, you’ll explore this captivating city in the best way possible—on two wheels. Throughout the tour, you’ll dive into Buenos Aires’ rich history, vibrant culture, striking architecture, and impressive street art, all while cycling along its serene coastline. This sensory journey will allow you to see, hear, taste, and feel the essence of life as a Porteño (a Buenos Aires local). We’ll teach you the skills to charm any local and introduce you to an age-old Argentine tradition with a surprising history. Along the way, you’ll enjoy a decadent boardwalk lunch, sampling flavors that will leave you wanting more. By the end of the tour, you might find yourself contemplating an extended stay in this enchanting city! This bike tour is the perfect way to start your Buenos Aires adventure. We recommend joining us early in your visit to make the most of everything this dynamic city has to offer!

First Day in Patagonia! - Welcome to Southern Patagonia! El Calafate is a charming town nestled in the vast Patagonian steppe, a rugged and remote region known for its breathtaking landscapes. Situated on the shores of Lago Argentino, the largest lake in Argentina, El Calafate is renowned as the "Capital of the Glaciers" and serves as the gateway to the spectacular Perito Moreno Glacier—one of the few glaciers in the world still advancing. Upon your arrival at El Calafate Airport, a transfer will be waiting to take you to your hotel, where your Patagonian adventure begins. - Transfer: Buenos Aires Hotel to Airport At the scheduled time, you will be picked up from your hotel and transferred to Jorge Newbery Domestic Airport for your next flight. Safe travels!

Walk in the Perito Moreno Glacier - Full-Day Minitrekking Adventure Your day begins with a hotel pick-up, heading toward Los Glaciares National Park. Upon arrival at "Bajo las Sombras" port, we will board a boat and navigate across Lake Rico, enjoying stunning views of the south face of the Perito Moreno Glacier along the way. Once we reach the opposite shore, experienced mountain guides will greet us and divide participants into groups for the activity. You’ll be equipped with crampons, helmets, and harnesses, and the guides will provide a briefing on safety protocols. The adventure starts with a walk along the lake shore, offering a chance to witness ice calvings and soak in the beauty of the glacier. Along the way, the guides will share insights into glaciology, enhancing your understanding of this incredible natural wonder. With crampons securely in place, we’ll step onto the glacier itself for an unforgettable hour-long trek across the ice. As we explore, you’ll encounter fascinating features like deep crevasses, brilliant blue moulins, towering seracs, and shimmering turquoise ponds. Afterward, we’ll hike along the lateral moraine, taking in panoramic views of the glacier and its surroundings. After descending from the ice, a scenic trail leads us through the enchanting Andean Patagonian forest back to the shelter, where you’ll have some free time to relax. We’ll then embark on the return boat ride to Puerto Bajo las Sombras. Before the day concludes, we’ll visit the Glacier walkways, located 7 km from the port. This one-hour guided experience offers breathtaking panoramic views and opportunities to explore self-guided trails at your own pace. Finally, we’ll return you to your hotel, leaving you with memories of an extraordinary Patagonian adventure.

Kayak and Trekking Experience - Full-Day Kayak and Trekking Adventure on La Leona River Your adventure begins in the morning with a pick-up from your hotel in El Calafate, heading along the iconic Route 40 to the historic “Luz Divina” Parador. After equipping ourselves with kayaking gear, we’ll set off down the tranquil waters of the La Leona River, covering a total distance of approximately 10 miles. Midway through the journey, we’ll pause for an exciting 2-hour trek at Cerro Los Hornos. This hike offers a rare opportunity to explore a landscape filled with petrified logs, fossilized dinosaur bones, and ancient rock formations, some of the oldest on Earth. At a scenic viewpoint, we’ll stop to enjoy lunch (please bring your own box lunch) while taking in the breathtaking surroundings. After our break, we’ll return to the kayaks and continue paddling to the Turbio Stream, where our river adventure concludes. Following the kayaking portion, we’ll pack up the equipment and return to your hotel in El Calafate. -Transfer: La Leona to El Chaltén Hotel At the designated time, you will be transferred to your hotel in El Chaltén in private service.

Free Day in El Chalten - Day at Leisure in El Chaltén Get ready for an exhilarating day immersed in nature! El Chaltén is a hiker's paradise, offering a variety of well-marked, self-guided trails suitable for all levels of experience. You have the freedom to choose your path and pace, setting off on your adventure directly from your hotel. For a short and rewarding trek, consider the 3-kilometer (1.8-mile) hike to the Cerro Torre viewpoint, which takes approximately one hour. Along the way, you’ll traverse the serene Río de las Vueltas and pass through a picturesque lenga forest, with stunning views at every turn. Keep an eye out for the region’s abundant birdlife—this trail offers an excellent chance to spot woodpeckers and other native species!

Laguna de los Tres Hike - Day at Leisure in El Chaltén For avid hikers, today’s top recommendation is the spectacular trek to Laguna de los Tres. You can start this iconic hike directly from town or take a shared bus to Hostería El Pilar, located 14 km from downtown. Starting at El Pilar offers the advantage of diverse and unique perspectives of the stunning surroundings. From there, follow a scenic trail through a lenga forest alongside the Río Blanco (White River), leading you toward the Poincenot campsite. Along the way, take a break at the Piedras Blancas (White Rocks) viewpoint, where you’ll enjoy breathtaking views of the Piedras Blancas Glacier and its striking glacial features, including erratic boulders and lateral moraines left behind by the glacier’s retreat over recent decades. As you continue your hike, you’ll be rewarded with ever-changing vistas of the Fitz Roy mountain range before arriving at your ultimate destination—the awe-inspiring Laguna de los Tres. From this unforgettable spot, you’ll experience the most stunning view of Cerro Fitz Roy, a true highlight of Patagonia. We recommend enjoying lunch here while taking in the breathtaking scenery before beginning your descent back to El Chaltén.

Last Day in El Calafate - Transfer El Chaltén Hotel / El Calafate Hotel At the appropriate time, you will be picked up to board a bus to go from your hotel in El Chaltén to your hotel in El Calafate. The 3 hour long drive will be a good opportunity to rest, relax and enjoy the passing landscapes at your window.

Welcome to Ushuaia! - Transfer: El Calafate Hotel to El Calafate Airport At the scheduled time, you will be picked up from your hotel and transferred to El Calafate Airport for your departure. -Transfer: Ushuaia Airport to Ushuaia Hotel Known as the southernmost city in the world, Ushuaia is a charming town best explored on foot. Its first inhabitants, the Yamanas, named it Ushuaia, meaning "protected bay" in their language. Officially incorporated into Argentina in 1884, it later became a penal colony, establishing a permanent Argentine presence in the region. Upon arrival, you’ll be transferred to your hotel. Depending on your arrival time, you might wish to explore the town or visit one of its fascinating museums. The Thematic Gallery of Historia Fueguina features over 120 life-size figures that bring the history of Ushuaia to life, while the Prison Museum delves into the tales of some of the most infamous and dangerous criminals. And don’t miss the opportunity to savor Ushuaia’s renowned seafood. We highly recommend trying the delicious Blake Hake, a true local delicacy!

Trekking & Canoeing Tours - Full-Day Trekking & Canoeing in Tierra del Fuego National Park Your adventure begins in the morning with a pick-up from your hotel, heading to Tierra del Fuego National Park, a haven of pristine natural beauty. The day starts with a scenic 4-mile (6.5 km) hike along an undulating coastal trail. As you trek, you’ll be surrounded by breathtaking landscapes, with stunning views of lakes, the sea, and the majestic mountains. The trail offers a deep connection with nature, immersing you in the park’s serene and diverse environment. Following the hike, we’ll pause near the banks of the Lapataia River to enjoy a warm and hearty lunch inside a heated dome, providing comfort and panoramic views of the stunning surroundings. After lunch, the second part of the adventure begins. You’ll be equipped with rubber boots, cover pants, and life jackets for a thrilling canoeing experience. Starting at Lake Acigami, you’ll paddle along the tranquil waters of the Lapataia River, eventually reaching the sea at Lapataia Bay, the southern terminus of National Route Nº 3. The tour concludes at Lapataia Bay, where you’ll be transported back to your hotel, ending an unforgettable day in Tierra del Fuego’s pristine wilderness.

Beagle Channel Navigation - Half-Day Beagle Channel Navigation In 1833, Charles Darwin sailed the Beagle Channel and made remarkable discoveries. Now, it’s your turn to follow in his footsteps and explore this historic waterway, once known as the Onashaga Channel, named after the Onas, its first navigators. At the designated time, make your way to the tourist pier in the heart of the city, where you’ll embark on a 3-hour boat trip through the iconic Beagle Channel. As you sail, enjoy panoramic views of Ushuaia Bay, with the city beautifully framed by the towering Martial Glacier. Along the way, you’ll encounter a variety of marine wildlife, including cormorants (birds closely related to penguins) and playful fur seals basking on Alicia Island. With Argentina on your left and Chile on your right, you’ll continue sailing along this natural border, eventually reaching the legendary Les Eclaireurs Lighthouse, the historic sentinel guarding the bay. On the return trip, we’ll stop at Bridges Island, where you can take a short walk along an interpretive trail. Learn about the native Yamana people, explore the island’s largest shell deposits, and immerse yourself in the region’s rich history. During the excursion, you’ll be treated to a warm hot chocolate with cookies or have the chance to try mate, Argentina’s beloved green tea. Once back at the port, you’ll make your own way back to your hotel, with unforgettable memories of your Beagle Channel adventure.

First Day in Puerto Iguazú - Transfer: Ushuaia Hotel to Ushuaia Airport At the appropriate time, you will be transferred from your hotel to Ushuaia Airport for your flight. - Transfer: Puerto Iguazú Airport to Hotel The charming border town of Puerto Iguazú is the gateway to the breathtaking Iguazú Falls, one of the Seven Natural Wonders and a UNESCO World Heritage site. This awe-inspiring destination is a must-see for any traveler visiting Argentina. Upon your arrival at Puerto Iguazú Airport, you’ll be warmly greeted and transferred to your hotel. Enjoy the day at your leisure, relaxing in the tropical climate and jungle surroundings of this vibrant area.

Iguazú Falls - Argentine Side - Full-Day Iguazú Falls (Argentine Side) Today, we’ll pick you up from your hotel and drive you to Iguazú National Park on the Argentine side. This incredible park is surrounded by lush subtropical forest, teeming with diverse wildlife. Your guide will help you spot a variety of species, including toucans, parrots, and coatis. As you explore, you’ll walk along the lower and upper walkways, which wind through the forest and lead you right up to the falls, allowing you to experience the magnificence of Iguazú Falls from multiple perspectives. One of the highlights of the day will be a visit to the iconic Devil's Throat, the largest and most awe-inspiring of the falls. To reach this powerful cascade, you’ll take the ecological train and walk along boardwalks that offer stunning views of the surrounding landscape. Please note that the Devil’s Throat visit is temporarily suspended for maintenance. After exploring the falls and taking in the breathtaking scenery, you’ll have free time to enjoy lunch in the park, immersed in the natural beauty of the environment. This unforgettable, 7-hour excursion is the perfect way to experience the raw power and beauty of Iguazú Falls from the Argentine side.

Mbocay Fall Experience - Full-Day Mbocay Fall Experience Today, you’ll embark on a unique and exclusive adventure, connecting with nature and the regional gastronomy of Misiones. In the morning, you’ll be welcomed at La Chacrita with a traditional Misiones breakfast. Afterward, you’ll set off on a 4 km (2.5 mi) hike through a rugged forest trail, leading you to the stunning Saltos del Arroyo Mbocay—a series of beautiful waterfalls, cascades, natural pools, and lush vegetation. The Mbocay stream originates in Puerto Península Park and flows into the Paraná River. After your hike, you’ll return to La Chacrita, where a delicious regional lunch awaits you. Following lunch, you’ll have time to relax and enjoy the peaceful surroundings until 4:00 PM. - Transfer: Hotel in Puerto Iguazú to Puerto Iguazú Airport At the appropriate time, you will be transferred from your hotel to Puerto Iguazú Airport for your flight. - Transfer: Aeroparque Airport to Hotel Upon your arrival at Aeroparque Airport in Buenos Aires, you will be taken to your hotel in private transportation with an English-speaking guide.
End of your Adventure - Transfer Buenos Aires Hotel / Airport At the appropriate time, you will be transferred to the international airport for your flight. ¡Buen viaje!

tourName: Argentina holiday, Ibera Wetlands & Iguazu Falls
placesVisited: Posadas, Ibera Wetlands, Iguazu National Park, Stay in a traditional estancia
generalInfo:
On this Argentina holiday you’ll experience the Ibera Wetlands and Iguazu Falls on a five day tailor made journey that takes you away from the main tourist trail. In the Ibera Wetlands you’ll tour the swamps, marshes and lagoons where a wide variety of wildlife make their home, from pig-like peccaries to capybaras to armadillos. In Iguazu National Park you’ll visit both the Argentinean and Brazilian sides of the Iguazu Falls, whose beauty you can appreciate from the many walking trails and boat trips.

What makes this tour the most interesting, perhaps, is your accommodation. You’ll enjoy traditional Argentinean food and hospitality with stays at local estancias – old, usually family run establishments, home to sweeping grounds, horses and gauchos. They are a fascinating insight into Argentinean life and an experience that you’re sure to remember for a long time to come.

dayInfo.description: From Posadas to an off-the-beaten-path destination... When you arrive in Posadas, you will be taken to a small estancia in the Iberá region, close to the renowned wetlands. Enjoy the classic gaucho setting. The estancia is an excellent starting point for exploring the surrounding area. The Esteros are the world's second-largest wetlands, after the Pantanal in Brazil. Iberá is also one of the continent's largest freshwater reservoirs. The estancia is an ideal base for exploring the area and experiencing a real gaucho atmosphere. Because this is more like a family home than a hotel, you will be able to eat handmade meals and learn about the local customs. After arriving at the estancia, you will have the afternoon free to explore the magnificent, isolated countryside on foot or on horseback.

Iberá wetlands tours: unearthing peace and nature - After a homemade breakfast you will go out to explore the area. Take a boat trip to see alligators and capybaras and do flora and fauna sightseeing. The natural reserve is hometown to some exotic species declared Provincial Natural Monument like the marsh deer and some impressive aquatic vegetation. If you prefer an even more adventurous activity take a horse ride along the Iberá marshes and feel like a real argentine gaucho.

Out of the Esteros: from Posadas to Iguazú falls - Say goodbye to Iberá's spectacular sunrise and prepare to resume your adventure. You will be picked up in the morning and taken to Posadas, which is roughly 4 hours away. When you arrive in Posadas, board the public bus to Puerto Iguazú (300 kilometers distant), the entry to the legendary Iguazú Falls. This journey takes around 5 hours; if you want to make this part of the trip by private transportation, please let us know and we will provide you with a quotation. You will be taken to your accommodation upon arrival in Puerto Iguazú. You'll have the afternoon free to chill and enjoy the tropical heat and forest environment. If you want to go exploring, go to "Hito Tres Fronteras," a viewpoint west of town that rises high above the tumultuous reddish-brown confluence of the Iguazú and Paraná rivers, which also forms the Triple Frontera, or Triple Border between Argentina, Brazil, and Paraguay.

Full-Day Iguazú Falls Argentine side Today we will pick you up from your hotel and drive you to Iguazú National Park, on the Argentine side. The falls are surrounded by a humid subtropical forest where the exuberant vegetation is home to many different species of wildlife. Our guide will help you spot some of them: toucans, parrots and coatis, just to name a few! Lower and upper walkways weave in and around the falls, permitting up-close and personal experiences with this magnificent spectacle of nature. The Argentine side of the falls is filled with a myriad of paths, and walkways which allow you to have an experience from many different perspectives. You will also have the chance to visit the “Devil's Throat”; the largest of the falls and for many, the most spellbinding. To get to the Devil's Throat, you’ll take the ecological train and then walk out along boardwalks. After walking around and taking pictures of waterfalls, animals and plants, you will have some free time to eat lunch in this amazing environment. This exciting, 7-hour excursion is highly recommended in order to experience the true power of Iguazú Falls!! Type of service: Semi private Duration: 7 hours Included: Transportation mentioned above, bilingual guide (English/Spanish), ecological train Not included: Entrance fee to the Iguazú National Park (Argentinian side), meals (lunch/box lunch) Great Adventure Boat Trip (Iguazú National Park) Enhance your visit to the Argentina side of the Iguazú Waterfalls with an interesting truck ride through the subtropical rain forest discovering the native flora and fauna with a knowledgeable guide. Embark on a fun-filled adventure by navigation up under the waterfalls, getting stunning views and a dose of adrenaline. You will make a 5-mile tour in an all-terrain vehicle on the Yacaratiá trail to Puerto Macuco. You will board in a twin-engine boat sailing almost 4 miles through the Lower Iguazú River with 1.25 miles of rapids until the entrance of the Devil's Throat Canyon, where the expected baptism of water is taken! Type of service: Shared Duration: 2 hours aprox. (combined with the excursion to the Argentine side of the falls) Included: Boat ride, waterproof dry bag, bilingual guide (English/Spanish) Not included: Transfers (to do this activity you will set a meeting point the day you make Iguazú Falls – Argentinian side), meals and drinks Age Restriction: People under 12 years old can not participate in this activity Note: Pregnant women, people with heart problems, neurological or spinal problems are not allowed to take this boat trip. Please note that you will get soaking wet during the ride, we highly recommend bringing spare clothes with you to change afterwards.

Half-Day Iguazú Falls Brazilian side Today we will pick you up from your hotel and drive you to Foz do Iguazú National Park, on the Brazilian side. Don't forget your passport! While Argentina has 80% of the falls on its side, Brazil has the best panoramic view. On the Argentinian side, you have the sensation of being right inside the falls, but only by visiting the Brazilian side you will fully appreciate the immensity of Iguazú falls. At the entrance of the National Park, you will get a bus with accompanied by a guide that will take your to the falls. Take your time to enjoy it and feel it. Stroll the different walkways and feel the spray of water in your face. Take the boardwalk over the Salto Santa María, it feels like walking on the water! Get closer to the Devil's Throat and feel the power of water! Once the tour is over, take the bus that will leave you at the access gate from where you will be driven to your hotel. Type of service: Semi private Duration: 2-3 hours Included: Transportation mentioned above, bilingual guide (English/Spanish) Not included: Entrance fee to the Iguazú National Park (Brazilian side), meals (lunch/box lunch), Visa to enter Brazil (please check the requirement with the consulate of your country) Guide assistance during transfer

Transfer Hotel Puerto Iguazú / Puerto Iguazú Airport At the appropriate time you will be transferred to Puerto Iguazú airport to take your flight. Type of service: Semiprivate Included: Transportation mentioned above

tourName: Argentina holidays, 22 days
generalInfo:
This journey starts with a boutique hotel in Buenos Aires, a fusion of cultural influences from a trendy metropolis and Italian cuisine, to native Indian roots, Atlantic Patagonia, steep Andes mountains and wide glaciers. All to be tailor made. An itinery from cosmopolitan Buenos Aires, wetlands of Ibera, Iguazu waterfalls, Peninsula Valdez to Patagonia with El Calafate, Chalten & Ushuaia. You can stay in typical atmospheric hotels combined with special Argentinean estancias and the boutique pousadas & hotels. We can work with 3 to 5 star boutique accommodations, all tailor made.

Lovely posada in the Iberas marshes, with 2 days for wildlife watching, and a visit and stay on both the Argentinean & Brazilian sides of the Iguazu waterfalls, the largest waterfalls of the world, including optional nature excursions in the tropical Brazilian forest. From here you travel back to Buenos Aires further to Peninsula Valdez for watching whales, penguins and more wildlife. From there to the Andes regions to visit the Perito Morena glacier and self guided trekkings or guided walks at El Chalten in impressive mountain with glacier landscapes. At last visit Tierra del Fuego cruise and/or visit the National Park at Ushuaia.

Other options for Argentina: Tailor made selfdrive programs Valles Calchaquies, Salta, Tilcara, Tucuman, exploring the Andean landscapes & historical sites of Salta & Tucuman, with charming little & typical hotels, and/or excellent top accommodations at famous estancias Colomé, House of Jasmines, and Cafayate wine bodegas.

We also offer private guided roundtrips at Salta, Atacama desert, Uyunyi salt flats and Mendoza with driver-guide, including gourmet cuisine, wine and olive tasting, boutique wine resorts, Aconcagua park, day and night visit to the observatory Leoncito, staying at boutique pousada La Querencia, Barreal (San Juan province), visit Caverna de Las Brujas, Laguna de Llancanelo and volcano national park la Payunia, visit to the observatory Pierre Auger at Malargue, Pozo de las Animas, Las Llenas - one of the best ski centers of Latin America and boutique spa Therma Cacheuta near Mendoza. Extra option to cross the Andes and travel from Mendoza (or from San Juan as starting point to Valle Elqui - Selena in Chile) to Valparaiso at the Pacific Ocean or Santiago de Chile with your private guide-driver in 4-5 days.

Buenos Aires tours are all tailor made according to your wishes, half day, full day or several days. We can offer special Urban art tours (street art, graffiti tours) with specialized guides on Urban art, Argentinean life, history and politics. We also offer Gastronomy tours, Architecture tours mixed with Urban art or only focused on one aspect. Kayaking tours with walking in the Tigre delta and learning about life and ecosystems. Birdwatching tours. Besides all private guided City tours.

Trekking on foot or by horse with Argentinean gauchos, trekkings on foot or by horse, guided by local gauchos. Starting from near Cachi, following rivers, canyons, crossing passes on high altitude, following old Inca trails and ending in the Toro canyon. Price includes guidance of gauchos on horse, transport of all luggage & food with mules, gaucho cook & meals, hay for horses, campment fees & 2 personal horses (incl. for free days).

With a tailor made trip through Argentina and/or Chile we can offer 10% discounts on public prices for Antarctica cruises with zodiac landings and wildlife watching. Feel free to plan a chat with us with Whatsapp.

dayInfo.description: Arrival in the cosmopolitan city of Buenos Aires and transfer to hotel. Many hotel options, hotel Centuria, Loi Suites Arenales, Byblos Palermo Soho.

We´ll take you out trough the city by car, discovering the inside scoops of the city. A mix between the hot spots, and the hide corners with a local taste. In 4hs you´ll have a great panoramic view about Buenos Aires, providing you great new info to continue your journey as an Insider. With 3 stops in different areas (Usually San Telmo, Palermo, and Recoleta neighborhoods but is flexible to choose other areas) to walk around, and show and tell you about our culture, art and local ways. You´ll have snacks and beverages for the road, on board a comfortable car.

Optional 1: Enjoy a tango lesson and then explore Argentine tango in its natural setting: The Milonga. Optional 2: private day tour to “La Bamba de Areco”, a typical “Estancia” in San Antonio de Areco, a picturesque town in the outskirts of Buenos Aires (approx. 1.30hrs away from town). Enjoy exclusive activities at the place: horse or carriage ride (to get to know the authentic landscape of the “Argentine Pampas”), watch a polo practice, relax at the swimming pool, visit the town and see the unique silver pieces local artisans create. You can stay overnight if you are interested in getting the whole experience.
Flight to Posadas. Pickup at Posadas Airport and transfer to Estancia at Esteros Del Iberá. Due to its mild climate and isolation, the marsh is an area where wild animals are still the stars.

Free time to relax and enjoy the place and its activities. Activities included: two lake tours to appreciate unspoiled nature (landscapes, biodiversity, birds), one walking tour, one night walking tour, a two hour horseback ride or Sulky-ride. Overnight in Iberá estancia.
After breakfast, land transfer to Iguazú (aprox. 7hrs drive). Upon arrival, transfer to the hotel La Cantera Lodge or El Pueblito Iguazu.

After breakfast you will embark in an adventure in the Argentinean side of the falls visiting the Iguazú National Park is named after the river that marks its northern boundary. There, in the midst of a lush sub-tropical jungle, is majestic Iguazu Falls, one of the planet’s largest and most spectacular on account of the river’s powerful flow and its more than 275 drops. You will venture into the midst of its drops and falls, following a pathway of raised footbridges. At the top circuit, you will stop at different lookouts, climbing until you reach the incredible “Garganta del Diablo”, Devil’s Throat, undoubtedly the most spectacular of all the falls, whose waters drop more than 80 meters. Also Included: Great Boat - River Adventure (12 minutes) – departing from the docks at the end of the lower circuit a powerful speed boat will take you into the lower canyon of the Iguazu River and to circle the island until you reach the base of Tres Mosqueteros Drop, where you will be able to see drops on both the Brazilian and Argentine side, as well as the Garganta del Diablo. Return via the falls and Atlantic rainforest jeep safari to your hotel.

Visit the Brazilian side of the Iguazu waterfalls. This tropical rainforest attraction is located on the far western side of the Parana River, in Iguazu National Park, an UNESCO World Natural Free time to wander and walk through the balconies and enjoy beautiful views of the waterfalls. Overnight in Iguazú.
Flight to Puerto Madryn via Buenos Aires. Meet at Trelew airport and regular transfer to the hotel Dazzler, Terrazas de Madryn. Overnight in Puerto Madryn.

Southern Right Whale Watching Tour (2 hours aprox), Peninsula de Valdes land tour including: Group tour through the different Sea Lions and Sea Elephants colonies in Punta Norte and Caleta Valdés. Group Orca watching in Punta Norte (not guaranteed). Visit colonies of Magellan Penguins (September to March). Overnight in Puerto Madryn.
Free day at leisure for other activities. Overnight in Puerto Madryn.

Flight Trelew-Buenos Aires/Buenos Aires-Calafate Pickup at Calafate airport and transfer to the hotel. Free time to wander and explore Calafate town. Overnight in Calafate Parque hotel, Vientos del Sur.

Visit Perito Moreno Glacier in Los Glaciares National Park with short boat trip. Optional 1: Glacier Mini Trekking. The two hours circuit that follows introduces you to the fascinating landscape of the glaciers: streams, small lagoons, gullies, cravasses and plenty of ice formations of the most incredible blues. The trekking is moderate. The ice surface over which you walk is irregular, but firm and safe. You will receive explanations about flora, fauna and general glaciology of the region. Optional 2: “Rios de Hielo boat trip” – The excursion is a half day tour around the spegazzini glaciar. Optional 3: Full day excursion to Upsala Glacier, Estancia Cristina, 4x4 Upsala Viewpoint and Museum. Navigate for three hours among icebergs and stunning scenery overlooking the western front of the Upsala glacier and then through Cristina Canal to the point of disembark at the Estancia for 6 hours. Enjoy a guided visit to the Costumbrista Museum (old shearing shed). Then Ascentin all-terrain vehicles, travelling 9.5 km through mountainous roads and arrive to the Continental ice shelter and enjoy a 30 minute walk. Then visit the oriental front of Upsala Glacier. Lake Guillermo, Southern Patagonian Ice and Andes. Return to the farm house of the Estancia navigate back. Overnight in El Calafate.
Free day at leisure. Overnight at Calafate.

Road transfer from El Calafate to El Chalten (212 kms - 3 hours). This road borders Lake Argentino first and Lake Viedma later, up to the spot where the eyes meet the vastness and grandeur of Mount Fitz Roy, on whose base lies El Chalten. Considered the Argentinian capital of hiking. Visitors to this site will discover that in addition to mountaineering, the local nature hides real fishing sanctuaries, nice sites to go hiking or just be delighted with the almost untouched beauty of this Andes scenery. Hotel Destino Sur , Hotel Poincenot.

Free day at leisure. Enjoy self-guided treks or guided excursions of your choice. There are many hikes setting off from El Chalten, those which run through well signed trails inside the National Park as well as in private areas. According to your physical condition and available time -and of course depending on the unpredictable Patagonian weather- it is possible to undertake from short hikes up to ascents or embark on expeditions for several days. ??
Free day for walking, hiking, ice climbing course.
Flight Calafate-Ushuaia. Free afternoon at leisure. Overnight in Ushuaia Hotel Las Lenga, Hosteria Linares, Tierra del Fuego.

Cruise from Ushuaia to the strait's penguin rookery at Estancia Harberton, and visit the homestead and Akatushun research museum. For wonderful views of the channel, ride the chairlift to the Martial Glacier for panoramic vistas over Ushuaia and the islands. Short two-hour cruises pass islands inhabited by fur seals and the channel’s remote lighthouse. Overnight in Ushuaia. Optional: Pack a picnic and visit the Tierra del Fuego National Park for a day in the great outdoors, following remote walking trails past beaches, bays and forested valleys. Join a tour to go trekking and canoeing along the Lapataia River and Lake Roca.
Flight Ushuaia-Buenos Aires. Transfer to international airport to board flight back home.

tourName: Argentina nature and culture holiday
generalInfo:
Buenos Aires, Iguazu Falls, Puerto Madryn, Peninsula Valdes, Punta Tombo, Calafate, Ushuaia & Tierra del Fuego.

Description: This 14 day package enables you to experience all the natural wonders & wildlife of Argentina. After enjoying the 'Paris of South America' - Buenos Aires, you will have your breath taken away by the spectacular Iguazu Falls from where you will be taken to Puerto Madryn, where you will visit the Punta Tombo Penguin Colony and the wild Valdes Peninsula, home to wildlife such as the Southern Right Whale, sea lions, sea elephants and the mighty Orca. We then discover the sheer-sided peak of Mount Fitzroy and the immense Perito Moreno Glacier, where chunks of ice are often seen cracking into the water. Finally to Ushuaia, the southern most city of the world where you will get to walk with native Magellanic penguins and discover Tierra Del Fuego National Park.

dayInfo.description: Buenos Aires: Welcome to Buenos Aires. Met by Trip Planner at airport and transfer to hotel. One of Argentina’s top attractions is the leviathan metropolis of Buenos Aires, the most fascinating of all South American capitals. It’s a riveting place just to wander about, people-watching, shopping or simply soaking up the unique atmosphere. Its many barrios (neighborhoods) are startlingly different – some are decadently old-fashioned, others daringly modern – but all of them ooze character. Buenos Aires has got everything: night-life, tango, culture, football, excellent beef and the best local wines. Argentine Dinner Party Experience www.theargentineexperience.com You will take part in the Argentina Dinner Experience this evening . This unique dinner party's concept is to teach you the fundamentals of what being an Argentine is all about, whilst simply having more fun than is available anywhere else. Learn how to close your own empanada using the 'repulge' technique, to order steak your way in Spanish, to prepare your own 'mate' drink. During the experience you get to take part in the ritual of preparing an Argentina Asado with the best of Argentina beef whilst sampling the best of Argentine wines. This is a group experience and is a lot of fun and great way to meet fellow travelers.

Private City Tour. The city tour would be a mixture of driving and walking and would take in all the major sights of Buenos Aires. From the Flor Generica And the Rose gardens we would make our way to the park of memory . This park is dedicated to the 30,000 Argentines who disappeared during the dictatorship between the years 1976 to 1983. We would then visit Recoleta and the final resting place of EVA (Evita) Peron. This would be followed by the plaza San Martin and the Plaza de Mayo. This plaza has a rich history and the mothers of the plaza de Mayo still march their every Thursday holding the pictures of their disappeared youngsters and wearing their iconic headscarves. This is also the sight of the Casa Rosada where Evita made her famous balcony speech. From there we would move on to take in San Telmo and la Boca with the famous Caminito. We would move on then to the Theatro Colon and the 9th of July Avenue which at 18 lanes wide is the worlds largest and quite a sight to be hold. Los Angelitos Dinner Show. Buenos Aires is the world capital of Tango and Los Angelitos experiences the nostalgic mood with intensity through dance, music, clothing and poetry. Lively and ethereal, El Cabaret is the vibrant dance of this award winning show. A dazzling live orchestra, great dancers, traditional Argentine cuisine, and a fine selection of local wines and cocktails, make it a must see production. Includes pick and transfer to and from show.

Iguazu Falls: Transfer from hotel to airport to catch flight. Transfer from airport to hotel. Having recently been listed as one of the new 7 Wonders of Nature, Iguazu Falls is one of the most breathtaking sites to behold. With countless waterfalls surrounded by the tropical jungle of Argentina, Paraguay and Brazil, ones breath will be taken away by your proximity to nature. The vast majority of the Iguazu Falls lie on the Argentine side of the border, within the National Park Iguazu. This side offers the most extensive experience of the Falls thanks to its extensive system of trails and walkways that enable you to go both below and under the falls – most notably the Devils Throat. The surrounding forest also offers excellent opportunities to discover the regions wildlife.

Argentine Falls Tour. Today you will enjoy a full day tour of the Argentine side of the Iguazu Falls. During the tour you will get ‘up, close and intimate’ with views of this unforgettable section of the Iguazu River. Our guide will show you the hidden gems of this unique National Park in the lower and upper walkways and will take you off the beaten path to show you the best views. You are welcome to wonder off on your own whilst in the National Park. Trails through the 210 square mile reserve provide visitors with various views of the Falls, especially the largest one, Devil's Throat. The mist over the Devil's Throat is such that endless rainbows are formed. Expect to get wet today and fell exhilarated with the spray and close contact with the sheer power of the falls. The ecological train ride is included in the tour. So too is the Jet boat ride under the falls. Return to hotel early evening.

Puerto Madryn: Transfer from hotel to airport to take flight. Transfer from airport to hotel. In 1865, Puerto Madryn was the site of the first Welsh landing in the area. Their legacy remains today: Welsh-speakers, tearooms and Eisteddfods add a distinctive cultural flavor to the region. Another attraction is the noisy colony of Magellanic penguins at Punta Tombo, where chicks appear from November and take to the water from January. This wild and treeless tag of land, loosely linked to the mainland and reaching out into the South Atlantic, is a UNESCO-registered nature reserve that is home to a large variety of wildlife. Whales, penguins and elephant seals make up part of the profusion of marine life, whilst guanacos, rheas and armadillos roam around on the land. Southern right whales can be spotted during their breeding season of June to December, killer whales can be spotted from November through to April, and August to October is the best time to observe the elephant seals.

Peninsula Valdes Tour. Driver to Valdes Peninsula, a UNESCO World Heritage site. You will arrive at Isthmus Carlos Ameghino from where it is possible to see at the same time Nuevo and San Jose Gulfs, visit the Interpretation Centre and see the Birds’ Island. This is a small island connected to the continent during low tides where visitors are not allowed. A wide variety of birds arrive during their breeding season: seagulls, flamingos, herons, cormorants, ducks and penguins among others. Continue to Caleta Valdes where there is an important settlement of Southern Elephant seals. Further along you will arrive at Caleta Valdes, a large natural creek that is home to a colony of sea elephants. After admiring Caleta Valdes you'll continue along the road as it drops suddenly down into a crescent of golden cliffs overlooking a bright blue bay and the small village of Puerto Piramides. Here herds of southern right whales tend to arrive in June. You can take a boat trip around the Golfo Nuevo bay and watch these immense creatures gliding past. The peninsula navigation allows you to get unusually close to the whales. You will even get wet if they jump! While the whales may be seen from late June to mid-December, the sea elephants and sea lions are permanent residents. Following your tour, you will return to your hotel in Puerto Madryn.

Penguins in Punta Tombo tour. Drive to Punta Tombo which is located on the Atlantic Ocean coast, 150 km from Puerto Madryn. During the warm months (September to April) Punta Tombo reserve is home to the world's largest colony of Magellanic penguins. Spending much of their lives in the water, these penguins return yearly to the Patagonian coast to court, breed, and raise their young. Approximately half of the colonies of penguins that nest at Punta Tombo burrow underground. Males arrive prior to the females, preparing and settling into their old nests. When the females arrive, they search out their lifelong mate through a series of calls and a chorus of answers. After an elaborate courtship, the female will lay one egg and both male and female will share the two-month incubation. Once the baby penguin, or chick, hatches, the parents will forage for food, feeding the chick by regurgitation until it can fend for itself. After the chicks learn to swim, the family will return to the ocean and migrate north to southern Brazil. Some Magellanic penguins may migrate 3000 miles round-trip between Brazil and Patagonia. When the immature penguins return to Punta Tombo the following year, they will molt their feathers, and breeding will once again resume. Besides penguins it is also possible to see many other kinds of birds in the area. Driving back to Puerto Madryn, the tour stops at Gaiman, one of the oldest Welsh colonies in the area, where it is possible to taste an excellent tea with homemade cakes.

El Calafate: Transfer from hotel to airport to take flight. Transfer from airport to hotel. In the heart of Patagonia, next to the Andes, is one of Argentina’s most scenic areas, commonly referred to as Lago Argentino and the Perito Moreno Glacier, declared “Universal Heritage” by the UNESCO. The most renown of all the glaciers is the Perito Moreno Glacier. Situated 80 km (50 miles) from El Calafate, it is the most easily reached among them. This is an imposing ice river that descends from the Southern Patagonian Ice Cap down to the lake, at ‘Canal de los Témpanos’ (Icebergs’ Channel). It is the only glacier in the area which is considered to be in equilibrium, that is: not receding. It has always been the most important attraction of the region thanks to its spectacular beauty, but especially because of its unusual behavior. The glacier slowly advances down the mountain slope towards the lake, producing, as it spills down, thunderous noises and ruptures. Recommend visiting Laguna Nimez reserve, a short walk from the town center. This ecological environment lodges an educational circuit with trails and signposts laid up along over 2,500 meters. The guides await visitors at the entrance gate to assist them with the interpretation of the natural environment. Likewise, a complete herbarium that helps visitors identify the local plants is located in the entrance area. The reserve has good vantage points that enable visitors to watch how the flamingoes, geese, silvery grebes, black-necked swans, ibis, lapwings, ducks, coots, hawks and chimangos, among other 70 species, fed in the clump of rushes.

Hiking Perito Moreno Glacier. Hike El Perito Moreno Glacier on this full-day tour from El Cafate. This trip is a must-do for thrill-seekers and adventure travelers. This 11-hour expedition includes pickup and drop-off at your hotel in El Calafate, a boat ride from Bajo de las Sombras port as well as all the necessary glacier-hiking equipment like crampons and ice axes. A professional local guide ensures your safety and enjoyment. After being met at your El Calafate hotel, you'll be transferred to Bajo de las Sombras (Under the Shadows) port for your 20-minute sail to the glacier. Once you arrive at Perito Moreno Glacier, your expert guides will instruct you on the proper use of special winter hiking equipment, including crampons and ice axes. Wear appropriate gear such as wool socks, trekking boots, and cold weather clothing. Once you're all geared up, make your way along Rico Arm towards the glacier itself. During the 90-minute trek across Perito Moreno, your local guide will tell your group about the history and formation of the glacier. Surrounded by an otherworldly, white-on-white landscape, listen to the sound of your crampons crunching ice and feel the steam of your own breath. Once you reach the end of the walk, you'll stop and eat the lunch that you've brought along with you. Head back across the Rico Arm and over a footbridge that allows you one last parting view of the hulking glacier you just conquered. After a brief forest trek, you'll be picked up by bus and deposited at the glacier's most spectacular overlook, where spend an hour of free time to relaxing, enjoying the scenery and snapping some photos before heading back to your El Calafate hotel.

Full Day Upsala Glacier Tour. Experience the remote beauty of Patagonia’s Estancia Cristina and Upsala Glacier on a journey of discovery from El Calafate. Sail past icebergs across Lago Argentino and tour the historic Estancia Cristina ranch. In the afternoon, choose between a short and easy trek to a beautiful waterfall or an off-road tour to the beautiful Upsala Glacier. Our Patagonian adventure begins with pickup from your hotel in El Calafate. Relax on the 28-mile (45-kilometer) journey to the port at Punta Bandera, where your three-hour boat cruise departs. Enjoy croissants and hot drinks served on board the comfortable boat as you glide among icebergs, past the stunning scenery of snow-covered peaks. Sail to the western front of the Upsala Glacier, then cruise along Cristina Channel to Estancia Christina. Disembark at the historic estancia, and learn the history of the sheep and cattle ranch on a visit to the museum and old shearing shed. Enjoy a snack break before continuing your tour of the estancia. Take a short-guided walk up to Caterina River to visit the estancia’s chapel and other historic buildings. After lunch, take an off-road trip for fantastic views of the Upsala Glacier, or an easy trek to see the beautiful waterfall of Los Perros. The three-hour off-road trip takes you along a scenic mountain trail, following a route of great geological interest, until quite recently covered by glaciers. Reaching a mountain refuge, take a 20-minute walk over terrain eroded by glaciers to reach the Upsala Glacier. From here you can see amazing views of Lake William, the Patagonian ice field and the Andes mountains. If you choose the walk to the cascading waters of Los Perros waterfall, the two-hour trek takes you through beautiful woodlands for lofty views of Caterina River and the estancia below.

Ushuaia: Transfer from hotel to airport. Transfer from airport to hotel. Reluctantly shared by both Argentina and Chile, this ”land of fire” really is the end of the world. Its faraway location has drawn explorers since the days of Magellan and Darwin, and this tradition continues with today’s travelers. A triangular archipelago surrounded by the stormy South Atlantic and the Strait of Magellan, Tierra del Fuego offers plenty of natural beauty: scenic glaciers, lush forests, astounding mountains, clear waterways and a dramatic sea coast. The region’s largest city, Ushuaia, is also the ‘southernmost city in the world’ – a major draw for list-tickers – but has also become the main gateway to wondrous Antarctica. Tierra del Fuego is isolated and hard to reach, but for true adventure-seekers in Argentina it’s a must. After settling into your hotel, we recommend that you visit the End of the World Prison Museum in the afternoon.

Beagle Canal & Penguins. Sail the Beagle Channel aboard a comfortable catamaran on this full-day exploration of the waters of Tierra del Fuego. Leaving from Ushaia, visit several islands in the channel to view the native plant and animal life, including sea lions and penguins, before spending time at the oldest ranch in the region, Estancia Haberton. Once you board your sturdy, comfortable sailing vessel, leave the urban bustle of Ushuaia behind and head through the Beagle Channel, which boasts another kind of din: the barking of sea lions and the squawking of penguins. On this full-day sailing trip led by expert guides, meander through the islands of the Alicia Archipelago and come face to face with the area's prolific bird life, including steamer ducks, scua gulls, cormorants and black browed albatross. Visit Seal Island in the Les Eclaireurs Archipelago, home to two species of vocal, playful sea lions, before taking a peek at the Les Eclaireurs Lighthouse. Cruise between Chile and Argentina, visiting Williams Port and Port Almanza. Entering McKinley Pass, you'll head straight for Martillo Island and a large colony of native Magellanic penguins. The last stretch of your sailing adventure takes you to Estancia Haberton, a historical settlement that has been functioning since the 1800s. After a short walking tour, board the bus that will take you back to Ushuaia and return to hotel.

Tierra del Fuego National Park. Discover Tierra del Fuego National Park and its spectacular scenery on this half-day excursion from Ushuaia. The world's southernmost national park features glaciers, lakes, mountains and abundant wildlife. Explore by Tierra del Fuego by vehicle or upgrade to include a ride on the End of the World Train. Tierra del Fuego half-day tour from Ushuaia. Enjoy breath-taking Patagonian scenery Explore the park via train or by vehicle. Complimentary hotel pickup and drop-off After pickup from your hotel in Ushuaia, travel to Tierra del Fuego National Park, watching the scenery change as you pass the urban outskirts. Pass beautiful bodies of Patagonian water and soon come upon the majestic Mt. Susana. The old prison, now the site of the End of the World Train, marks the departure point for the vehicle or train option. End of the World Train :Board the train and enjoy the views as the railway takes you across peat bogs and bridges before making a stop at Macarena Waterfall Station where you learn about the region's indigenous people, the Yamana. Climb to a scenic viewpoint, then continue your sightseeing train journey through the park, ending up at the old sawmill. Continue your excursion towards glimmering Ensenada Bay, where you see the rocky Redonda and Estorbo Islands, as well as the majestic, snowy Sampaio Mountains. At Roca Lake, meander along the gushing Lapataia River towards Condor Hill, then stop at the otherworldly Green and Black Lagoons. After your adventure has finished, you'll be dropped back at your hotel in Ushuaia.
