Departure: Transfer from hotel to airport to take flight to Buenos Aires and connecting flight home.

tourName: Argentina north to south holiday, 15 days
generalInfo:
Have just 15 days for your next great adventure? Two weeks is the perfect amount of time to experience Argentina from top to bottom. 

Discover Buenos Aires with a local guide, visit the iconic Perito Moreno Glacier and Ushuaia National Park in Patagonia

Explore the breathtaking Iguazú Falls, and immerse yourself in Mendoza, the heart of Argentina's Malbec wine region.

Best time to travel: October to April.

This 15-day journey takes you through the highlights of Argentina. Savor a tango show and indulge in delicious Argentine cuisine in Buenos Aires, then fly to Patagonia to cruise the Beagle Channel in Ushuaia. Conclude your adventure with wine tasting in Mendoza and a boat ride beneath the stunning Iguazú Falls.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Argentina! - Transfer from Airport to Hotel Upon your arrival, you’ll be transferred to your hotel, with the rest of the day free for you to enjoy at your leisure. Buenos Aires is a vibrant, fast-paced cosmopolitan city, brimming with color and diverse architecture. As Argentina’s capital, it’s often called the Paris of South America, and it proudly embraces this title while showcasing its own rich culture. Argentines are known for their warmth and hospitality, so don’t be surprised if someone approaches you while you’re walking with a map to offer directions. This welcoming spirit is part of what makes the city special! On your first day, take the opportunity to explore the charming cobblestone streets lined with outdoor cafés. Savor the irresistible aroma of freshly grilled Argentine beef on a traditional parrilla (barbecue), and browse through local antique and artisan markets, perfect for finding unique souvenirs at great prices. For a deeper dive into the Argentine spirit, be sure to visit Palermo Soho, where you can shop for stylish leather jackets and handbags from local designers.

Time to Explore the City! - Half-Day Buenos Aires City Tour We will begin our half-day city tour in the vibrant heart of Buenos Aires, with convenient pick-up from the stylish Palermo Soho district. This immersive journey offers a direct introduction to the essence of the city. Our first stop is Plaza de Mayo, a historic landmark surrounded by iconic sights such as Casa Rosada (the Government House), the stunning Metropolitan Cathedral, and the Cabildo, a symbol of Argentina's colonial past. At the opposite end of Avenida de Mayo stands the impressive Congress building, reflecting Argentina’s rich political history. Next, we head south to the bustling San Telmo Market, where the city’s vibrant energy comes to life. From there, we explore La Boca, the birthplace of Tango, a colorful and cultural hub. On Caminito Street, you’ll encounter talented artists showcasing their captivating Tango-inspired works. We continue with a quick stop in Puerto Madero, a revitalized former port district now home to sleek, modern architecture. The contrast between Buenos Aires’ traditional and contemporary landscapes is striking. Our journey then leads us to Palermo, a neighborhood filled with lush parks, including the historic City Zoo, the Botanical Garden, the Argentine Horsetrack, the National Polo Field, and the Planetarium. It’s where nature and leisure come together. To end our tour, we visit Recoleta, one of Buenos Aires’ most glamorous neighborhoods, known for its elegant charm and historical significance. We’ll also explore Recoleta Cemetery, where Eva Perón rests in peace. At the conclusion of the tour, we will transfer you back to your hotel. - Half-Day Dinner & Tango Show In the evening, we will pick you up from your hotel and take you to a legendary venue where you’ll discover one of Argentina’s most cherished traditions. Enjoy an unforgettable night out in Buenos Aires as you experience the passion of the Argentine tango. Tango is not just a dance; it’s a symbol of our immigrant roots, the creativity of local artists, the sensuality of Argentine women, and a way of expressing heartbreak through tragic yet eternal love stories. Tonight, you’ll witness a professional tango and music performance by a talented group of local artists, set in an elegant and captivating venue. The ambiance, attire, and dance steps will transport you back in time to experience the tango culture of 100 years ago. This remarkable performance will be paired with a delicious à la carte dinner, featuring Argentine and international cuisine. Drinks are included, so you can indulge in a glass of Malbec wine as you enjoy the show. At the end of the night, we will return you to your hotel, leaving you enchanted by the bohemian spirit of our beloved Buenos Aires.

Welcome to Southern Patagonia! - Transfer: Buenos Aires Hotel to International Airport Jorge Newbery At the scheduled time, you will be transferred from your hotel to Jorge Newbery Domestic Airport for your next flight. -Transfer: El Calafate Airport to El Calafate Hotel El Calafate is situated in the heart of the Patagonian steppe, a vast and rugged landscape offering breathtaking views. Located on the shores of Lago Argentino (Argentina’s largest lake), it is known as the gateway to the glaciers, particularly the world-famous Perito Moreno Glacier, one of the few glaciers in the world still advancing. Upon arrival at El Calafate, you will be greeted at the airport and transferred to your hotel.

Walk Around Los Glaciares National Park! - Full Day Perito Moreno Glacier Tour We will pick you up from your hotel early in the morning for a journey to Los Glaciares National Park, located 50 miles from El Calafate. Home to the breathtaking Perito Moreno Glacier, this park has been a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1981, renowned for its almost 200 glaciers. The Patagonian ice field, occupying half of the park, is the second largest in the world after Antarctica. Upon arrival at the park, your guide will take you to the various walkways where you can get an up-close view of the colossal ice wall. If you're lucky, you might witness a landslide – when huge blocks of ice break off and fall into the water, it’s a natural spectacle that stuns all who see it. The sound of the ice cracking and falling is unlike any other, as it halts everything in its surroundings. Your adventure begins from the main balcony, with free time to explore the walkways at your own pace until the designated meeting time with your guide. For lunch, the park offers a service area with a restaurant and snack bar (lunch is not included). For a different perspective of the glacier, you can opt for a 1-hour boat ride along the glacier's massive 240-foot high ice wall, navigating through floating icebergs. Please note, that this boat ride is not included but can be added on-site, subject to availability. After a full day of exploration, you'll be transferred back to your hotel. - Nautical Safari Tour Departing from the Bajo de las Sombras pier (6 km from the glacier’s walkways), this exciting cruise takes you across Lake Rico, passing between icebergs that have calved from the Perito Moreno Glacier. As you sail down the Icebergs Channel, the boat will get close to the glacier, offering a spectacular view of its immense ice wall, with the constant spectacle of falling ice. This hour-long excursion provides a unique perspective of the glacier, complementing the walkways tour with stunning views of the dynamic ice movements. It’s an ideal way to enhance your visit to Perito Moreno.

Free Day in El Calafate - Day at Leisure in El Calafate Today, enjoy a relaxing day at your own pace in El Calafate. You have the freedom to explore this charming town, visit local shops, or simply unwind and take in the stunning Patagonian landscape. Whether you choose to stroll along the shores of Lago Argentino or discover nearby attractions, the day is yours to enjoy as you please.

Half-Day Beagle Channel Navigation - Transfer El Calafate Hotel / El Calafate Airport At the designated time, you will be transferred from your hotel to El Calafate Airport, marking the end of your Patagonian adventure. - Transfer Ushuaia Airport / Ushuaia Hotel Welcome to Ushuaia, the southernmost city in the world! Nestled in a protected bay, Ushuaia is a small town with an intriguing history. Originally inhabited by the Yamanas, the town's name means "protected bay" in their language. It became part of Argentina in 1884 and later served as a penal colony, shaping its unique story. Upon arrival, you will be transferred to your hotel. Depending on your arrival time, feel free to explore the charming town or visit one of its many fascinating museums. The Thematic Gallery of the Historia Fueguina offers life-size figures that bring the history of Ushuaia to life, while the Prison Museum delves into the darker tales of the region's past. And don't miss the opportunity to savor local seafood, especially the delicious Blake Hake, a regional specialty. - Half-Day Beagle Channel Navigation In 1833, Charles Darwin sailed through the Beagle Channel, and today, it's your turn to discover its wonders! Known as Onashaga Channel by the native Onas, the Beagle Channel offers an unforgettable 3-hour boat trip. You will embark from the tourist pier in the center of Ushuaia, taking in panoramic views of the city, with the Martial Glacier looming in the background. As you sail through the channel, you'll spot diverse wildlife, including cormorants and fur seals on Alicia Island. With Argentina on your left and Chile on your right, you'll continue to the iconic Les Eclaireurs lighthouse, a historic sentinel of the bay. On the return journey, we will stop at Bridges Island for a short walk along an interpretive trail, learning about the native Yamans and the region's largest shell deposits. During the excursion, enjoy a warm cup of hot chocolate with cookies or try Mate, the beloved Argentine drink. After returning to port, make your own way back to your hotel.

Full Hike & Sailing Day - Full-Day Trekking & Canoeing in Tierra del Fuego National Park In the morning, we will pick you up from your hotel to embark on an adventure through the stunning Tierra del Fuego National Park, a place filled with incredible natural beauty. After a short drive of about 10 km, we will begin a 4-mile hike along a coastal path, winding through picturesque landscapes. As you walk, you’ll be immersed in nature, with panoramic views of the surrounding lakes, sea, and towering mountains. Following the hike, we’ll stop near the Lapataia River for a delicious and warming lunch, served with a breathtaking view inside a heated dome, offering a perfect spot to relax and enjoy the serene surroundings. Next, we’ll prepare you with the necessary gear, including rubber boots, coverpants, and lifejackets. The journey continues with an exciting canoe ride from Lake Acigami down the Lapataia River, floating on inflatable canoes (duckies). You’ll navigate through the river’s freshwater towards the sea, finally reaching Lapataia Bay, where the southernmost point of National Route Nº 3 meets the ocean. At the end of this unforgettable journey, you’ll be driven back to your hotel to relax after a day of adventure.

Welcome to Mendoza! - Transfer Ushuaia Hotel / Ushuaia Airport At the appropriate time, you will be transferred from your hotel to Ushuaia Airport to catch your flight. - Transfer Mendoza Airport / Chacras de Coria Mendoza, Argentina’s renowned wine region and the birthplace of Malbec, is not only famous for its vineyards but also for its stunning landscapes. From the towering peaks of Aconcagua—the highest mountain in the Americas—to exciting outdoor activities like rafting, Mendoza offers a wealth of natural beauty and adventure. Upon arrival at Mendoza Airport, you will be transferred to your hotel in the charming Chacras de Coria area, where you can begin your exploration of this incredible region.

Wine Tasting Tour - Half-Day Wine Tour In the morning, we will pick you up for an unforgettable journey through Argentina's renowned Wine Road, where you’ll visit some of the region’s most highly acclaimed wineries. Accompanied by expert guides, you will learn about the winemaking process, the different wine styles, and the region's gastronomy while enjoying delightful wine tastings. You’ll have the chance to explore either Maipú or Luján de Cuyo, depending on the vineyards’ availability. Maipú is just 15 minutes from Mendoza city and is Argentina’s first viticultural region. It’s here that early European immigrants chose to continue their winemaking traditions. The perfect climate and soil conditions have made Maipú internationally recognized for its wines. Alongside vineyards, olive groves flourish, offering a wonderful opportunity to experience both Argentine wines and olive oils. Luján de Cuyo, also known as The Cradle of Malbec, is surrounded by rolling hills and offers breathtaking views of the highest mountains in the Americas. This area is home to exclusive accommodations, fine dining, spas, and some of the most prestigious wineries in the world. At the end of the tour, you will be transferred back to your hotel with a deeper appreciation for both the diverse wines and the stunning landscapes of Mendoza.

Continue Exploring Mendoza - Full-Day High Andes with Trekking to Durazno Gorge After breakfast, we will pick you up from your hotel in Chacras de Coria and depart for Aconcagua Provincial Park, located 185 km (115 miles) from Mendoza city. As we travel along the iconic Route 7, you will be treated to spectacular views of the surrounding mountains and rivers. Along the way, we will pass through charming villages such as Cacheuta, Potrerillos (with its scenic water reservoir), Uspallata (a picturesque town), and Penitentes (a ski resort). You’ll also have the opportunity to visit The Inca’s Bridge, a remarkable natural rock formation. As the journey progresses, we will traverse the three mountain ranges: the Pre Andes, the Front Range, and the Main Range. Upon arrival at Aconcagua Provincial Park, located in the Horcones Valley, you will embark on a 2-hour hike to Durazno Gorge. Alternatively, if you prefer a shorter option, there is a 45-minute trail leading to a scenic lookout. After taking in the awe-inspiring views of the Aconcagua Mountain, the tallest peak in the Americas, you will begin your journey back to your hotel in Chacras de Coria.

Welcome to Puerto Iguazú! - Transfer Chacras de Coria Hotel / Mendoza Airport At the appropriate time, you will be transferred from your hotel to Mendoza Airport for your departure. - Transfer Puerto Iguazú Airport / Hotel in Puerto Iguazú This small border town is the perfect gateway to visit the spectacular Iguazú Falls, one of the Seven Natural Wonders of the world and a UNESCO World Heritage site. Iguazú is a must-see destination for any traveler visiting Argentina. Upon arrival at Puerto Iguazú Airport, you will be met by our representative and transferred to your hotel. You will have the rest of the day to relax and enjoy the tropical climate and lush jungle setting that surrounds you.

Get Involved in the Iguazu National Park - Full-Day Iguazú Falls Argentine Side Today, we will pick you up from your hotel and take you to Iguazú National Park on the Argentine side. Surrounded by lush subtropical rainforest, the falls are nestled within a rich ecosystem, home to a diverse array of wildlife. Our guide will help you spot some of the unique species in the area, such as toucans, parrots, and coatis. The park offers an extensive network of lower and upper walkways that wind around the falls, providing intimate views and allowing you to feel the full power of this natural wonder from various perspectives. The Argentine side of Iguazú is known for its many trails, each offering a distinct vantage point of the cascading waterfalls. One of the highlights of the tour is a visit to Devil's Throat, the largest and most awe-inspiring of the falls. To reach this breathtaking viewpoint, you'll take the ecological train and walk along the boardwalks that bring you up close to the roaring waters. (Please note: visits to the Devil's Throat are temporarily suspended for maintenance.) After exploring the falls, you’ll have some free time to relax and enjoy lunch amidst this stunning natural setting. This 7-hour excursion offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to fully immerse yourself in the beauty and power of Iguazú Falls. Highly recommended for nature lovers!

Brazilian Side - Half-Day Iguazú Falls Brazilian side Today, we will pick you up from your hotel and take you to Foz do Iguazú National Park on the Brazilian side. Remember to bring your passport! While Argentina holds 80% of the falls, Brazil offers the most breathtaking panoramic view of this natural wonder. On the Argentine side, you’re immersed within the falls, but only from the Brazilian side can you truly grasp the vastness and beauty of Iguazú Falls. Upon entering the park, you will board a bus with a guide who will take you on a scenic journey to the falls. Take your time to explore the walkways, feel the refreshing spray of the falls, and be awed by the beauty surrounding you. Stroll across the boardwalks above Salto Santa María, a thrilling experience that feels like walking on water! You’ll also have the opportunity to get up close to Devil’s Throat, where you can witness the immense power of the water. At the end of the tour, the bus will take you back to the park entrance, where you will be driven back to your hotel.

Return to Buenos Aires - Transfer Hotel Puerto Iguazú / Puerto Iguazú Airport At the scheduled time, you will be transferred from your hotel to Puerto Iguazú Airport for your departure. -Transfer International Airport Jorge Newbery (AEP) / Buenos Aires Hotel Upon arrival at Jorge Newbery International Airport, you will be greeted and transferred to your hotel in Buenos Aires.

End of your Argentina Holiday! - Transfer Buenos Aires Hotel / International Airport Ministro Pistarini (EZE) At the scheduled time, you will be transferred from your hotel to Ministro Pistarini International Airport for your departure. Safe travel and ¡Buen viaje!

tourName: Argentina tailor made holiday
generalInfo:
Northern Argentina offers fascinating sights to the visitor, with its varied and distinct native cultures set in their beautiful natural surroundings of Andean volcanoes, deserts, multi colored rock formations and green oases. We bring you in touch with its people, to learn their music, understand the regional variations, to fully enjoy the flavors of its Andean cuisine, discover incredible wineries hidden in the middle of imposing mountains. Northern Argentina is a hidden gem to be explored and experienced.

Here you find the soul of indigenous cultures mixed with Spanish influences. One of the highlights of Argentina is to travel through the Andes chain from Salta into the Atacama desert and saltflats of Uyunyi, it has immense nature of volcanoes combined with Andean cuisine, wine tasting, boutique spa’s, for those who love adventure and luxury travel. We offer selfdrive itineries & guided trips for groups through Argentina and like to show you the possibility, for those who have the budget, to travel with a private guide - driver. This can be for a special holiday, for a gourmet – culinary tour exploring the Nova Andina cuisine and wines, for a wellness holiday in the Andes, scouting for shooting locations, real estate, for making a film documentary. We form part of a professional audiovisual team and can help you further with all audiovisual equipment and take care of all logistics for a photo or film shooting in case this might have your interest as well. A traditional made yerba mate and a master class how to prepare your gourd with fire, charcoal and sugar will be part of the journey. Time for Vision Quest and Healing Arts can be incorporated. The trip can be fully tailor made according on your travel wishes. We offer Vip premium service.

In this itinery we show you an example of how to combine Salta as a starting and ending point together with the Valley of Calchaquies and a visit to San Pedro de Atacama in the driest mountain desert of the world in Chile.

After Salta we drive to Cafayate and Cachi in the Valley of Calchaquies with Indian villages, famous wine houses, abandoned haciendas, snow capped volcanoes, plains with giant cactuses & amazingly polychrome rock formations. From Cachi we return to Salta, continue to Purmamarca from where you can decide to cross the Andes to San Pedro de Atacama via the Lema pass. You return via another pass and the Toro canyon to Salta again. These are 2 circular itineries joined in an eight shaped loop with the great advantage that we pick and drop off our car at Salta. You can also start and pick up your car at Catamarca or La Rioja and travel from there over the famous N40 to Cafayate, Cachi and Salta and drop off the car finally at Salta, but the drop off costs are very high due to the large distances that are covered in Argentina, so this is not the best option.

The itinerary from Cafayate to Cachi goes mainly over dirt roads and can be accomplished without problems with a normal car in the dry season from April to December. In the wet season part of these roads are flooded by rivers and only accessible with a 4x4 pickup. The rest of the roads mentioned have access all year round for a normal car. Accessibility of the roads in the high Andes always need to be checked with local police stations during the rain season. These itineries can also be booked as selfdrive programs by us. For selfdrive programs it requires good Spanish language skills, experience with orientation using maps & GPS, and not to forget thorough driving experience.

Treks on horseback or on foot of 3-10 days, guided by authentic Gauchos can be added to your program, see the reviews for horseback trekkings in NW Argentina on this site. You travel through fascinating valleys & mountains with pre-Inca & Incaica sites, with remote haciendas, puma’s and condors, amazing pre-Inca petroglyps, you cross through an area where you can come only on foot or by horse, the postman and priest still travel that way.

We also offer guided private roundtrips at Mendoza & San Rafael, including gourmet cuisine, wine and olive tasting, boutique wineresorts, Aconcagua park, day and night visit to the observatory Leoncito, staying at boutique pousada La Querencia, Barreal (San Juan province), visit Caverna de Las Brujas, Laguna de Llancanelo and volcano national park la Payunia, visit to the observatory Pierre Auger at Malargue, Pozo de las Animas, Las Llenas - one of the best ski centers of Latin America and boutique spa Therma Cacheuta near Mendoza. More options are to cross the Andes and travel from Mendoza (or from San Juan as starting point to Valle Elqui - Selena in Chile) to Valparaiso at the Pacific Ocean or Santiago de Chile with your private guide-driver in 4-5 days.

Traveling with your own driver is one, traveling with a guide that has traveled and guided all over Latin America is another story tale. Your guide has a University degree, speaks fluent both English & Spanish, is a certified mountain leader, has guided more than 120 trips and is well trained in driving on difficult terrain also with 4x4 vehicles. The combination of thinking out of the box and the radiation of a guide with a mission can make this trip a real unforgettable experience. A guided trip can be one on one, it can be for a couple, family with kids or for a whole group. It can be a top luxury travel, we can also stay at guesthouses, that all depends on your travel wishes, we can even now and then camp if that would interest you. By making an enquiry through this page you get directly in contact with your guide. Feel free to Skype us or invite us for a call on a time that suits you. We have free calls to 60 countries worldwide among which free calls to the UK, USA, Canada, Australia and China.

Countries that we cover to guide at this moment are Argentina with the mid to northern range of the Andes, north Chile with the Atacama desert, Bolivia Altiplano & rainforest, Colombia from Caribbean, Pacific to the Andes, Cuba from West to East, Brasil from Rio de Janeiro, Pantanal, Amazon, Chapada de Diamantina to the Atlantic rainforest and beaches, the mystic South of Peru with Colca canyon, Cusco, Titicaca & Machu Picchu.

Buenos Aires tours are all tailor made according to your wishes, half day, full day or several days. We can offer special Urban art tours (street art, grafiifti tours) with specialized guides on Urban art, Argentinean life, history and politics. We also offer Gastronomy Culinary tours, Architecture tours mixed with Urban art or only focused on one aspect. Kayaking tours with walking in the Tigre delta and learning about life and ecosystems. Birdwatching tours. Besides all common City tours.

Some local festivals on the proposed itineries: a very enchanting festival of NW Argentina is the carnaval at Huamahuaca and San Pedro de Jujuy in February; at San Pedro de Atacama they celebrate Festival de San Pedro y San Pablo the last days of June, a blend of lively folk dancing, a thrilling rodeo, and processions that combine their Atacameño heritage into hispanic Catholic traditions, and the most important festival at Mendoza is the National Grape Harvest Festival (Vendimia) in the last days of February and first days of March.

We have more than 250 independent reviews on Responsible Travel on our destinations in Latin America from Cuba, Bolivia, Brasil, Peru, Colombia to Chile and Argentina. With a tailor made trip through Argentina and/or Chile we can offer 15-20% discounts on public prices for Antarctica cruises with zodiac landings and wildlife watching. Contact us for a chat via Whatsapp and ask for a tailor made itinery and quote.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Salta and private transfer to your boutique hotel, La Candela or Khala boutique. Free afternoon for strolling around, taste some empanadas and some wines, or a privately-guided walk introducing you to the most traditional corners of this city, nicknamed “Salta La Linda, the Beautiful.” You can end the evening with a combination of traditional plates made in a local's kitchen with a folkloric dance peña, or visit a gourmet restaurant in the city.

After breakfast, we leave Salta and head towards the picturesque Calchaquíes Valleys, crossing the agricultural Valley Lerma to enter the impressive lunar landscape of Las Conchas Gorge. We visit some impressive rock formations and at Cafayate we arrive at the exquisite hotel Killa, hotel Paris-Texas or Vinas de Cafayate. After check in, take some time to relax and check out the view from the surrounding grounds of the hotel or stroll through the lovely village.

Enjoy a traditional breakfast. Later, we have a trip through vineyards and a bodega to learn about local wine production and specific flavors and grapes indigenous to the region. Afterwards, enjoy a wine tasting in the wine cellar, with the Torrontes grape variety, characteristically smooth and fruity in flavor, or the Malbec-Cabernet blend with its remarkable body and rich taste. In the midday we have various options as brief walk or a longer hike in the middle of the incredible rock formations of the gorge to be able to really get amongst the landscape, with its warm colors and view of the Cafayate Valley and dunes, and/or visiting local artesans.

In the morning, we head towards Cachi driving through small colonial villages over the spectacular N40. When arriving at the Quebrada de las Fechas gorge, enjoy a walk through the multicolored rock formations. In Molinos, we visit a small farm and a center of weavers and their old looms. Finally we arrive at Seclantas, a small village from where we can enter the Colte to visit the craftsmen along the way, as they practice their ancestral techniques making ponchos and blankets. In the evening, we arrive in Cachi and lodge in the Hotel Cortijo or hotel of your choice. Optional: to have an extra stay in between, when we reach Angastaco we can take a secondary road that takes us to Colome in 40 kms after which we reach the luxury Colome Estancia.

Free day for visiting artisans and shopping, participating in local excursions to Cachi Adentro, horse riding, and/or visiting pre-Inca and Inca ruins exploring the surroundings and make some small walks.

In the morning we exit towards Salta, crossing the Los Cardones National Park and the Encantado Valley to arrive around noon at the city. Take a stroll in town and enjoy some free time during lunch before leaving for the Humahuaca Gorge, a World Heritage Site. We will pass numerous villages with typical Andean architecture until arriving finally at the small town of Purmamarca to check into the hotel of your choice, La Comarca, El Viejo Algorrobo, Marques de Tojo. Your evening is to enjoy the ambiance of boutique shops, bars and gourmet restaurants. Alternatives: stay in Salta for 1 or 2 extra nights at a hacienda, at finca Los Los, estancia de charme - House of Jasmines or similar estancia in the Salta Area to relax and/or for horse riding. For birdwatchers stay in San Lorenzo for an extra day birdwatching at the cloud mountain forest near Salta.

A long and fascinating travel to San Pedro de Atacama passing salt lakes with sometimes hundreds of flamingos, crossing the Jamo pass of 4600m altitude. Over the pass we descend again to the Atacama desert known as the driest place in the world with green oases and views on the Lascar and Licancabur volcanoes. Hotel of your choice at San Pedro for 4 nights, Explora hotel de Larache, Casa Solcor Boutique, Takha Takha, Katarpe up to hostels managed by local indigenous organizations.

After your long journey a full morning to relax and stroll through this desert village, visit the archaeological museum, in the afternoon a visit to the surroundings, salt formations, viewpoints and the dunes of the moonvalley for sunset over the Andes.

Early departure to the geysirs of Tatio to see the steam condensed in the cold air and the sunrise coming in through the impressive steamclouds creating a mystical ambiance. After the visit we drive another 1.5 hours crossing the mountain to the Atacama village Machuca from where we make a short walk to a colonial church just above the village and bofedales (wet pampa lands) where the alpacas and lamas stroll and graze. At the end of the day we visit the beautiful thermal bath complex of Puritama to enjoy this long day in small natural hot pools before returning late afternoon to San Pedro de Atacama.

In the morning we leave for Toconao, an oases village 40 km of San Pedro de Atacama. From here we continue to the Reserva Nacional de Los Flamencos at the salt plain of Salar de Atacama where we will see various flamengos and other birds. Back in Toconao, we may make a walk through the green oases into the canyon, surrounded by volcanic rock and desert like landscapes. We return in the afternoon back to San Pedro de Atacama to visit the ruin Quitor of the Atacameño culture with a view over the oasis of San Pedro and the salt plains and enjoy dinner in one of the lovely boutique restaurants.

Today we travel back to Argentina via a route passing the Miscanti en Miñiques volcanoes and heading to San Antonio de los Cobres where we will descend into the Cañon del Toro to Salta following the same trail as the Train of the Clouds (Tren de las Nubes). We stay overnight in Salta in a hotel of your choice.
Free morning to relax, in the midday or afternoon we leave to the Salta airport with a flight to Buenos Aires.

tourName: Argentina tour, Salta and Jujuy
generalInfo: On the Tour Salta and Jujuy – Best of the Northwest trip, you will quickly discover why Salta is known locally as, “La Linda” (The Beautiful). One of the best preserved colonial cities, Salta is the perfect base for your adventures in the northwest of Argentina. Tour the stunning Humahuaca Gorge and giant Salt Flats on the Safari to the Cloud adventure, and discover the local culture of the traditional Andean towns. And with nearby wineries, white water rafting and horse riding available, why not stay a few more days?!

dayInfo.description: Salta: One of traveler's favorite cities, Salta offers outstanding museums, colonial arquitecture, alive cafés in the main plaza (great people watching spot) and the vibrant and authentic peñas, places where locals grab a table to watch their favorite folkloric singers and after a wine (or two) everyone join for dancing. The perfect base to explore the Argentinan north.

Salta / Excursion Salt Flats and Humahuaca Gorge: Today you will leave Salta in a two- day excursion (shared service). For this exploration we recommend to leave your luggage in your hotel in Salta, and just to take a day pack on the excursion. Early in the morning we will travel along the same route as the famous Train to the Clouds, zigzagging on lonely roads between the blue sky and the high desert plains. On our way, we will visit historic ruins, scattered houses, small villages and amazing landscapes.

Humahuaca Gorge, Salta & Jujuy: Today you will depart at the indicated time (shared service), for a tour along the Humahuaca Gorge, declared a UNESCO Heritage Site. You will visit places such as Maimará, "Paleta del Pintor" (it's a photo stop on the road) , Tilcara, and it´s famous " Pucará de Tilcara", Trópico de Capricornio, Uquía (Pinturas Cuzqueñas) and finally, the small town of Humahuaca before returning to Salta in the evening.

Salta: Today you will have the opportunity to relax at your own pace. You can explore by foot the Colonial Area (some of the highlights are the Cathedral, the Franciscan church and the San Bernardo convent), visit the world famous museum (MAAM) where they exhibit a few mummies they rescued from the hight Andes or just sit in one the many live cafés in the main square. We highly recommend to visit a Peña and mix with the locals eating empanadas and dancing Folklore.

Salta: At appropriate time, you will be transferred to the airport or bus terminal (shared service). Today, you can choose to extent your travels purchasing any of our available offers in Buenos Aires, Iguazu Falls or the rest of the Andes area.

tourName: Argentina tours & honeymoons
generalInfo:
The North of Argentina is the most fascinating area of Argentina concerning variety of ecosystems, landscapes & culture. Here you find the soul of indigenous cultures mixed with Spanish influences & the magnificent Andes.

You stay in typical atmospheric hotels combined with special Argentinean estancias and the best pousada & hotel available at the Ibera marshes & Iguazu waterfalls.

This journey starts with an original hotel in Buenos Aires, a fusion of cultural influences from a trendy metropolis and Italian cuisine, to native Indian roots with lively handicraft markets. From grand avenues, boutique shops, excellent shopping and nightlife to subtropical trees & climate.

You continue your travel to a lovely posada in the Iberas marshes, with 2 days for wildlife watching, and a visit and stay on both the Argentinean & Brazilian sides of the Iguazu waterfalls, the largest waterfalls of the world, including nature excursions in the tropical Brazilian forest. From here you travel back to Buenos Aires to La Rioja situated at the feet of the Andes. You pick up your rental car and in a magnificent journey through the Andes you visit several national parks & archaeological sites, from Ischigualasto, where the oldest dinosaurs are found, to the Moonvalley of Talampayo with amazing rock formations, to the Parque de los Menhires, an archaeological menhir puzzle and a pre-Inca native settlement in Quilmes.

You continue through the Valley of Calchaquies from Cafayate to Cachi with Indian villages, famous wine houses, abandoned haciendas, plains with huge cactuses & amazingly shaped rock formations. A valley to get inspired by the present & history. After the Calchaquies valley you have a free day in a luxury estancia House of Jasmines near the city of Salta. From here you continue to the Altiplano of 4000 meters high with the typical puna vegetation, and the largest salt plains of Argentina, after which you descend into the colourful canyon landscapes of Purmamarca & Humahuaca canyon. You can visit the pre-Inca ruins of Tilcara or go on shopping handicrafts on a free day and participate in a special lama trekking the following day, to experience how the people traveled in the earlier days, before the Spaniards introduced the horse & mule.

You follow in this self drive parts of the famous route 40, from Moonvalley, the wine fields of Cafayate to the Altiplano & the saltplains. It is a national, on some stretches unpaved route of undescribed beauty for the individual traveler. The route runs from Patagonia to the border of Bolivia. The itinerary in the dry season can be accomplished without problems with a normal car.

When you return to Salta again, you descend in altitude and cross through a wonderful & lush green mountain cloud forest, to complete your travel through the northwest.

Extensions: Unique trekking by horse from 3-10 days, guided by Argentinean Gauchos can be added to your program. You travel through fascinating valleys & mountains with pre-Inca & Incaica sites, where you can come only on foot or by horse. See more about horse riding and trekking in Argentina here.

Other options:
Tailor made selfdrive programs Valles Calchaquies, Salta, Tucuman, exploring the Andean landscapes & historical sites of Salta & Tucuman, with charming little & typical hotels, and/or excellent top accommodations at famous estancias Colomé, House of Jasmines, and Cafayate wine bodegas.

We also offer private guided roundtrips at Salta, Atacama desert, Uyunyi saltflats and Mendoza with driver-guide, including gourmet cuisine, wine and olive tasting, boutique wineresorts, Aconcagua park, day and night visit to the observatory Leoncito, staying at boutique pousada La Querencia, Barreal (San Juan province), visit Caverna de Las Brujas, Laguna de Llancanelo and volcano national park la Payunia, visit to the observatory Pierre Auger at Malargue, Pozo de las Animas, Las Llenas - one of the best ski centers of Latin America and boutique spa Therma Cacheuta near Mendoza. Extra option to cross the Andes and travel from Mendoza (or from San Juan as starting point to Valle Elqui - Selena in Chile) to Valparaiso at the Pacific Ocean or Santiago de Chile with your private guide-driver in 4-5 days.

Trekking on foot or by horse with Argentinean gauchos, trekkings on foot or by horse, guided by local gauchos. Starting from near Cachi, following rivers, canyons, crossing passes on high altitude, following old Inca trails and ending in the Toro canyon. Price includes guidance of gauchos on horse, transport of all luggage & food with mules, gaucho cook & meals, hay for horses, campment fees & 2 personal horses (incl. for free days).

Buenos Aires tours are all tailor made according to your wishes, half day, full day or several days. We can offer special Urban art tours (street art, grafiifti tours) with specialized guides on Urban art, Argentinean life, history and politics. We also offer Gastronomy Culinary tours, Architecture tours mixed with Urban art or only focused on one aspect. Kayaking tours with walking in the Tigre delta and learning about life and ecosystems. Birdwatching tours. Besides all common City tours.

With the booking of a tailormade holiday in Argentina, Brazil and/or Chile we can offer a discount of approx 10% on Antarctic cruises we work with. You only need to book quite in advance for Antarctic journeys.

dayInfo.description: Arrival Buenos Aires, transfer in to original & luxury hotel in quarter Palermo.
Day at leisure. Dinner and Tango Show at Esquina Carlos Gardel.
Flight to Posadas. Arrival and private transfer from the airport to the Posada Ypa Sapukai (Colonia Pellegrini - 200 km) in the middle of the Ibera marshes. Free afternoon in the Posada.
Full day boat trip & wildlife sightings. Second day guided walking excursion or horse back ride.

Private transfer to Posadas. Travel by bus from Posadas to Iguazú including full day regular excursion Minas de Wanda & San Ignacion Ruins with local guide. Accommodation in Iguazu at Hotel Sheraton, with Iguazu Falls view.
Excursion Argentinian side of the falls with local guide and great adventure navigation excursion in boat in the midday.

Private transfer from Argentina to Brazil. In morning time to for visit the best Latin American Bird Park and/or to book a helicopter flight. In midday private tropical forest excursion, walk, wildlife watching at oxbow lake & canoeing upstream the Iguazu falls. Accommodation in the best hotel of the falls: Las Cataratas in the middle of the Brasilian National Park.
Free relaxing day on Brazilian side. Hotel Cataratas.
Private transfer from the hotel to the Argentinean airport. Flight to Buenos Aires, transfer to luxury hotel in Palermo.
Domestic flight to Rioja. Pick up rental car, start Andes journey and drive to Valle Fertil.
Full day to visit the natural wonders & dinosaurs of NP Ischigualasto.
Visit NP Talampaya, Moonvalley and continue to Belen.
Drive to visit Parque de los Menhires & indigenous ruins of Quilmes
Drive to the wineyards of Cafayate. Time to visit several famous wine bodegas. Overnight in Hotel Killa.
Full day private excursion with local guide to visit pre-Inca petroglyps, the canyon Rio Colorado & midday walk in las Conchas.
Drive to the most beautiful indigenous village of Argentina, Cachi. Travel through Valles Calchaquies. Overnight in Hotel Cortijo. NB in the wet season from Jan-March you drive to Salta directly.
In morning private walk with local guide through valley Cachi Adentro, visit local people & historic sites. Free midday to visit Cachi & surroundings.
Drive to Salta. Overnight at top estancia House of Jasmines.
Free day to relax, ride horse on the estancia and/or visit Salta.
Drive to Toro canyon to San Antonio de los Cobres. Overnight at Hosteria Las Nubes.
Drive to Salinas Grandes over Altiplano, then to Tilcara over Purmamarca, overnight at La Comarca hotel.
Free cultural day to visit Tilcara & Humahuaca canyon, and make a walk with sunset through the colored hills of Purmamarca.
Lama trekking full day program with Caravana de Llamas.
Drive to Salta, drop off car. Flight out to Buenos Aires. Transfer in to luxury hotel in quarter Palermo.
Private transfer from the hotel to the airport Ezeiza.

tourName: Argentina, Uruguay & Brazil holiday
placesVisited: Argentina: Buenos Aires, Uruguay: Colonia, Estancia stay, Horse riding, Puerto Iguazu, Brazil: Foz do Iguacu, Iguazu Falls from both Brazilian and Argentinian sides, Rio de Janeiro
generalInfo:
This Argentina, Uruguay and Brazil holiday is a great value introduction to three of South America’s fascinating countries. This 10 day trip skirts the eastern coast of the continent, with time to enjoy two iconic cities – Buenos Aires and Rio de Janeiro – and a fascinating three night stay on a working estancia in the heart of Uruguay. You’ll also see one of South America’s natural wonders, the Iguazu Falls, exploring it from both the Argentinian and the Brazilian sides.

In Beunos Aires, an orientation walk will help you get your bearings, before soaking up the city’s mix of European and Latin influences. From here, it’s time to make like a gaucho on a working estancia in rural Uruguay. You can help out as little or as much as you like here, getting stuck in with daily farm work, working with livestock and riding horses, or simply relaxing and enjoying the very special Uruguayan hospitality. The next treat in store is the chance to explore the spectacular Igauzu Falls from both the Argentinian and Brazilian sides, before finishing this trip in unforgettable, charismatic Rio de Janeiro, where a huge range of optional activities that will help you discover this exciting metropolis.

You’ll travel by plane, local bus, ferry and an overnight bus, with a group of no more than 16 people.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires.
dayInfo.description: Bienvenido! Welcome to Buenos Aires. Your trip begins with an orientation walk around Buenos Aires’ Microcentro district at 1 pm – your leader will be waiting in the hotel lobby. Pass by historic buildings along the Avenida de Mayo, including the Casa Rosada (Argentina's government house), explore antique markets in the picturesque San Telmo area and perhaps have a coffee in the famous Cafe Tortoni. Make sure you're back at the hotel for your welcome meeting at 6 pm where you’ll prepare for the rest of your adventure.

dayInfo.title: Colonia del Sacramento.
dayInfo.description: The morning is free to explore Buenos Aires – just ask your leader if you need any recommendations. Later in the day, jump on a ferry to cross the Rio de la Plata (River Plate) to Colonia del Sacramento in Uruguay. When you arrive, enjoy some free time to get acquainted with one of the country’s oldest cities. The World Heritage-listed Barrio Historico (Old Quarter) is a great place to start. Listen to the noisy parakeets in the Plaza Mayor or comb Colonia’s small museums. For great views, climb to the top of the city’s 19th-century lighthouse that’s still in operation today.

dayInfo.title: Colonia del Sacramento / Estancia Stay.
dayInfo.description: Enjoy a free morning in Colonia De Sacramento. You could continue strolling around Barrio Historico or maybe check out the artisan stalls selling Swiss cheese – Colonia was also settled by Swiss immigrants and is home to a unique local Swiss cheese. In the afternoon, you’ll take a private transfer to an estancia near the city of Mercedes where you'll meet your hosts who’ll look after you for the next couple of days.

dayInfo.title: Estancia Stay.
dayInfo.description: Spend a couple of days experiencing life on a Uruguayan estancia. Although you’re welcome to relax and explore your surroundings at your leisure, there are plenty of opportunities to get involved with ranch activities, like making fresh empanadas or joining a game of football or volleyball. The digs aren’t fancy, but the surroundings and hospitality are something special. Eat homecooked meals including a traditional asado (barbecue), enjoy music around the campfire and maybe saddle up for a horse ride in true gaucho style.

dayInfo.title: Estancia Stay.
dayInfo.description: Spend another day taking in the gorgeous views across the estancia. Maybe head out on another horse ride to explore your surroundings or make your way into nearby Mercedes for a river walk and an ice cream.

dayInfo.title: Overnight Bus - Iguazu Falls.
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, bid farewell to your hosts and travel to the Uruguay/Argentinian border. Cross the border to Argentina, then prepare for an overnight bus to Puerto Iguazu – the gateway to Iguazu Falls. There’ll be a chance to grab a light dinner and some snacks before the journey.

dayInfo.title: Iguazu Falls (Brazilian Side).
dayInfo.description: When you arrive at Puerto Iguazu bus station this morning, jump in a minivan across the border into Brazil and head straight to the national park to stretch your legs and see the mighty Iguazu Falls. After some time spent admiring this force of nature, head to your hotel in Foz do Iguacu, where you have free time for the rest of the day.

dayInfo.title: Iguazu Falls (Argentinian side) .
dayInfo.description: Return to Argentina today to see Iguazu Falls from a different angle. Following a series of boardwalks, it’s possible to get so close to the thundering waters that you can almost touch them. At over two km long, Iguazu Falls are made up of over 270 separate cascades, with some reaching up to 80 m in height. For a more exhilarating experience, why not take an optional Zodiac boat ride to the base of the falls? After, head back to your hotel to relax.

dayInfo.title: Rio de Janeiro.
dayInfo.description: Today you’ll take a flight to Rio de Janeiro. Settle into your hotel room, then head out with your leader for an orientation walk. The remainder of the day is free to explore at your own pace. Maybe head to Copacabana or Ipanema Beach or, if the time of year is right, check out a soccer game at the famous Maracana Stadium. You could also take the tramcar up to the artistic hillside neighbourhood of Santa Teresa, or head up Corcovado Mountain for sweeping views over Rio from the foot of the Christ the Redeemer statue.

dayInfo.title: Rio de Janeiro.
dayInfo.description: With no activities planned, your trip comes to an end after breakfast. If you'd like to spend more time in Rio, we'll be happy to book additional accommodation for you (subject to availability).

tourName: Argentina whale watching tour
generalInfo:
Not always regarded by wildlife watchers but wrongly so, Argentina is home to a vast array of wildlife and some of the most stunning scenery in the world. This trip centres around one particular location in Argentina (Peninsula Valdes) the the amazing behaviour of a small population of orcas. Which was immortalised by the BBC during the 1993 series The Trails of Life where they filmed the orca beaching themselves in order to catch the southern sea lion pups in the surf. It is just unbelievable sight which we aim to see here.

But in addition to the orcas we will spend some time at the largest colony of Megallanic penguins in the world, enjoy a dolphin watching cruise, some world class birding and excellent mammal watching inland. All in all this tour is an excellent way to get the best of the Patagonian wildlife whilst sampling the best that Argentina culture and hospitality has to offer.

See one of the world's most spectacular natural events. Come to Patagonia in time to see the resident Orca hunting seal pups by torpedoing onto the beaches before thrashing their way back off with their prey in caught.

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner). There will be bottled water (approx 1ltr) available for each guest each day. We have our own private air conditioned 4x4 vehicles for all transfers. We include a professional zoologist (- zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) to escort you on all your excursions and also a very knowledgeable English speaking local guide. Your zoologist (- zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) escort is an expert in cetacean (whale and dolphin) biology and behaviour and will be able to help you identify the different species as well as interpret you what behaviours you are seeing. For example the subtle learning techniques that the orcas use to teach the younger whales the hunt and individual differences in each orca so you begin to get to know individuals. One of the joys of having a zoologist (- zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) escort is that you will not miss any sightings. We also use excellent local whale watching naturalists, with years of experience in observing the orcas as well as other whales and dolphins of the area. Also included are all boat trips, wildlife viewing and park fees are included. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on blue whales which are available to watch throughout the tour.

Seasons:

The exact season varies a little but from late February to early April is usually the entire season for this tour. During a 5-6 week period from late February to early April the transient pod of orcas start to hunt the southern sea lion and southern elephant seal pups as they take the water for the first time. The exact time of this unique behaviour varies and is dependant on fish stocks which speed up or slow down the seal development and therefore when they take to the surf for the first time. Over the last couple of decades the vast majority of attacks have been recorded in March and this is when the hunting usually reaches a peak.

Why Choose this Tour:

• We offer the chance to observe the amazing hunting behaviour of the orcas around Peninsula Valdes.
• We can arrange use of a boat to go out to where the orcas patrol, this is an exciting and new way of observing the hunting orcas before and during their unique hunting.
• If requested we can bring equipment such as a hydrophone (to hear the orcas under the water) and also an underwater camera which will attempt to film the whales and dolphins underneath the waves.
• This tour is like none other being offered by a UK based operator, you will not only get access to the best locations to watch the hunting orcas but we can also arrange further wildlife watching throughout Patagonia as well as taking in some of the most spectacular landscapes in the world.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.
• We have an unrivalled network of experts and guides all over Argentina that are able to find and observe animals like Commerson’s dolphins, southern fur seals, Magenellic penguins, culpeo foxes, giant anteaters, greater rheas, pumas, fairy armadillos, southern elephant seals, coypus, jaguarundis and hundreds other endangered, rare or endemic species throughout this wilderness land. Whether it is Los Glaciares, Tierra del Fuego, Chaco, Iguazu, Campo de los Alisos, El Palmar and many other wildlife watching locations you want to visit we can arrange it. Please inform us if you wish to add a Argentina extensions to this orca watching itinerary below and we can provide an excellent wildlife watching itinerary and quote for you.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).

Locations:

The only place in the world where this orca hunting style exists in the world is off one or two beaches along the Peninsula Valdes in Patagonia, Argentina. Making Punta Norte just about the most exciting whale watching destination in the world.

Fitness Level:

There is no real fitness level required for our orca watching holidays to Patagonia, you decide on the amount of walking involved in the tour.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; but as a rule of thumb we recommend that you bring your own binoculars or spotting scope as well as suitable clothing which would be a mix of cool, light clothing as well as warm winter clothes as the weather can be unpredictable and long hours on exposed beaches can get windy. Water proofs and a wind-breaker are also recommended. Comfortable walking shoes are a must, just in case you decide to head out for a hike in search of armadillos or guanacos. A sunhat and sun cream are also recommended. Of course plenty of film or memory cards for your camera as well as any other items of a personal nature which you will require whilst away.

Minimum Age: 12 Years old.

dayInfo.description: Buenos Aires - Arrival On your arrival into Buenos Aires you will be met at by your guide and taken to your hotel. If you arrive in the morning you will have time in the afternoon to visit Costanera Sur Nature Reserve. Here you will get a glimpse of some of the wildlife which inhabits the north of Argentina before we head south in the open pampas. We have a good chance of spotting coypu, Pampas cavy, Hillarys side-necked turtle, black tegu lizards as well as many bird species like chalk-browed mockingbirds, great Pampa-finch, black-and-rufous warbling finch, spectacled tyrant and many many more. (no meals included today).

Peninsula Valdes - Travelling & Wildlife Watching After morning you will catch a flight south from Buenos Aires to Trelew which is well and truly in Patagonia. We will be transferred to our hotel in Peninsula Valdes and then after checking in and some lunch we will leave to pay the Punta Tombo penguin colony a visit. This is a huge colony and the largest Magellan penguin colony in the world. At this time of the year the moulting season is just ending and most of the penguins are leaving or have already left but there is still a good chance of finding plenty around here as we walk in between the old nest sites. We will have our evening meal back at the accommodation. (breakfast is the only meal included today)

Bahia Bustamante - Travelling & Wildlife Watching After breakfast we will leave Peninsula Valdes and head further south along the spectacular Patagonian coastline until we reach Bahia Bustamante, After checking into the guest house you will have lunch and then the rest of the afternoon is for you to explore the surrounding areas. This is one of the smallest and most beautiful of all Patagonia's towns and you will enjoy the relaxing atmosphere as well as the wealth of life around here from steamer ducks, Magellanic penguins, southern sea lions, southern giant petrels, orca, as well as another 70 plus bird species which are regularly seen. We will have our evening meal in a local guest house or restaurant. (breakfast is the only meal included)

Puerto Deseado - Travelling & Wildlife Watching After breakfast we will enjoy some birding, along the Patagonian coastline before being transferred further south again to Puerto Deseado where we will check into our guest house. This afternoon will be at your leisure as you can scan the sea for more orca, southern right whales, Commerson's dolphins, southern elephant seals, snowy sheathbills, dolphin gulls, Royal terns, black-browed albatross and many other marine birds and mammals. We will enjoy our evening meal in our accommodation or a nearby restaurant. (breakfast is the only meal included today).

Puerto Deseado - Wildlife Watching This morning you will further explore some of this coastline which Charles Darwin visited himself during the voyage of the Beagle. We will take a boat trip out to try and get up close to some of the marine mammals and birds of the area such as Commerson's dolphins, southern sea lions, Magellanic cormorants, Megallanic penguins, red-legged cormorants and possibly orca. We will have our well deserved and last Patagonian meal in our guest house or a local restaurant. (breakfast is the only meal included today).

Buenos Aires - Travelling This morning after breakfast you will be taken to the airport to catch a flight back to the Argentine capital. Once we get to Buenos Aires we will check into our hotel and the rest of the afternoon will be for you to explore the city and its many sights. This is one of the most atmospheric cities in the whole world and an hour or two exploring its many streets is a magical experience. Our last meal will be served in our accommodation. (breakfast is the only meal that is included today).
Home - Departure After breakfast you will be transferred to the airport in time to catch your return flight home. (breakfast is the only meal included today)

tourName: Argentina wildlife highlights tour
generalInfo:
Take a mesmerising journey through Argentina with our expertly curated tour, exploring the wonders of Buenos Aires, the Valdes Peninsula, the Ibera Wetlands, and the awe-inspiring Iguazu Falls. Delve into the cultural marvels of Buenos Aires, a city pulsating with a harmonious blend of European sophistication and Latin American exuberance. From the historic allure of San Telmo to the trendy ambiance of Palermo, each neighbourhood narrates a distinctive tale.

Journey south to the Valdes Peninsula in Northern Patagonia for an exhilarating wildlife safari. Witness the majesty of sea lions, elephant seals, and orcas in their natural habitat. Depending on the season, encounter a bustling penguin colony and keep an eye out for whales.

Explore the untamed beauty of the Ibera Wetlands in northeastern Argentina, a haven for diverse ecosystems. Marvel at the pristine landscapes home to capybaras, marsh deer, caimans, howler monkeys, and a plethora of bird species, creating a utopia for avid birdwatchers.

Conclude your Argentina experience at the magnificent Iguazu Falls, where a safari boat ride offers a close encounter with the powerful cascades. This tour seamlessly weaves cultural immersion with thrilling wildlife experiences, promising an enriching and memorable adventure through Argentina's varied landscapes.

dayInfo.description: ARRIVE BUENOS AIRES - Welcome to lively Buenos Aires. Upon landing at the airport, our representative awaits to transfer you to the heart of Palermo Soho. Your boutique haven, the Mine Hotel, promises a stylish retreat, ensuring a seamless transition into the vibrant atmosphere of this captivating city.

BUENOS AIRES - Enjoy a half-day exploration of Buenos Aires with a knowledgeable local guide. Uncover the city's history and vibrant neighbourhoods, visiting landmarks like Plaza de Mayo, San Telmo's cobblestone streets, and the colourful La Boca. Explore the revitalised Puerto Madero and exclusive Recoleta, featuring the iconic cemetery. In the evening, indulge in a captivating tango show at El Querandi, complemented by a delightful Argentine dinner. This curated adventure seamlessly blends cultural discovery with the allure of Buenos Aires' iconic sites and the mesmerising rhythm of tango.

VALDES PENINSULA - Continue your Argentinean journey with a short flight from Buenos Aires to Trelew, the gateway to the Valdes Peninsula. Upon arrival, transfer to the coastal gem of Puerto Madryn. Set along Golfo Nuevo in Northern Patagonia, Puerto Madryn delights wildlife enthusiasts. Your base, Dazzler Hotel Puerto Madryn, exudes comfort with sophisticated charm and stunning views of the pristine coastline. Experience the allure of this natural paradise as you immerse yourself in the wonders of the Valdes Peninsula, all while enjoying the unmatched hospitality of your hotel.

VALDES PENINSULA - Today you will explore the UNESCO World Heritage Site of Peninsula Valdés. A one-hour drive leads to the Carlos Ameghino Visitor Centre, unveiling the unique ecosystems of this wildlife treasure. Next, discover Estancia San Lorenzo, a Patagonian sheep farm and home to the world's largest Magellan penguin colony. Enjoy a mouthwatering Patagonian lamb BBQ amid the estancia's historic charm. Witness the charismatic penguins just 4 miles away. At Punta Norte Wildlife Reserve, Southern Sea wonders unfold, with possible sightings of sea lions, elephant seals, and Orcas. As we return to Puerto Madryn, encounter diverse fauna thriving in this rugged Patagonian landscape.

VALDES to IGUAZU FALLS - Journey from Trelew, via Buenos Aires, to Puerto Iguazu the gateway to the majestic falls. On arrival in Iguazu Falls, your guide will transfer you to the Mercure Iguazu Hotel Iru, your accommodation in Iguazu on the Argentinean side and nestled within the Iraypu Jungle.

IGUAZU FALLS - After breakfast, depart on a journey to Iguazú National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the New 7 Wonders of the World, just 20 km from the city. The Upper Trail offers a breathtaking panoramic view of the Falls and the Iguazú River Delta. Immerse yourself in native flora, tune into the melodies of local birds, and perhaps catch a glimpse of caí monkeys or the lively coatis with their familial movements. Conclude the day with the Gran Aventura, a shared boat ride ensuring a close encounter with the power and beauty of Iguazu Falls. This exhilarating excursion provides various perspectives, creating lasting memories of this natural wonder that will linger in your heart.

IGUAZU FALLS - Guided by a knowledgeable bird expert equipped with binoculars and a telescope, embark on a captivating jungle walk in La Lorenza to spot its emblematic birds. La Lorenza boasts a remarkable diversity, recording over 300 bird species, including the yellow-crested woodpecker, robust woodpecker, orange dancer, crested hummingbird, scarlet-breasted yacutoro, and various climbers and tanagers. Crossing the "Tancredo Neves" International Bridge into Brazil covers about 20 km, leading to the Park's Visitors Centre. The walkway presents a breathtaking panoramic view of the Argentine falls from a distance, meandering through lush rainforest scenery.

IGUAZU to IBERA WETLANDS - Your guide awaits at your hotel for a scenic trip to Puerto Valle in the Ibera Wetlands. Traverse Argentina's lush landscapes, stopping at the UNESCO-listed Jesuitic Ruins of San Ignacio. Your haven, Puerto Valle, strategically situated in the northwest of the National Park, provides an unforgettable introduction to Iberá's natural wonders. Overlooking Laguna Valle, Puerto Valle allows private access to the pristine lagoon, offering a tranquil immersion in nature. Your stay promises an immersive encounter with wildlife, eco-friendly adventures, and the serenity of lush landscapes and pristine waters.

IBERA WETLANDS - Immerse yourself in the natural wonders of Puerto Valle with a range of included activities that showcase the beauty of Esteros del Iberá, the Paraná River, and the surrounding Estancia. Whether you're cruising along the Paraná River, exploring on a captivating photo safari, paddling through serene waters on kayak trips, riding through the landscape on horseback, or venturing on a safari trip through Iberá National Park, each experience promises to connect you with the rich biodiversity of the region. Take the unique photographic opportunity to capture the magic of the red macaw reintroduction at the Cambyretá Portal. Your time at Puerto Valle is a seamless blend of exploration, adventure, and a deep connection to the natural wonders of northern Argentina.

IBERA to BUENOS AIRES - After your adventures immersed in the wildlife of northern Argentina, return to Buenos Aires for your final night in this captivating city. The Mio Buenos Aires is a charming refuge away from the hustle and bustle.
DEPART BUENOS AIRES - Transfer to Buenos Aires airport for you departure flight.

tourName: Atacama to Paine holiday
generalInfo:
Outdoor lovers will be in their element on this tour through some of South America's most outstanding landscapes. Chile is a land of extremes, showcasing barren desert moonscapes, dramatic granite spires and verdant farmland peppered with emerald lakes. We'll explore it all on this trip from the Atacama down to the mountains of Torres del Paine.

Atacama Desert - Walk in the Moon Valley and on the Salar de Atacama
Puerto Varas - Hike in Chile's Lake District, in the shadow of the Osorno Volcano
Torres del Paine - Discover the glacial lakes and mountain ranges of one of the most impressive locations on earth
Why not extend your trip? - Take a short stay on the mysterious Easter Island (trip code: EIE)

dayInfo.title: Trip begins in Santiago de Chile; afternoon city tour
dayInfo.description: : Our tour of Chile starts in the capital, Santiago, in the shadow of the Andes. As there are many flights arriving in the morning to Santiago, our Tour Leader plans to meet us in the hotel reception at 2pm for a welcome briefing, and to take us on an orientation tour of the capital. We'll head into the heart of the city, making our way to the Plaza de Armas, the civic heart of the city since 1541. Standing here, we'll get the impressive panoramas of the majestic cathedral, as well as City Hall and the National History Museum. Busy pedestrian areas flank the Plaza de Armas, and unleash residents and families into the palm-tree-lined square on weekends. We'll continue to the imposing Government Palace, through picturesque, cobble-stoned streets and traditional neighbourhoods, and also take a cable car trip up San Cristobal Hill from some panoramic city views, before returning to our hotel. If you'd like to receive an airport transfer today, you'll need to arrive into Santiago International Airport (airport code: SCL), which is approximately a 45-minute drive from our hotel. Please note that if you wish to join the city tour today, you should arrive at the hotel by 2pm. We recommend giving yourself at least one hour to clear the airport, and a 45-minute drive to our hotel - so the latest your flight should arrive is 12pm. Don't worry if you miss the welcome meeting or the city tour, your Leader will inform you of any essential information this evening or tomorrow morning.

dayInfo.title: Walking tour around the arty port city of Valparaiso
dayInfo.description: : We escape the city today and make a day-trip to Santiago's nearby coastal cities of Valparaiso and Vina del Mar. Valparaiso's UNESCO-listed old town is a meandering maze of multi-coloured, hilltop houses, dotted with street art and murals that have almost created a type of open-air art museum. We'll explore the Cerro Alegre neighbourhood, a slightly bohemian area of colourful 19th-century mansion houses, built predominantly for a burgeoning English immigrant population. Now covered with murals and colourful stairwells, we'll get some great views from the city and have the chance to see in action some of the famous 'ascensores' (funiculars) that bring people up and down from the mountain-top. While in the city, we'll also explore the iconic Plaza Sotomayor and the seaport that made Valparaiso a hub of one-time international importance. From Valparaiso, we'll drive to the charming coastal city of Vina del Mar. After seeing a couple of key sights, we'll have some free time here for lunch at the coast, taking a paddle in the Pacific before making our way back to Santiago for the evening.

dayInfo.title: Fly to Calama and drive to the Atacama Desert; sunset at Moon Valley
dayInfo.description: : Flying to Calama this morning we transfer by private bus to the oasis town of San Pedro de Atacama, set high among the spectacular volcanoes of Los Andes Cordillera and our gateway to the dramatic landscapes of the Atacama Desert. On arrival there will be some time to relax, and this late afternoon we will take a walk among the dunes of the nearby Valle de la Luna (Moon Valley), a nature reserve to the west of the town, where the surreal landscape has been formed by the erosion of the salt mountains. We intend to watch the setting sun cast its golden glow across the spectacular landscape, taking a short, approximately 3km/2 mile easy walk, before returning by bus back to San Pedro.

dayInfo.title: Discover the vast Atacama salt flat; visit the high altitude lagoons at Toconao
dayInfo.description: : San Pedro was once the centre of the Atacama culture, before the arrival of the Spanish, and its dusty streets and evocative setting still exude an air of times long past. Over the next two days we have the chance to explore the cultural and natural diversity of this region. Our first day sees us travelling out to the gigantic Salar de Atacama to walk on the salt flats, undoubtedly one of the most dramatic natural features in the country. The barren valley of salt has been almost moulded by wind into crystalline forms on its crust - some hexagonal and others almost coral-like, or like shards of ice. We'll take a walk at the trails of the high altitude (2,300m / 7,545ft) Laguna Chaxa, where flamingos drink from the coloured lagoon, a flash of bright pink against the otherwise barren landscape. There are several high altitude lagoons here at the salt flat, all home to a variety of native bird species, of which the three types of Chilean flamingo are the most famous. As well as walking in this strange setting, we visit the small village of Tocanao, known for its buildings made of the volcanic stone liparite. We visit the church and historic bell tower, as well as the booths of craftspeople who sell their wares in the small village square. We'll make our way back to the hotel in the early afternoon, and have the rest of the day free in charming San Pedro. You have the option to visit the Cejar Lagoon in this free time - here, you can swim in the bright blue hues of these salty waters, and the desert surrounds make for quite an unusual swimming spot.

dayInfo.title: Dawn visit to the El Tatio Geysers; free afternoon with optional astronomy tour
dayInfo.description: : We'll have an early start this morning, driving the 1.5 hour route to the El Tatio Geysers, where their dawn eruptions have a smoky, apocalyptic glow against the rising sun. We'll take a boxed breakfast and enjoy a picnic here, taking in the bubbling fumaroles and mud pits all around. We'll return to the hotel around midday, and after our early start we'll take the rest of the day to relax. The desert town had a slightly frontier feeling, and it's a great little place to explore on foot, with a wide array of handicraft shops, small adobe churchs, cafes and bars to discover. In the evening, there is the option to take an astronomy tour, and get a glimpse of the Atacama's famed night skies (not always available during the full moon).

dayInfo.title: Fly from Calama to the Lake District
dayInfo.description: : Today we fly to Puerto Montt, the most important port in the south of Chile and, in a very real sense, the spot where the developed or settled population of Chile comes to a full stop. This is the gateway to the wild and rugged regions to the south and from here we drive to Puerto Varas and our hotel, based beside the shores of Lake Llanquihue. Flight schedules can change, but if we have free time to explore we'll take a stroll on the lake shore, the second largest in Chile and one of the shimmering jewels of Chile's Lake District. Set against the backdrop of snow-capped volcanoes, this is the third largest expanse of natural water on the South American continent and presents us with a quite breathtaking setting.

dayInfo.title: Walk in lava fields at the Osorno Volcano; view the Petrohue Falls
dayInfo.description: : Although not quite as wild and windswept as southern Patagonia, Chile's Lake District is arguably the more beautiful spot, and we have a full day to explore its lakes, valleys and forest today. The area is dominated by the classic volcanic cone of Osorno, an almost picture-perfect representation of a snowy volcanic peak. Our walk takes us through the lush landscapes of the Valdivian rainforest, the slopes of the mountain sprinkled with Andean birch, providing a haven for chingue (Patagonian skunk), culpeo (Patagonian fox), weasels and puma, whilst the bird populations boast hummingbirds, woodpeckers and kestrel. We also head to the Petrohue Waterfalls, a cascading torrent of emerald-blue with a stunning backdrop of the Osorno Volcano.

dayInfo.title: Fly to Punta Arenas in Southern Patagonia
dayInfo.description: : We fly to Punta Arenas today - our journey is normally in the afternoon but flight schedules can change. If the morning is free in Puerto Varas, there are a few interesting architectural sites that you might wish to explore. This area of the Lake District received large numbers of German immigrants in the mid-1800s, and the Gothic architecture of mansion houses such as Casa Kuschel (now the office of a conservation foundation) represents the typical style of the area. Museo Pablo Fierro is another curiosity - worth a visit if you're a fan of a strange and quirky museum! Or alternatively, you might wish to take a walk along the banks of Lake Llanquihue. After arriving into Punta Arenas, most likely in the afternoon, we'll take the short drive to our hotel.

dayInfo.title: Penguin-spotting boat trip to Magdalena Island; drive into Torres del Paine
dayInfo.description: : We get out onto the water today, with an early morning drive to the pier at Bahia Laredo. Here, we board our speedboat (this excursion may be with other travellers outside of our group) and sail through the Magellan Strait to Magdalena Island, home to a collection of Magellanic penguins - we'll be able to get off the boat here and take an hour-long walk with our naturalist guide, learning all about these penguins and their natural habitat. We'll continue our sail to Isla Marta, home to a colony of sea lions, as well as birdlife including the imperial cormorant and southern gull. While sailing back to the mainland, there is the possibility (for the lucky!) to spot Patagonian dolphins or sei whales along the strait. In the afternoon, we drive into Torres del Paine, one of the world's most impressive national parks, situated amidst a region of ice-capped peaks, silent blue glacial lakes and wild hills. One of the highlights of our time here will be the views of the Torres, imposing pinnacles of sharp granite that are surrounded by glacial lakes and craggy ranges, formed millions of years ago. This is a place to keep an eye out for condors, rheas and guanacos - wildlife surviving in a bleak, but beautiful, landscape.

dayInfo.title: Explore the lakes, glaciers and mountains of Torres del Paine
dayInfo.description: : Today we will explore this wilderness on foot. We start out on the Hunters Trail, a roughly 8km/5 mile hike that takes 3 hours to complete. The trail crosses natural habitats of big guanaco colonies, and there's the possibility to spot condors or the black-chested buzzard eagle, as well as going past the remains of cave paintings made some 6,000 years ago, by the remote and primitive Aonikenk tribes of Patagonia. The trail here gently undulates between the two eastern gates of the park, crossing the Patagonian Steppe. In the afternoon, we walk to the magnificent icebergs of the glacier-fed Lago Grey, an easy 6km/4 mile hike of about 2 hours in length, along a flat, shoreline trail that's made slightly harder with its rocky terrain. The scenery is magnificent throughout. It's worth mentioning that our itinerary in Torres del Paine will be flexible, in case of the strong winds that sometimes whip through this wild landscape.

dayInfo.title: Free morning in Torres del Paine; drive to Puerto Natales
dayInfo.description: : We have our last morning in the park before departing for Puerto Natales in the early afternoon. It's a short drive, and en route we'll make a stop to take a look in the depths of the Milodon Cave. Alternatively for those who wish there is the option to take a full day journey by boat to Puerto Natales from Torres del Paine. The excursion starts with a zodiac ride down the Serrano River for one and a half hours, reaching Puerto Toro where you'll hike for 30 minutes to get up-close to the Serrano Glacier. After the hike, you then board a larger vessel and continue the journey south for another one and a half hours arriving for a well-deserved barbecue lunch at a traditional estancia. If some travellers decide to take up this optional excursion, the group comes back together in Puerto Natales in the evening. From its small beginnings as a tiny fishing port, the town has blossomed into a hub of adventure, with striking views out to the mountain-lined fjords. We will eat out at one of the town's many restaurants this evening.

dayInfo.title: Fly from Punta Arenas to Santiago
dayInfo.description: : This morning we transfer to Punta Arenas, from where we fly back this afternoon to Santiago. On arrival we will transfer to our hotel for the final evening of our journey through this remarkable country.

dayInfo.title: Trip ends in Santiago de Chile
