We'll have the chance to taste the multiple varieties of grapes found in the area during our tour, before returning to Mendoza. The late afternoon is free to explore the city, and on our first full day in Argentina, it's a good idea to try some of the local delicacies - visit an afternoon coffee shop for an alfajor (an Argentinian speciality - a cakey biscuit filled with 'dulce de leche') or take a walk around the lively Plaza Independencia.

dayInfo.title: Walk in the Aconcagua Provincial Park and visit the Inca Bridge
dayInfo.description: : Today we have a full-day trip to Aconcagua Provincial Park, home to the magnificent Aconcagua - standing at 6,961 metres/22,837 feet it's the tallest peak in the Americas. At the bottom of the permanently snow-covered peaks, we'll find lush meadows and some forested valleys, and our tour leader will take us on a 90-minute hike to the Horcones Lagoon, a glacier-fed lagoon with outstanding views of the mountains. The trail is relatively flat and rocky, with mountains at either side of us and the peak of Aconcagua rising before us in the distance. Before returning to Mendoza, we'll also make a stop at the Puente del Inca, a geologically formed bridge once allegedly used by Incas to cross the river. The reddish oranges of the formation are caused by the minerals in the waters running beneath the bridge, and the remains of a slightly curious-looking stone chapel are still found built into the rock. We'll drive back to Mendoza after our visit. The drive to Mendoza takes approximately three hours each way.

dayInfo.title: Drive to Barreal; visit El Leoncito National Park
dayInfo.description: : Today we'll set off to Barreal, one of the most beautifully situated towns in this sleepy region of the country. The town is a shot of green in the often desert-like landscapes of the northwest, with seven snow-capped Andean peaks overlooking it. The highlight is the nearby El Leoncito National Park, a protected area with very strict regulations on air pollution. This valley gives us the chance (weather-dependent) to do some night sky watching while enjoying its breathtaking scenery. Our drive today will take around six hours, with a section of unpaved roads.

dayInfo.title: Drive to Villa Union through the Las Burras gorge
dayInfo.description: : We have a long day of driving today, approximately seven hours, to Villa Union. We'll pass through small villages, ancient prehispanic settlements and the 'Las Burras' Gorge road, winding through the mountains, as well as driving through the impressive Jachal River Gorge. We'll stop at a viewpoint to see the red formations of the enormous Talampaya and Ischigualasto National Parks for the first time, with the late afternoon sun in the background. Villa Union is the jumping-off point for exploring these parks and is a sleepy town with the shadows of the Andes in the background.

dayInfo.title: Explore the geo shapes and red rock landscapes of Ischigualasto and Talampaya National Parks
dayInfo.description: : A full day exploring weird and wonderful landscapes awaits us as we delve into the moonlike scenery of Ischigualasto National Park, and the red rock towers of Talampaya. Once the kingdom of dinosaurs, these two parks contain the most complete fossil record known from the Triassic Period and have together been granted UNESCO heritage status. Talampaya National Park is up first. The scrub desert boasts fossilised remains of a wide range of ancestral animals and plants. Even for those amongst us who are not scientifically minded, the park is an impressive show of geological wonders. We'll be undertaking an easy hike through the immense red rock canyon of the Don Eduardo Gorge, which is approximately 8 kilometres/5 miles on flat terrain. The dry riverbeds, red dunes and sand plains are more akin to a Martian journey than our expectations of Andean scenery. Popularly known as 'Moon Valley', Ischigualasto National Park, the next stop on our visit, is home to geological oddities that have been formed by water, wind and sun over the last million years. 'Bowling Lane' is one of the most iconic sites, with scores of perfectly polished round balls sitting on a flat surface, with apparently no explanation for their formation. We'll drive through this park by bus, stopping at the most interesting shapes to explore them further. After a thorough exploration of both parks, we'll return to Villa Union.

dayInfo.title: Drive to Belen and visit a women's weaving co-operative
dayInfo.description: : We'll get back on the Ruta 40 today, driving towards the small town of Belen and passing through characterful, rural villages en route. Part of the drive takes us on a winding upward journey over the Cuesta de Miranda, perhaps one of the most photogenic and visual climbs in the region - taking us from 1000 metres/3280 feet to 2000 metres/6561 feet above sea level and back down, in just a couple of hours. The highway was originally built in the early 1900s, following the path of the ancient Inca Trail that eventually led to Cusco. That early road was precarious - you could barely fit two cars abreast, with one side of the road dropping into the deep Miranda gorge. Thankfully it was updated in the last ten years, and a new highway was built - we'll pass the old one during the drive for comparison. After the Cuesta de Miranda, it's an easy drive for the final 200 kilometres/124 miles to Belen. There is a women's weaving co-operative in Belen that we've been visiting with groups for the last few years. Weaving, with both sheep and llama or alpaca wool, is an essential part of the economy up here in the northwest, and the co-op is a fascinating way to learn more about the process and its important place in this society. Our drive time today is approximately six hours including stops, arriving into Belen around 2pm.

dayInfo.title: Wine-tasting in Cafayate and visit to indigenous Quilmes ruins
dayInfo.description: : Setting off this morning to Argentina's northern Winelands around Cafayate, we'll stop at the indigenous Quilmes ruins en route. The Quilmes people, dating back to around AD1000, famously resisted the Incan invasion and lived through over a century of Spanish colonisation. The large site is made up of the remains of terraces rising up the cacti-covered hillside - we can walk to the top for excellent views of the valley and the site. Although not as impressive as other archaeological sites in the Andes, it helps us to understand the indigenous heritage in this part of Argentina. Finally, we'll arrive in Cafayate in the early afternoon for a round of wine tasting in one of the region's rustic wineries, its rows of green vines backed by the spectacular mountains beyond. We might try Argentina's main white wine, Torrontes, famous in this region. Our drive to Cafayate takes approximately six hours.

dayInfo.title: Drive to Cachi through 'Broken Arrow Gorge'
dayInfo.description: : The Argentina of the Andes is steeped in Inca heritage, and the indigenous populations have retained many of their old traditions - in small towns like Cafayate, local methods of weaving have been maintained since pre-Hispanic times, and during our journey through the Andes, we'll admire their woven clothes, hats, sweaters and ponchos in llama and vicuna wool. Today our journey takes us to Cachi through the 'Arrows Gorge', a spectacular formation of sharp, pointed rocks shooting up through the air at all sorts of different angles; the road that we travel on pierces this dramatic and surreal landscape. It's an unsealed road, and as such the drive will take the whole day, with a number of spectacular scenery stops (including at the highest point of the tour, just over 3,400m / 11,154ft). We'll arrive in the evening to the tranquil town of Cachi (2,530 metres/8,300 feet altitude).

dayInfo.title: Drive to Salta through high arid cactus deserts down to fertile forests on the 'Bishop's Hill Road'
dayInfo.description: : This morning, we'll head on to Salta, down the 'Bishop's Hill Road', 20 kilometres/12 miles of hairpin bends that offer views down to the Sierra del Obispo. During the drive, the change in scenery is simply amazing, as we travel from the cactus-filled deserts of the Cardones National Park, down to lush green mountains, blanketed in vegetation and eroded by rippling brooks and streams. We'll stop to discover the spectacular mountain views at the various viewpoints on route to Salta - one of the livelier cities in the north of Argentina, it is a blend of colonial architecture, fascinating museums and buzzing nightlife. Our drive today will take approximately five to seven hours, depending on the number and length of stops and the traffic upon arrival into Salta.

dayInfo.title: Discover Humahuaca Gorge
dayInfo.description: : Today we'll set out to explore the UNESCO Heritage area of the Humahuaca Gorge, a highlight of any trip to the northwest of Argentina. Our first stop is three hours north, at the colourful desert town of Purmamarca. This town has an incredible backdrop - a mountainside named the 'Seven-Coloured Hill' for its bright shades of yellows, oranges, reds and greens. This town is well worth visiting in depth, and we'll spend a couple of hours here hiking on the Los Colorados path, an easy trail of 2.5km / 1.5 miles, exploring the town and taking our lunch stop. From Purmamarca we'll move to the traditional village of Tilcara, with its charming village square, market and church. The rest of the day's journey is awash with colour and scenic roadside lookouts; another appropriately named mountain is The 'Painters Palette', which we'll see over the town of Maimara. It's interesting to see once again the heritage from the pre-Columbian period which gives this area of northwest Argentina a very distinct sense of cultural identity. This is not only manifested in the woven items that we've spotted in other towns but also in the local diet, with northern food including llama stews and corn dishes on offer. After a day exploring, we'll return to Salta and will get a taste of its music scene at a 'pena', a traditional folk music hall where locals come with guitars and take turns to play and sing. Dinner is included.

dayInfo.title: Fly to Buenos Aires
dayInfo.description: : This morning, we'll say goodbye to the northwest and catch our flight to cosmopolitan Buenos Aires. Here we'll find ourselves amid Argentina's capital, located on the southern shores of the Rio de la Plata. Since its founding by Pedro de Mendoza in the 1500s, the city has thrived on trade and its vibrant streets are filled with an eclectic mix of European architectural styles, with Spanish, French and Italian classicism rubbing shoulders with remnants of Victorian grandeur. The afternoon is free to settle in. Tomorrow we'll visit the eclectic and bohemian south of the city, so this afternoon you might want to visit the elite north, home to the embassies, the richer neighbourhoods and many of the city's green spaces. Its main site is the famous Recoleta Cemetery, the final resting place of some of Argentina's most revered figures, including Eva Peron. Or perhaps go to Palermo Park, an urban oasis in the madness of the city. This evening or tomorrow we'll have an opportunity to enjoy Buenos Aires' dazzling nightlife and soak up the pulsating rhythms of one of South America's most captivating cities.

dayInfo.title: Walking tour of La Boca and Plaza de Mayo; free afternoon
dayInfo.description: : We're experiencing the city as a Porteno (a Buenos Aires native) today, using the local buses and exploring on foot. Each neighbourhood of Buenos Aires has a distinct character, with grand Italianate architecture rubbing shoulders with winding cobbled streets or tree-lined avenues. To get a feel for the heart of the city, we'll stroll towards its founding point at the Plaza de Mayo, where the President's dusty-pink mansion is located. Every big event in Buenos Aires's history has been witnessed by the Plaza, from the continued protests of the Madres de la Plaza de Mayo back to Eva Peron's mass demonstrations in 1945. From here, we'll hop on a bus towards the colourful neighbourhood of La Boca. Settled originally by Italian migrants, the area is famed for its bright houses, a ramshackle affair of corrugated iron, and the tango dancers who perform in the streets. We'll visit a local Cafecito during our tour, taking a traditional Porteno elevenses of coffee and pastries. We end our morning in bohemian San Telmo, with its small one-way streets, historic mansions and walls covered with street art. Our Tour Leader will suggest lunch at a traditional Bodegon, sampling specialities that an Argentinian grandma would be happy with. Empanadas, locro (corn and pumpkin stew) or a delicious choripan (a fat chorizo sausage in bread, with chimichurri sauce) may be on the menu. The afternoon is free to explore with much on offer. You could stay and see more of San Telmo, which is particularly interesting when the antiques market takes over the cobbled streets. For book lovers, the Ateneo Grand Splendid, set in a converted theatre, is one of the most impressive bookstores in the world. This evening, we'll have the opportunity to enjoy Buenos Aires' nightlife, perhaps going to a tango show and soaking up the pulsating rhythms of this most Latin of dances.

dayInfo.title: Trip ends in Buenos Aires
dayInfo.description: : Our trip ends after breakfast at our hotel in Buenos Aires. There are no activities planned today, so you're free to depart from Buenos Aires at any time. If your flight is departing later in the day, luggage storage facilities are available at our hotel. If you'd like an airport transfer, you'll need to depart from either Aeroparque Internacional Jorge Newbery (AEP) or Ezeiza International Airport (EZE).

tourName: 10-Day Argentina Adventure: Fly-Fishing, Kayaking and More
placesVisited: Buenos Aires, El Calafate, Bariloche
generalInfo: Get lost in the fervor of Buenos Aires, impassioned rhythms of tango music, and the breathtaking beauty of Patagonia on this 10-day Argentina tour. Meander down the colorful streets of San Telmo, explore El Calafate for unparalleled views of nearly 200 glaciers, and wind down in Bariloche with fishing expeditions atop crystal-clear waters. Embrace the majestic Andes and indulge in urban vistas for the perfect Argentina experience.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - Enjoy Dinner and a Tango Show
dayInfo.description: Get to know the dazzling metropolis of Buenos Aires and its riveting history, known for its elevated style and romantic atmosphere. Your private transfer will meet you at the airport and escort you to the comforts of your luxurious accommodations before you step into the bustle of city life. After exploring the unique neighborhoods at your pace, you'll be captivated by a tango performance at dinner as you witness Argentina’s most acclaimed dance form. Listen to the majestic rhythm and embrace the passion as you immerse yourself into the local ambiance.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - Explore on a Half-Day City Tour
dayInfo.description: Awake to the hustle and bustle of city life and grab a light breakfast at your hotel. Today you’ll join your tour guide on a private, half-day excursion through whimsical Buenos Aires. Wander around the Plaza de Mayo as you admire the traditional architecture, cobblestoned streets, and the presidential house, also known as the Pink House. Later, visit San Telmo and La Boca where the colors of Buenos Aires turn ever-more vibrant and streets fill with energizing tango music. That afternoon, stop in Recoleta, one of Buenos Aires’ most up-scale neighborhoods, often called the “Paris of the South”.

dayInfo.title: El Calafate - Arrive in Captivating Patagonia
dayInfo.description: Take respite from the fervor of city life as you travel to beautiful Patagonia, home to some of the most diverse wildlife and landscapes in the world. You’ll board a short domestic flight to El Calafate, the starting point for many adventure travelers who set out to explore the world’s “capital of glaciers”. Located at the shore of Lago Argentino, it’s also home to Spegazzini Glacier, the natural border between Chile and Argentina. Upon arrival, enjoy an afternoon of leisurely exploration and a light meal in the town’s center.

dayInfo.title: El Calafate - Enjoy a Full Day at Perito Moreno Glacier
dayInfo.description: Lace up your hiking shoes and embark on a full-day adventure of the Perito Moreno Glacier. In the morning your private transport service will drive you to the entrance of Glaciers National Park. There you’ll take part in a six-hour tour of one of the most revered sites in Patagonia, a UNESCO World Heritage site since 1981. Half of the park is occupied by the Campo de Hielo Patagónico, the largest icefield in Patagonia. Travel from El Calafate to the park for breathtaking vistas at almost every angle, including more than 200 glaciers.

dayInfo.title: El Calafate - Experience a Unique Fishing Tour
dayInfo.description: Enjoy Patagonia’s landscapes at a more leisurely pace today. In the morning you’ll get picked up by your private transport for a scenic drive to the river, where your boating adventure begins. You’ll enjoy a fishing trip with stunning views and the chance to catch wild rainbow and brown trout. At midday you’ll stop for snacks, drinks, and a delectable lunch of fresh trout. Depending on the day’s temperature, you may want to take a quick dip in the cool waters for a chance to unwind and refresh amidst the quiet ambiance of nature.

dayInfo.title: Bariloche - Travel and Discover at Your Pace
dayInfo.description: In the morning you'll set out for Bariloche, a stunning almost fairytale-like region of Patagonia that’s surrounded by a large glacial lake, the majestic Andes Mountains looming in the distance. Once you’ve settled into your luxury accommodations you’ll spend the afternoon exploring the Swiss-like town plaza, with quaint cobbled streets and intricate rooftops. Try some of the delicious, locally-made chocolates or walk by the sparkling Nahuel Huapi Lake. Rest up in the evening so you’re prepared for the action-packed day that follows.

dayInfo.title: Bariloche - Embrace a Sunset Kayaking Excursion
dayInfo.description: In the morning you'll explore Lake Gutierrez, one of the most charming places in Bariloche. You'll spend the first half of the day enjoying a scenic hike along the lake's perimeter. In the evening you'll meet your guide once again for an incredible sunset kayak tour on its crystal-clear waters. Breathe in the crisp air and listen to the soothing sounds of trickling water as you paddle the lake's perimeter. After the excursion, indulge in a picada dinner as you marvel at the Patagonian sunset illuminating the night sky.

dayInfo.title: Bariloche - Revel in All-Inclusive Fly Fishing
dayInfo.description: Pick up the pace today. You'll meet your guide in the morning and bump along the scenic roads to Lanin National Park in northern Patagonia. You'll find a quiet, serene alcove to try your hand at traditional fly fishing. You can wade in the water or try your luck from a cataraft until midday. Stop for lunch to enjoy local delights, including a large meat selection, local wine, and vegetarian options. After a short rest lakeside, return to Lake Gutierrez or explore Lake Nahuel Huapi or Lake Moreno.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - Enjoy Buenos Aires at Your Pace
dayInfo.description: Bid your final farewells to the beautiful Patagonian region. Spend the morning hours at your own pace, going for a short walk to take in the awe-inspiring scenery one last time: crystal-clear waters, lush grasslands and the Andes Mountains reaching towards the sky. After you arrive in Buenos Aires you can enjoy a luxurious dinner with your private tour guide as you reminisce about your Argentinian adventure. Indulge in delectable asado paired perfectly with a glass of wine or bite into a mouthwatering empanada.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: You'll enjoy a light breakfast at your hotel before meeting your private transfer just outside your hotel. Carene down the bustling boulevards of Buenos Aires as you listen to the fervent chatter of street vendors and passersby making their daily commute. Inhale the enticing aromas of street food one last time. Shortly, you'll arrive at the Buenos Aires Ezeiza Airport, where you'll board your international flight home.

tourName: 10-Day Argentina Romantic Escape Tour
placesVisited: Buenos Aires, Patagonia, Mendoza, Iguazu Falls, El Calafate
generalInfo: Feel humbled as you gape at the immense Perito Moreno glacier with a cool arctic breeze grazing your face. Discover the flavors of world-class, Malbec wines as you gaze out over the charming vineyards and snowy Andes Mountains with your partner. From the sensual rhythms of Argentine tango in Buenos Aires to the awe-inspiring power of Iguazu Falls’ rushing waters, Argentina is the perfect destination for an intimate couple’s getaway. On this luxurious, 10-Day romantic tour through Argentina, you will discover the passions of this magnificent country while being inspired to connect with your partner at the deepest level.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – Arrive in Buenos Aires for a City Tour and Sensual Tango Show
dayInfo.description: Buenos Aires has often been referred to as the “Paris of South America” because of its charming streets and alluring energy that are reminiscent of its dazzling, European counterpart. This is a perfect place for you to begin your tour of Argentina, and you will arrive at one of Buenos Aires’ two international airports, where you will be met by your private tour guide who will transfer you to the city center. Your guide will lead you to your luxurious hotel in the heart of Buenos Aires’ enchanting neighborhood of Palermo, which is encompassed by lovely, tree-lined streets and unique shops, plazas, and cafes. Once you have settled in, you will meet your guide in the hotel lobby for a tour of some of the city’s most celebrated sights. You will discover the luscious Bosques de Palermo, which is Buenos Aires’ charming version of Central Park. You will also visit the notable Recoleta Cemetery, which is the burial site of Argentina’s most infamous figures such as Evita Peron. Then, you will visit the Centro as you tour La Casa Rosada, which is the executive mansion of Argentina’s President, before learning the history of picturesque San Telmo, which is Buenos Aires’ oldest neighborhood. In the evening, you should prepare to be dazzled by a display of one of the country’s most celebrated cultural experiences, which is a sensual, Argentine tango show that will be accompanied by a gourmet meal.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – Explore the Neighborhood of La Boca and Delight in a Couples Tango Lesson
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will wake up to a delicious Argentine breakfast at your hotel before meeting your expert guide in the lobby for a tour of the vibrant neighborhood of La Boca. As you stroll through the streets of this colorful neighborhood, you can admire the charming buildings and shops, and when you least expect it, you may be dazzled by pairs of tango dancers who may spontaneously burst into action around you. During your stroll, you will be able to smell the aromas of thick, fresh-cut steak as it permeates the air. You will then stop for lunch at one of the many traditional restaurants along La Boca’s central street that will be recommended to you by your guide. From here, your guide will direct you to another aspect of this eclectic city’s charming neighborhoods. Here, you will enjoy a private tango lesson with your partner that will be instructed by world-class tango dancers. As you dance together as a pair to the Latin-infused rhythms of the music, you will be able to feel the heated intimacy between you. You may begin to dance effortlessly across the tango studio with the backdrop of brilliant Buenos Aires. After your lesson, your private driver will return you to your hotel to freshen up before transferring you to the world-renowned Teatro Colon Opera House for an extraordinary show. You can admire the intricate architecture of the building before delighting in the spectacle of the wonderful performance.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – Visit Feria San Telmo and Dine in Luxury in Puerto Madero
dayInfo.description: After breakfast today, you will meet your guide in the hotel’s lobby before being transferred by private coach to today’s first destination: the famed Feria San Telmo. This lively, open-air market extends through the majority of the San Telmo neighborhood and is a wonderful way to sample a taste for classic porteno culture. You can wander through the endless aisles of booths, which will be filled with products that have been crafted by local artisans. As you and your partner stop to admire a portrait that was painted by a local artist, you can notice a crowd that will begin to form. If you walk over to it, you will be delighted to discover that a street-performing violinist has inspired an impromptu tango performance by passersby. This is the magic of Buenos Aires, and you will be elated to be experiencing it firsthand. In the evening, your private driver will transfer you to the upscale neighborhood of Puerto Madero, where you will dine in luxury at one of the high-end gourmet restaurants that will be recommended to you by your expert guide. As you sip a glass of rich Malbec wine and take a bite of your exquisitely cut Argentine beef, you can gaze out in complete contentment over the glowing Rio de la Plata river, which will be illuminated by the stunning bridge of Puente de la Mujer.

dayInfo.title: El Calafate – Enjoy a Luxury Boat Cruise through Los Glaciares National Park
dayInfo.description: You will have an early start and after a delectable breakfast this morning before meeting your driver in the hotel lobby for your transfer to the airport. You will embark on a quick flight to El Calafate, which is the heart of Argentina’s Patagonia region. From the airport, your private driver will transfer you to the picturesque port, where you will board a luxurious boat on which you will spend two nights lavishly cruising through the gorgeous Los Glaciares National Park. On this grand cruise, you will sail through the lakes of Patagonia, visiting the magnificent glaciers and areas of the park that are typically inaccessible to tourists. You will enjoy the immense magnitude of the world-renowned Perito Moreno glacier, which is famous not only for its gigantic size but also because it is one of the world’s few remaining glaciers that is actually growing in size as opposed to shrinking. You will then bask in the natural beauty of Patagonia’s rugged landscape, taking in the stunning mountains, lakes, streams, and forests that abound from it. You will then be amazed by the endless ice fields, which are the second largest concentration of ice on the planet after Antarctica. Lastly for today, you will indulge in a gourmet dinner by candlelight as you reminisce with your partner on all you have experienced throughout your fantastic trip thus far.

dayInfo.title: El Calafate – Discover Patagonia's Treasures on Night Two of your Boat Cruise
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will wake up on a luxurious boat before venturing out on a cruise for the second day of your expedition through Los Glaciares National Park. Today, you will be provided with an exquisite breakfast that will be fit for a true gourmand. After you finish eating, you will be lead on a visit to the infamous Spegazzini and Upsala glaciers, which are famous for their tremendous size. Your ship will dock at various points throughout the day, offering you the opportunity to disembark and enjoy a few guided nature hikes through the untouched terrain of Patagonia. As you trek through the Andean forest, you will find yourself completely awestruck by the natural beauty that surrounds you. You can breathe in the crisp, clean air of the mountains and feel a refreshing breeze as it rustles through your hair. If you look up, you will be to see your amazement as it is reflected in the face of your partner. Returning to the boat, you can sip a warm beverage on the dock as you glide along the calm waters of the park’s serene lakes. As the day comes to a close, you will delight in yet another phenomenal meal that will be prepared by the ship’s gourmet chefs, furthering your magical experience in the presence of luxury.

dayInfo.title: Mendoza – Delight in a Multi-Course Gourmet Lunch with Wine Pairing
dayInfo.description: Today, after enjoying your final breakfast on the ship, you will disembark and be met at the port by your private driver. They will be transfer you to the airport for a comfortable flight to Mendoza, which is Argentina’s popular winemaking region. Upon your arrival, your driver will transfer you to your delightful, boutique accommodation in the heart of Mendoza, which will also be a wine lodge. You can take a moment to admire the view from your luxurious hotel at the foot of the Andes mountains with their snowy peaks that rise in the distance. Once you have had time to freshen up, your expert guide will meet you in the hotel lobby for your first introduction to the beautiful wine country of Argentina. You will be transferred to one of Mendoza’s most charming bodegas for a multi-course, gourmet lunch that will be accompanied by a sensational wine pairing. As you luxuriate in your flawless meal, you will gaze out over the endless vineyards that are highlighted against the backdrop of the glorious Andes. You may think to yourself that you are truly having the experience of a lifetime, and after lunch concludes, you will spend the rest of the afternoon, wandering through Mendoza’s lovely city center at your leisure and delighting in the picturesque parks, plazas, and museums that are typical of this enchanting, Argentine city.

dayInfo.title: Mendoza – Privately Tour Mendoza's Best Bodegas with a Curated Wine Tasting
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will enjoy breakfast on the sunny terrace, savoring the warm morning sun on your face and feeling eager to begin another exciting day. You will meet your private tour guide in the hotel’s lobby to embark on a day of touring some of Mendoza’s finest wineries. As you visit each winery, you will unearth the intricacies of the winemaking process from winemakers whose families have owned these bodegas for generations. As you listen to their stories, you cannot help but notice that their passion for their craft is palpable, adding to the overall authenticity of this extraordinary experience. At your final bodega or winery, you will delight in a curated tasting of some of Argentina’s finest vintages. You can savor the sweet, fruity tastes of the rich, Argentine Malbec that the country is famous for before reveling in the enchanting atmosphere that surrounds you. You can admire the old-world charm of the massive, wooden barrels that are used to age the wine that you will enjoy. You will then be provided with a calm serenity that this peaceful place breeds. You should take pleasure in living in the moment alongside your partner, cherishing this wonderful adventure that you are experiencing together. After your tour, you will be returned to your luxurious accommodation, where you can spend the rest of the evening however you see fit.

dayInfo.title: Mendoza – Discover the Andes on a Tour of the Region's Breathtaking Sights
dayInfo.description: Today you will discover that there is much more to Mendoza than merely the charming bodegas and plazas that you have experienced. After breakfast, you will be accompanied by your private tour guide in the lobby and will set out on an exciting day trip into the heart of the Andes mountains. Just a short drive outside the city, you will travel along Argentina’s famed Route 7, which is part of the Pan American Highway, where you will witness the many treasures that the Andes hold in store. On your tour, you will be provided with the opportunity to marvel at the glorious peak of Aconcagua, which is the tallest mountain outside of Asia. You can visit rustic mountain villages and towns before stopping to purchase souvenirs that have been crafted by local artisans. You will be delighted by breathtaking views of the expansive Andes mountains that seem to continue endlessly. Afterward, you can completely immerse yourself in the purity and rawness of the natural world that envelops you by discovering the world-famous Puente del Inca, which is a scenic bridge that was once remarked upon by Charles Darwin. After a full day of exploring the mountainous Andes region, you will be escorted back to your luxurious hotel, where you can take your time, basking a relaxing spa treatment or massage. If you are not feeling up to the spa, then you can continue to enjoy Mendoza at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Iguazu – View the Beauty of the Falls on a Romantic Helicopter Ride
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will need an early start as you depart for the airport and fly to Iguazu, which is the final stop on your whirlwind tour through Argentina. Upon arriving in Iguazu, you will be met by your private driver who will transfer you to your grand hotel that is not far from the falls. After you have had time to freshen up, you will meet your private tour guide in the hotel lobby for your transfer to the falls. Here, you will have the opportunity to view the magnificent Iguazu waterfalls from above as you delight in a romantic helicopter ride. As the falls form a natural boundary between Argentina and Brazil, you will have a bird’s eye view of both countries as you soar high above them with the loud whirring of the falls and the helicopter being the only discernible sounds. Upon the completion of your helicopter ride, you and your companion will be led down the base of the falls where you will board a boat that will take you as close to this natural wonder as is safely possible. Stunned by the magnitude and sheer power of the falls, you can reach out for your partner’s hand as you approach the dazzling, falling waters together. Afterward, you will be very glad to have been able to experience something so truly magnificent and natural, and you may even be in awe that nature could produce something so breathtaking.

dayInfo.title: Iguazu – Visit the Glorious Garganta del Diablo and Head for Home
dayInfo.description: Today will be your final morning in Argentina. After a hearty breakfast, you will join your tour guide in the lobby one last time, and they will transfer you to the mouth of La Garganta del Diablo, or the Devil’s Throat, which is the largest and most impressive of Iguazu’s waterfalls. Standing at the edge of the falls and gazing over the lookout point alongside your partner, you cannot help but begin to reminisce on your journey thus far in addition to being blown away by the sheer magnitude of the falls. Your guide will then return you to your hotel, where you will gather your things and prepare for your private transfer to the airport for your departing flight home.

tourName: 12-Day Argentina Tour: Culture, Wine, and the Southern Patagonian Scenery
placesVisited: Puerto Iguazú, Mendoza, El Calafate, Buenos Aires
generalInfo: Absorb Argentina’s captivating culture, indulge in the sensational wines of the Mendoza region, and soak up the icy scenery of Southern Patagonia during this 12-day introduction to Buenos Aires, Puerto Iguazú, Mendoza, and El Calafate. Your travels will take you to the snowy southern alps beneath the Andes, the rolling jade vineyards cascading Argentina’s countryside, and the country’s spirited capital city for complete immersion in South America.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - An Authentic Argentinian Family Dinner
dayInfo.description: Your Argentinian adventure will begin where all things start in the bubbly South American country, in its capital city Buenos Aires, a top metropolitan attraction that introduces travelers to the unique Argentinian atmosphere, historic marvels, and exquisite culinary culture that you will have the pleasure of experiencing each day in the capital. After arriving at the international airport, you will transfer to your hotel to drop off your luggage and then join a local guide for an authentic Argentinian family dinner party showcasing the friendly nature of the culinary lifestyle through warm conversations and as you learn to fold an empanada.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - Historic Charms at Beautiful Sites
dayInfo.description: You may enjoy a fine cup of coffee as you tuck into an assortment of sweet breakfast pastry treats lathered in dulce de leche, a typical Argentinian caramelized source that is smeared on just about everything. After breakfast, a guide will meet you near your accommodation and lead you on a tour through the capital to the reflective sculptural petals of the Floralis Genérica and the colorful flower arrangements of Paseo El Rosedal. You will wander through the beautiful and historical green space before you continue to Recoleta, Plaza de Mayo, Casa Rosada, and other fascinating neighborhoods.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Iguazú - Escape to Argentina’s Natural Paradise
dayInfo.description: A brief but brilliant stop in Buenos Aires will draw to a close as you savor a splendid breakfast spread from your accommodation’s terrace overlooking the action-packed neighborhood. You will then transfer to the airport and head for one of Argentina’s magnificent forested sanctuaries, Puerto Iguazú. The national park region boasts sensational sightseeing opportunities in an environment left to its own devices and teeming with wildlife as a result. You may spend your first afternoon and evening appreciating the far-flung charms of this secluded jungle paradise from your accommodation near the heart of the park.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Iguazú - See the Iguazú Falls from All Angles
dayInfo.description: A guide will collect you in the morning and show you through the greenery to one of the new seven wonders of nature, Iguazú Falls. The falls themselves are the highlight of the tour and breathtaking views from lofty decks of the enormous sheets of falling water releasing thick mist into the sky will be the reward for your journey. Endless rainbows will form over the Devil's Throat, wildlife will wander the lower walkways, and jet boats will zip under the falls. An ecological train ride is also included in your tour to see the wilderness from a unique perspective.

dayInfo.title: Mendoza - Make Memories in Argentina’s Wine Country
dayInfo.description: Argentina may not be the most notable wine destination on the planet, but the country is proving a strong contender as a flourishing wine producer thanks to the growing emphasis on the bountiful harvests of the Mendoza region. It is the heart of the country’s winemaking culture and you will have the pleasure of spending three days enjoying the views, wines, and history of the popular Argentinian city from a charming accommodation tucked away in a quiet neighborhood. Today, you may settle in and explore the lively streets around your accommodation to acclimate to the majesty of Mendoza.

dayInfo.title: Mendoza - All About Argentinian Wines in Mendoza
dayInfo.description: Today’s activity is one for the books, and you will be seduced by the sensations of Mendoza’s wine culture from the moment you join your guide and take the twists and turns of countryside roads alongside sublime vineyards with towering peaks in the distance. Your travels will take you to boutique wineries with humble histories and powerful production processes that are the reason behind their prestigious bottles, well-established estates with some of the best views of the valleys around Mendoza, and tour the cellars where exquisite Malbec and Cabernet Sauvignons age to be opened at a later date.

dayInfo.title: Mendoza - One-of-a-Kind Mendoza Moments
dayInfo.description: Mendoza’s wine heritage blends with its culinary heritage, and today you will explore the region’s connection to the local cuisine during a cooking class led by an experienced chef. Your day in the kitchen will be set amongst a productive vineyard that is the origin of a series of sumptuous wines. There are an array of signature dishes and specialties to prepare during your class, from the typically stuffed pastry known as an empanada to the staple steak sauce of chimichurri. Following your day cooking, you and your chef will tuck into your creations with a glass of wine.

dayInfo.title: El Calafate - Argentina’s Icy City Below the Andes
dayInfo.description: From the green pastures of Mendoza to the ice plains of El Calafate beneath the snowy alps of Southern Patagonia, your transfer this morning will share the incredible distinction in environments from one end of Argentina to the other. Beneath the powerful peaks of the Andes and surrounded by the rarely visited glaciers, your accommodation is a dream getaway from the hustle and bustle within one of the world’s most spectacular ice fortresses. Plenty of otherworldly outdoor adventures await, and you may enjoy a stroll to Laguna Nimez reserve after arriving to view flamingos, silvery grebes, black-necked swans, and more.

dayInfo.title: El Calafate - Adventure to the Perito Moreno Glacier
dayInfo.description: El Calafate is an entry point to the winter wonderland that is the Patagonia region sprawling the foothills of the world-famous Andes mountain range. Across the expanse of snowy plateaus and icy summits lies an impressive collection of glaciers and ice caves, namely the Perito Moreno Glacier. The glacier is an adventurer's surreal haven boasting sparkling glacial lagoons to cruise through, momentous icebergs that will crack and shift before your eyes, and sweeping snow plains painting the views in white and blue. The awe-inspiring tour will conclude in the early evening as the sun fades behind the snow-capped mountains.

dayInfo.title: El Calafate - Horse Riding in the Los Glaciares National Park
dayInfo.description: The high-altitude region surrounding El Calafate is mostly draped in snow and ice, but there are a series of towns and villages peppering the countryside that find themselves comfortably settled on green grass. One such site is a gorgeous Argentinian ranch where you will indulge in the regional cuisine and round up horses for a slow and stunning ride across the Rico River in the Los Glaciares National Park to viewpoints overlooking the postcard-perfect mountain scenery and picnic spots hidden beneath the shady trees.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - Memories Beneath Southern Patagonia
dayInfo.description: You will spend your morning beneath the icy summits of Southern Patagonia, an unbelievable backdrop to tours around the stunning landscape of El Calafate. You may use your free morning in the Patagonian region to explore as much as possible on your own, choosing from activities including hikes across the surreal grassy pastures of the Fitz Roy range and visiting a selection of culinary hotspots serving the finest Argentinian beef dishes smothered in tangy chimichurri, a traditional Argentinian sauce. In the afternoon, you will fly to Buenos Aires for your final evening in Argentina.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - Capital Dreams Before You Leave
dayInfo.description: Waking up on your final morning in Argentina will be bittersweet. You will be thrilled to have had adventures in the country’s best destinations, visiting iconic landmarks and cultural sites; however, you will feel somewhat sad to be saying your farewells. Fortunately, you may spend your last morning absorbing the sensational Argentinian atmosphere from a charming café in Buenos Aires. After breakfast, you may stroll the streets to gather trinkets and tokens remembering your adventure before you return to your hotel and transfer to the airport.

tourName: 12 Days of Adventures in Beautiful Argentina
placesVisited: Buenos Aires, Ushuaia, El Calafate, Puerto Iguazú
generalInfo: Venture to one of the most biodiverse regions in the world on a 12-day Argentina adventure. Immerse yourself in the hustle and bustle of city life, set against the backdrop of vibrant hues and colonial facades. Tap your feet to the lively rhythms of Argentina's famed tango music before taking off on the adventure of a lifetime in Patagonia and the majestic glaciers at El Calafate.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - Arrive and Enjoy Wondrous Argentina
dayInfo.description: Welcome to Argentina! Welcome to this illustrious South American country, home to Patagonia and bustling city life. Today, you will arrive at the Buenos Aires airport and be transferred to your downtown accommodation via private transportation. Enjoy the rest of the day at your own pace, exploring the city center. Marvel at the architecture, inspired by Spanish colonial design, and the bold pops of color on every street. Bargain shop at high-end designer stores or relax at an outdoor cafe. In the evening, you can try renowned Argentine beef, sizzling on an open parrilla.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - Cycle to the Enchanting Puerto Madero
dayInfo.description: Today, you'll join a private bike tour to visit the vibrant neighborhoods of San Telmo and La Boca, keeping up with urban life. Later, you'll peruse the illustrious Puerto Madero for city skyline views as sailboats bob in the distance. In the late evening, make your way back to the heart of the city for dinner along the cobbled streets of Montserrat.

dayInfo.title: Ushuaia - Welcome to Unique Ushuaia
dayInfo.description: Take flight on a new adventure to Argentina's most revered natural wonders. Fly to Ushuaia, a small town known for its indigenous heritage. Although it was officially incorporated into the Republic of Argentina in 1884, Ushuaia has long been home to the Yamanas, its first inhabitants, who named the town "protected bay” in their native language. You will have time to explore the town at your pace. Step inside several unique museums, including the Thematic Gallery of the Historia Fueguina. In the evening, you can indulge in a seafood dinner to embrace local cuisine including delicious black hake fish.

dayInfo.title: Ushuaia - Embark on a Trekking and Paddling Excursion
dayInfo.description: Lace up your hiking boots for a full-day excursion at Tierra del Fuego National Park. Meet your guide, then travel just 12km to one of the world’s most awe-inspiring national parks. You'll begin your hike at Ensenada Bay, where you'll catch a glimpse of the beautiful Beagle Channel before making your way to the coast. Later that afternoon, you'll arrive at La Roca, at an iridescent lake at the base of snow-capped mountains. Stop for lunch amidst the fascinating scenery before rounding out your trek at Lapataia Bay.

dayInfo.title: Ushuaia - Traverse Penguin Rookery and Beagle Channel
dayInfo.description: Take off the next morning on a day-long adventure at Harberton Ranch. You and your guide will first visit Beagle Channel, where you'll keep watch for rare bird species and listen for small mammals and reptiles in the shrubbery nearby. Along the way, you may make stops at Isla de los Pájaros , where you can spot a colony of Imperial cormorants and other native birds. As you visit Isla Martillo, you may hear barking seals and squawking gentoo penguins amid the smell of sea as you travel in the direction of Isla Martillo.

dayInfo.title: El Calafate - Welcome to Southern Patagonia
dayInfo.description: On Day 6, you'll move on to El Calafate, one of the most revered destinations in southern Patagonia. Home to the Perito Moreno Glacier, one of the only glaciers in the world that's still expanding, El Calafate is well known as the starting point for many adventure seekers hoping to uncover the natural wonders hidden throughout Patagonia. At the shore of Lago Argentino, El Calafate is also home to the Spegazzini Glacier, which divides Chile and Argentina. Finally, relax at an authentic finca , or ranch, as you look out on the green plains rolling into the horizon.

dayInfo.title: El Calafate - Spend a Full Day at Perito Moreno Glacier
dayInfo.description: Admire Patagonia's icy giants up close at Glaciers National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage site since 1981. Witness a breathtaking array of mesmerizing hues, from the crisp white Hielo Patagónico to the deep greens and blues of the Andes in the distance. You'll inch ever closer to the Perito Moreno Glacier for a view of Spegazzini and Upsala glaciers. You can also embark on a nautical safari tour, on which you'll marvel at the gigantic ice walls of Perito Moreno.

dayInfo.title: El Calafate - Relax at a Traditional Patagonian Ranch
dayInfo.description: Live life like a local today as you explore Patagonia’s estancias , an integral part of Argentine culture. Breathe in the crisp air of the Patagonian Steppe and admire the mountain peaks as alpaca graze in the distance and cowbells ring out from the hillsides. Explore the winding trails by foot or on horseback alongside your personal guide. Later, you'll learn more about the region's history and cultural heritage, including a horse-handling gaucho demonstration and a lesson about the village's primary occupation, sheep breeding.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Iguazu - Travel North to Puerto Iguazú
dayInfo.description: Travel to the airport with a private transfer to arrive at Puerto Iguazú, a small border town and home to Iguazú Falls, one of the world’s seven natural wonders. Spend the day deep within the lush jungle foliage where you may visit the Hito Tres Fronteras, the border where Paraguay, Uruguay, and Argentina meet. Listen to the churning waters and energetic coos of tropical birds as you walk through the local market where locals often display their artisan crafts.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Iguazú - Trek through Iguazu National Park
dayInfo.description: Your adventure continues today as you trek through Igauzú National Park to explore endless walking trails, waterfalls, and wildlife. Your guide will provide you with complimentary binoculars so that together, you'll spot fascinating wildlife including toucans, monkeys, or even native coatis, marked by their long, striped tails. You'll soon make your way to the Garganta del Diablo for a look at the magnificent falls raging below. Traverse the wooden walkways for unique perspectives of wildlife and vegetation.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - Explore Iguazú National Park and Parque Das Aves
dayInfo.description: Set off for the Brazilian border. You'll board private transportation en route to Parque de Aves for one-of-a-kind birdwatching. Here, you'll see colorful species native to the most-southern regions of the continent, including toucans, parrots, and more. Later, you'll explore the Brazilian region of the Iguazú National Park for more incredible views of the massive, cascading falls. Feel the cool splash against your face as you get closer and closer to the epicenter of Devil's Throat and the crashing waters below. Return to Buenos Aires in the evening.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: Your Argentine adventure comes to a close today. In the weeks to come, you'll remember the frenetic energy of Buenos Aires; the crisp, cool air in El Calafate at the Perito Moreno glaciers; and the relentless cries of tropical birds and cascading waters of Puerto Iguazú. In the morning, after breakfast, you'll be greeted by your private transport and accompanied to the regional airport where you'll catch your flight home. Perhaps you'll spend your return flight planning a return to Argentina.

tourName: 14-Day Guided Tour of Argentina for Seniors
placesVisited: Buenos Aires, Patagonia, Bariloche, Mendoza
generalInfo: On this 14-Day Argentina tour for seniors, you can revel in true extravagance as you traverse the country at your leisure, pausing to relax and appreciate the finer things in life. Savor an Argentine steak with a glass of Malbec or tap your foot to the rhythm as tango dancers move with precision to the sensual beat. This is Argentina as you always hoped it would be: traditional and exciting.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – Private City Tour and Tango Show
dayInfo.description: Often referred to as the “Paris of South America,” Buenos Aires is truly among the loveliest and most dazzling cities in Argentina and is the perfect starting point for your tour of the country. You will arrive in Buenos Aires and be met at the airport by your private driver who will transfer you to your luxurious, 5-star accommodation in one of the city’s most charming neighborhoods. Once you have had time to settle in, your private guide will collect you from your hotel for an introductory city tour via private coach. On your tour, your experienced guide will make sure to hit all the highlights of this fabulous city, including a visit to the famed Recoleta Cemetery, which is the final resting place of Eva Perón. Your guide will take you through Palermo to view the lovely Bosques de Palermo, which can be compared to New York’s Central Park. You will tour the city center and have an opportunity to visit the Casa Rosada, which is the executive mansion of the President of Argentina. After your tour, you will have the chance to freshen up before meeting your private driver in the hotel lobby who will escort you to a world-class tango show that will be accompanied by a gourmet and traditional Argentine dinner.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – Visit Barrio La Boca and Enjoy a Spectacle at Teatro Colon
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will wake up to a delicious breakfast at your hotel before meeting your private guide in the lobby for a tour of one of Buenos Aires’ most colorful and vivacious neighborhoods: La Boca. You will stroll through the lively streets as tango dancers break out into impromptu shows all around you. You will also be enticed by friendly shop owners who may call out for you to come inside and take a look at their trinkets. You will even notice the children as they kick around a soccer ball in a local field, and you will immerse yourself in the true culture of Buenos Aires’ daily life. After you have had a look around, you will enjoy lunch at one of the many splendid restaurants that line the neighborhood’s main drag. Delicious Argentine delicacies are served by each restaurant, and you be delighted by the live tango shows that take place on their outdoor patios. After your private driver has returned you to your hotel, you can explore the area a bit on your own with recommendations from your local guide. The Palermo neighborhood is full of charming cafes, unique boutiques, art galleries, bars, and restaurants, making it the ideal location to meander around in your free time. In the evening, you will meet your driver at the hotel and delight in a sensational show at the world-famous Teatro Colón Opera House. Here, you will delight in the interesting architecture and intricate designs of the building’s domed roof before enjoying the world-class spectacle that awaits you.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – Explore the Famed San Telmo Open-Air Market
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will enjoy a traditional Argentine breakfast of facturas, which are pastries that have been covered in powdered sugar and typically filled with sweet, thick dulce de leche. You may also indulge in a coffee or mate, the typical Argentine drink of choice, which is a strong and highly caffeinated tea that requires a bit of an acquired taste. Your private guide will pick you up at your hotel to start your day with a visit to the famed San Telmo open-air market. San Telmo is one of the oldest and most historical neighborhoods in Buenos Aires, and your guide will elaborate on its fascinating history. The weekly market brings fresh energy to this district, offering tourists and locals alike the chance to enjoy traditional Argentine delicacies, music, tango, and artifacts that have been crafted by local artisans. As you wander through the teeming market, stopping to admire a booth of paintings by a local artist, you may smell the sweet aroma of Argentine Parilla , or barbeque, and decide to stop for lunch. Here, you can sip a freshly squeezed orange juice from one of the market’s many vendors and enjoy the sunny afternoon at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Los Glaciares National Park – Day One of Luxury Cruise
dayInfo.description: Today, you will wake up early and be met by your private driver who will transfer you to the airport for a quick flight to El Calafate, which is one of the main entry points into Patagonia. Here, your driver will leave you at the port where you will board a luxurious small boat for your two-night boat cruise through Los Glaciares National Park. On this cruise, you will have the opportunity to view El Perito Moreno, one of the world’s most notable remaining glaciers that is expanding rather than receding. You will have the opportunity to get up close to the fantastic glacial ice fields and experience parts of the park that is typically inaccessible to other visitors.

dayInfo.title: Los Glaciares National Park – Enjoy Night Two of Your Luxury Cruise Through Patagonia
dayInfo.description: You will wake on the boat to enjoy the second day of your deluxe cruise through the lakes and canals of Los Glaciares National Park. You will luxuriate in a gourmet breakfast before preparing for the day’s host of activities. The expert crew will educate you with details of the surrounding environment and regional wildlife as you continue to cruise through this impressive area. The boat will stop at various landing points, allowing you the opportunity to disembark and explore the area on guided nature walks to overlook points with ideal views of the infamous glaciers. View the distinguished Upsala Glacier up close, you will enjoy being immersed in the incredible natural environment. Close your eyes as you listen to the wind as it rustles through the trees with the sounds of wildlife, reminding you how very far away you are from the stress and worry of your regular life. You can look over the seemingly endless ice fields as your boat gently cruises alongside them and be amazed by the massive Andes mountains that surround you as you glide through the crystal-clear waters of the Patagonian lakes.

dayInfo.title: El Calafate - Patagonia at Your Leisure
dayInfo.description: After disembarking from your cruise, your private driver will meet you for your scenic, one-and-a-half-hour transfer to Bariloche, which is located in Patagonia’s distinguished Lake District. Your driver will make stops along the way at the notable sites, offering information about each place and the opportunity to take photos. Driving through the vast countryside of Patagonia with the snow-capped Andes mountains looming on all sides, you will notice the herds of sheep that lazily graze in fields, which will seem to expand for miles. You can absorb the gorgeous scenery that surrounds you on this tour, and discover delicious meals to delight your inner foodie.

dayInfo.title: Bariloche – Bask in Breathtaking Natural Landscapes
dayInfo.description: You will fly to Bariloche, and your private transfer will escort you to a pristine mountain lodge equipped with fantastic views of the lakes and mountains for which the Lake District is renowned. You will notice that Bariloche is reminiscent of Germany’s Bavaria, and the snowy peaks of the Andes even earned it the nickname the “Swiss Alps of South America.” Your private driver will leave you in the town of Bariloche where you can relax among breathtaking views of this charming town that is nestled within the mountains.

dayInfo.title: Bariloche – Enjoy a Day Cruise of the Lake District
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will wake up to a delicious breakfast at your mountain lodge and meet your private guide in the lobby to begin your day of activities. Today, you will have the opportunity to explore the Lake District by boat, which is the most classic way to appreciate the true natural beauty of the region. You will board the boat for a day-cruise, disembarking for guided hikes through the glittering terrain, where you will discover the allure of Bariloche at a leisurely pace. At the completion of your day’s cruise, your driver will return you to your lodge.

dayInfo.title: Bariloche - Exploring the Differences of Patagonia
dayInfo.description: For a unique view of Patagonia, you can spend time visiting El Bolosn to sample the rich cheeses and crisp beers taken from the German tradition with organic farms blossoming along the edges of the lake. You could also spend more time in Bariloche's chocolate shops to discover and admire a tradition of decadent flavors that celebrate both a local and international heritage. In the evening, settle in to watch the sunset from your hotel with a glass of Argentine wine in hand to reflect on the wonders of the day.

dayInfo.title: Mendoza – Take a Private Tour of Local Bodegas With a Curated Wine Tasting
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will have an early breakfast and meet your private driver at your hotel for your transfer to the airport, which is where you will board a short flight to Mendoza, Argentina’s esteemed winemaking region. Upon settling in at your boutique wine lodge and spa accommodation, you will be met in the lobby by your knowledgeable guide who will lead you on a wonderful tour of Mendoza’s best local bodegas or wineries. You will learn about the winemaking process from families that have been doing it for generations and have a passion for their craft, which becomes immediately transparent upon hearing their stories. After visiting several bodegas, you will be treated to a specially curated wine tasting and have the opportunity to sample some of the finest wines in the world. Swirling a glass of sweet, dark Argentinian Malbec wine against the backdrop of endless picturesque vineyards, you can delight in every sip that you drain from your glass. Allowing the soft tannins to wash over your tongue, you will be convinced that this is genuinely one of the most beautiful places on Earth. In scenic, peaceful wine country, everything else seems to melt away, and you are free to live in the moment and indulge in the treasures of this fantastic country.

dayInfo.title: Mendoza – A Day Trip to The Andes
dayInfo.description: Today, prepare to traverse Mendoza’s beautiful countryside as you are taken by private coach deep into the Andes mountains. You will find yourself awestruck as you drive through the winding roads of Argentina’s Route 7, which is part of the famed Pan-American Highway. You will have the opportunity to view the mighty peak of Aconcagua, which is the highest mountain on the continent. Your knowledgeable guide will delight you with information about the region, offering an insider’s perspective into this natural wonderland. You will stop at noteworthy sites along the way such as Uspallata, which is an enchanting mountain town with extraordinary views of the alpines, and the renowned Puente del Inca, which is a colorful, natural rock bridge across the Vacas River that was once explored by Charles Darwin. As you arrive at the lookout point for snowy Aconcagua mountain, you will marvel at its sheer magnitude and imposing stature. Your guide may ask you to close your eyes and just listen. The sounds of wind and wildlife will be heightened as you shut off your other senses, and the aura of the natural world as it surrounds you becomes palpable. You will open your eyes and gaze around at the breathtaking landscape, feeling so small among nature’s brilliance. After the tour, your private driver will return you to your hotel, where you will have the chance to enjoy your boutique hotel’s spa at your leisure. If a spa day does not entice you, then you can venture to town for dinner at one of the superb restaurants that are recommended by your tour guide.

dayInfo.title: Mendoza – Delight in a Final Stroll Through Mendoza and Return Home
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will awaken for breakfast and take the morning to admire the landscape and explore the town of Mendoza once more. You can choose a scenic cafe to revel in the tranquility of the town at your leisure. As you sit next to your travel companions, you will begin to reminisce on your marvelous journey. The days is yours to embrace the life and beauty of your surroundings by lounging in natural hot springs with a view of the natural arid landscape. If you prefer more adventure, you can venture out of town on horseback.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - Return to the City of Tango
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you can look around you at breakfast and take in the snow-capped Andes against the charming dirt roads and vineyards of Mendoza. You may realize that this has truly been the trip of a lifetime before meeting your private driver who will meet you at your hotel. You will have help to collect your things and be transferred to the airport for your return flight to Buenos Aires. The remainder of the day will be at your leisure to enjoy the beauty of the city at your pace.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, you may find the aromas of medialunas or alfajores in the dining room providing a sweet scene to the dining room of your hotel. When you are ready, you will transfer to the airport for your flight home to officially bring an end to your discovery of Argentina. You may have uncovered new ways to enjoy the beauty and simple pleasures of daily life that you can take home with you as you return home.

tourName: 8-Day Introduction to the Sumptuous Flavors of Argentinian Food and Wine
placesVisited: Puerto Iguazú, Mendoza, Buenos Aires
generalInfo: Introduce your palate to the sumptuous flavors of traditional food and wine on this extravagant 8-day Argentina culinary. Indulge in dinners with views of the rainforest, sip a selection of South America’s finest wines at exemplary estates in the Wine Country, or savour traditional Asado as tango dancers twirl the night away. No matter your travel preferences, this culinary experience is tailored to your tastes.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Iguazú - Argentinian Dinner with Forest Views
dayInfo.description: Countless waterfalls flow in the forests flanking Iguazú National Park, the destination where your Argentinian adventure will begin. Recognized as one of the seven Natural Wonders of the World, Iguazú Falls is a dream experience for you to relish during your stay at accommodation nestled in the flourishing rainforest. After arriving, you may admire the astonishing natural surroundings of colorful birds that sing from the canopy and monkeys that leap from branches. As the sun goes down and the nocturnal creatures take over the forest, you will tuck into a delicious Argentinian dinner with views of the sweeping greenery.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Iguazú - Dramatic Scenes of the Devil’s Throat
dayInfo.description: Today’s tour after breakfast brings with it the opportunity to see the immense Iguazú Falls up close from observation points peppering the Argentinian rainforest. Your guide will lead you through the thick jungle-clad landscape along wooden and concrete walkways that weave between the lower and upper sections of the Iguazú River. These pathways veer off the beaten path and will escort you to a lofty landscape viewpoint overlooking the famous Devil's Throat. Rainbows form in the mist that hangs over the enormous blankets of falling water, providing endless photographic moments. Your expedition includes an ecological train and jet-boat ride.

dayInfo.title: Mendoza - Decadent Dining in the City
dayInfo.description: Mendoza is Argentina’s hallmark Wine Country, with elaborate estates stretching across the emerald valleys surrounding the city’s modern and historic neighborhoods. Productive vineyards in the green oasis produce some of South America’s finest wines, with Malbec and Cabernets from the breathtaking region famously awarded. You will arrive in the late hours of the morning and transfer to accommodation in the heart of Mendoza’s historic district. Here, you will appreciate the views of mountainous peaks and dine on gourmet cuisine paired with sensational wines at decadent restaurants in and around the city.

dayInfo.title: Mendoza - Wandering Argentina’s Wine Country
dayInfo.description: You will join Mendoza locals this morning after breakfast on a quick sightseeing tour of the city’s culinary markets, then meet your wine guide for an afternoon sipping on South America’s best varietals and vintages. Three phenomenal wine estates, with vineyards thriving across the vast landscape in the shadows of mountain summits, will invite you to explore the depth of flavor of Argentinian wines. Barreled Merlots, sparkling Chardonnays, and rich Cabernet Sauvignons are a few highlight wines on the sommeliers’ menus, each perfectly paired with regional delicacies and accompanied by beautiful landscape views.

dayInfo.title: Mendoza - Cycling Through the Wine Country
dayInfo.description: There is even more to Mendoza than meets the eye, and you will uncover more of the magnificent region’s beauty up close on a cycling tour of the Wine Country. You will pedal past lush vineyards that veil the countryside, up dusty trails to panoramic viewpoints, and down to wine estates nestled between the rolling hills. Your casual cruise through the countryside will take you to a selection of pristine wine producers in picturesque parts of Mendoza, where you will learn about the unique winemaking process, sip sumptuous Malbecs and other varietals, and soak up the stunning scenery.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - Relish Authentic Argentinian Asado
dayInfo.description: Your Argentinian wine and food tour will conclude in the country’s capital city, Buenos Aires. A guide will greet you at the airport and you will transfer to accommodation in the middle of the bustling city. You may take some time to unwind, explore the vibrant neighborhoods, and watch tango performers twirl and twist in colorful town squares. In the evening, you will join local culinary experts for a traditional Argentinian dinner. You will chat about local culinary traditions and share stories, while making empanadas , and tucking into a classic Argentinian Asado .

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - Dazzling Cultural Discoveries in the Capital
dayInfo.description: Buenos Aires provides travelers with a taste of Argentina’s diverse culture and you will explore the unique charms of the capital city on a tour today. You will smell the fragrant flowers blossoming at the Paseo El Rosedal rose garden, wander the historic Plaza de Mayo town square, watch tango dancers perform in La Boca, and admire the city’s grand opera house, Teatro Colón, before the afternoon sun dips. In the evening, you will watch an award-winning El Cabaret show, complete with a live orchestra, exquisite Argentinian cuisine, and a brilliant selection of local wines.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - Seduced by Argentinian Culture
dayInfo.description: Your tour of Argentina comes to an end in the capital city, where you will spend your final morning immersing yourself in the local spirit at markets, museums, and plazas. You will explore the dazzling trinkets on display at boutique stalls, browse the evocative exhibits of iconic galleries, and wander the lush lawns of parklands nearby town squares, where tango performers entertain in the morning. A chance to absorb the cultural charms of Buenos Aires on your final day will curtain-call a fabulous wine and food tour, from Puerto Iguazú to Mendoza and the capital city.

tourName: A Perfect Wine Tour of Argentina & Chile: Mendoza, Maipo Valley & San Antonio Valley
placesVisited: Santiago, Maipo Valley, San Antonio Valley, Mendoza, Uco Valley
generalInfo: The sun shines with a remarkable radiance, as Andean peaks loom large over the lush vineyards outside Santiago, Chile and Mendoza, Argentina. Your custom tailored tour immerses you in the flavors of the countryside that have been shaped by the unique properties of the soil. Search for aromas of chocolate, tobacco, and plum drifting from your glass. Touch your fingers to the rugged earth and trace the waxy skin of grapes dangling off the vines. From enriching wine to traditional tastes of regional cuisine, you will discover majesty in the landscape and excitement in the distinctive flavors during your perfect wine tour of Chile and Argentina.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Welcoming Santiago
dayInfo.description: Santiago is a dynamic capital city in its culture and landscape, with skyscrapers rising to meet the bordering peaks of the Andes Mountains and riverbeds separating the neighborhoods, each distinct with its own character. Sycamore trees line the wide boulevards, and the aroma of fresh produce emanates from avenues besides the Central Market. Vendors offer stunning fresh-made juices with flavors such as passion fruit and strawberry or cherry with orange and lime. Fishmongers inside the Central Market provide tremendous sea bass and decadent oysters caught earlier that morning. Your flight lands at Comodoro Arturo Benitez International Airport, where your private transfer greets you upon your arrival. Take the time to enjoy the comforts of your luxurious hotel at the heart of the city. The remainder of the day is at your leisure. Locals make their way to the celebrated shopping district of Vitacura. Trees shade the wide boulevards and gardens decorate the landscape in view of the rolling mountains. Joggers cherish the fresh air and couples walk their dogs through the park-like landscape. Bakeries fill the air with the scent of freshly baked crispy bread in the shape of rolls, known as marraquetas , as geese linger on the grass near the shores of a quiet pond beside the facades of the designer boutiques.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Promise of the Chilean Vine
dayInfo.description: The morning light washes over the cream-colored façade of La Moneda, the presidential palace, and seat of the Chilean government. Your guide greets you in the hotel lobby after breakfast and escorts you on a half-day informative tour of the city, beginning at La Moneda. The structure was erected in the early 19th century as the mint but became the residence for the president by the mid-1800s. The stone is colored with chalk from San Cristobal and bricks baked from a town outside of Santiago. Cypress and oak trees shade the forecourt plaza offering views to the balconies and windows along the façade. After exploring the city, you continue your introduction to the history of Chile at one of the largest wine producers in the country, where a single estate covers more than 21 acres. The vineyard was established in the late 19th century with grapes brought from Bordeaux, France. The winery continues to produce wines with Old World tradition and New World forethought. The manor resembles a Tuscan villa on the mountain chain overlooking the Santiago. Walk along the vines with your guide and dig your fingers into the soil to feel the rugged quality of the rocky terrain. The minerals in the soil, and the struggles of the vine provide the wines with a unique, flavorful profile. In the tasting room, you have a lavish view of the estate. Your guide pours a sample of the Shiraz. The scents of blackberry and cedar drift upwards from the deep red hues. The soft tannins coat your palate for a balanced finish of the toasted wood.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Varietals of the Maipo Valley
dayInfo.description: The morning light spreads through the streets of the Bellavista neighborhood, known best as the site for Pablo Neruda’s home of La Chascona. The peak of Cerro San Cristobal casts a slight shadow over the neighborhood, but locals enjoy the arcades and boutique shops of Patio Bellavista. Small art galleries fill the windows with vibrant displays of Chilean aesthetic and the aroma of coffee with steamed milk drifts past the red façade of the Castillo Rojo, a charming hotel boutique hotel built in the 1920s. Your guide escorts you out of Santiago for the day and into the gorgeous landscape of the Maipo Valley, the oldest wine region in the country. The French-inspired vineyards became popular more than 150 years ago, producing fabulous Cabernet Sauvignon and delectable Carménère. Boutique wineries have emerged to rival the renowned vineyards of the valley, utilizing the tougher soils of the higher altitude of the Andes foothills, approximately 2,500 feet above sea level. You make your way to an estate opened in the late 19th century and offering superb craftsmanship of Old World wines. The grapes on the vine have a waxy, timid texture. The cellar is cool and contains the aromas of oak and stone. In the tasting room, you have a view of the slopes leading down toward the valley floor. Your guide pours a sample of the Cabernet Sauvignon grown on the property. You find an aroma of plum and rosemary mixed with vanilla and clove. An expressive balance of flavors lingers on your tongue with a bold and fruity body.

dayInfo.title: Santiago – Enticed by Well-Rounded Flavor
dayInfo.description: The Central Market brims with people wandering the aisles in search of fresh mussels and delicate sea bass. Fishmongers call out to passersby with promises of flavor and gigantic crab. Cheese mongers offer samples while fruit vendors display ripening cherries and zesty oranges. Your guide meets you at the hotel and leads you to the endless rolling greenery of the San Antonio Valley. The region is known for producing lavish Pinot Noir, light Sauvignon Blanc, and buttery Chardonnay. Wineries in the valley have taken the experience on step further, offering luscious pairings of their celebrated wines with traditional-inspired dishes. At lunch, you venture to a state-of-the-art estate utilizing steps to produce organic wines along with special-made sheep’s cheeses. The manor blends into the natural landscape allowing gravity to optimize the growth and harvest of the grapes in various phases. After harvest, farmers pick through the grape bunches and stems by hand, choosing the best grapes to process. Wander along the stainless steel tanks and into the stunning wine cellar. The temperature, humidity, and access to light are controlled to ensure perfect conditions. The scent of French oak fills the cellar. In the tasting room, your guide offers an array of cheeses paired with each wine you sample, leading to the light bodied and fruity Pinot Noir.

dayInfo.title: Mendoza – Chilean Charm to Elegant Argentina
dayInfo.description: A restored antique home in Barrio Italia fills the streets with the rich scent of roasted coffee beans from Brazil and Nicaragua. Locals enjoy the full body and decadent flavor of the slowly roasted beans accompanied by a sweet pastry stuffed with orange cream. After breakfast, your private transfer meets you at the hotel and escorts you to the airport for your flight to Mendoza, Argentina. You ascend over the Andes Mountains during your brief transfer, landing at Governor Francisco Gabrielli International Airport. The graceful city resembles a serene town in the South of France with wide, shaded boulevards, regal plazas adorned with trickling fountains, and the aroma of spiced chocolate emanating from the numerous confectionaries. Cafes place tables and chairs along the walkways for locals to enjoy the cool breeze and the bustling movement along the streets. After settling into the comforts of your centrally located hotel, your guide leads you on a private introductory tour of the city, beginning at Parque General San Martin.
