dayInfo.description: Today, you will enjoy your final breakfast in Argentina before spending the morning exploring the city as a family. You can stroll through the city’s charming streets once more and sit at a charming cafe to enjoy a final factura or sip of mate . Before you know it, you will have to return to your hotel to gather your belongings and meet your private driver in the lobby for your transfer to the airport.

tourName: Learning to Tango in Buenos Aires Tour
placesVisited: Buenos Aires
generalInfo: The air is sharp and crisp, and somewhere deep within you something stirs. The music starts with characteristic flair and the dancers file onto the floor. The scene is set, the players in position, the hours of practice flowing to your brain as you grab your partner and set off on an adventure of rhythm and movement. This learning to tango in Buenos Aires tour is beyond anything you’ve ever imagined.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – Bienvenidos a Argentina!
dayInfo.description: Touch down just outside breathtaking Buenos Aires, the capital of Argentina, where Old World style and New World charm come together to form one of the world’s great cities. Upon arriving at the airport, a private driver will take you to your luxurious, elegant, and perfectly located hotel, where you’ll find the services are as excellent as the furnishings. After dropping off your bags and recovering from your trip, you can set out for your first look at this incredible urban conglomeration, the home to brilliant culture and a singular ambiance: you’ll find yourself falling quickly in love with the rapid lilt of castellano , the smell of the city’s many parrillas and the quick and easy smiles of the locals.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – A Day of Discovery in the Paris of Latin America
dayInfo.description: After a hearty breakfast, you’ll be led on a private tour of dazzling Buenos Aires, hitting the highlights of this marvelous world capital and learning about its fascinating history. Begin at the famous Plaza de Mayo, the political center of the country for more than a century, where protests have been held for decades and where the elite meet to determine the country’s fate. You’ll see the belle-époque stylings of Buenos Aires City Hall, the numerous political monuments dedicated to the great events and leaders in Argentine history, and the executive mansion of the President of Argentina, popularly known as the Casa Rosada. From here, you can stroll down the famed Avenida 9 de Julio, one of the city’s main thoroughfares and the widest avenue on Earth. Walk by the soaring Obelisk and the stirring Plaza de la Republica before visiting the incredible Teatro Colon, Buenos Aires’s main opera house and one of the five best concert venues in the world. Then turn onto sensational Avenida Corrientes, where the tango and porteno identity seem to fill the air all around you. Check out Florida Street – a pedestrian-only street that features some of the city’s best shopping – before visiting one of the avenue’s excellent restaurants or cafes. After experiencing Buenos Aires on a large scale, you’ll slip back into the quieter, more remote barrios as you make your way to the famous neighborhood of La Boca, ground zero for the country’s massive Italian immigration and a place that truly reflects the city’s passion and pride. The storefronts are brightly colored and inviting, history fills the streets and alleyways, and you might just see a couple of amateur tango dancers showcasing their skills at Argentina’s national dance. This evening gives you a chance to see the tango in a unique and unforgettable way, as you’ll enjoy a traditional Argentine Asado while you take in all of the heat and fervor of an underground tango show. As you sip your perfectly balanced Malbec, you’ll feel inspired to try this irresistible dance for yourself; and, soon enough, you’ll get that chance.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – Learning the Steps and Looking Sharp
dayInfo.description: This morning features your first foray into the tango, as you’ll go to the studio for your introductory lessons to this captivating and sultry dance. Learn the rhythms of the music and the elementary steps, feel the beat and desire fill your heart and limbs, and discover how intricately linked the tango is to the very history of this bustling and beautiful city. Each step will bring you closer to authentic Argentina, and every dip and slip and shimmy is sure to excite you and inspire you to keep learning. After a delicious lunch, you’ll hit the city’s best shopping streets, on the lookout for the gear that will help you look as good as you feel, the clothing and shoes that will fill you the confidence needed to tango like a pro. You’ll enjoy the rare treat of buying authentic Rio de la Plata tango garb, and you might even get a chance to do some non-tango shopping as well: Murillo Street near Palermo is home to a wide array of leather houses (where you’ll find some of the very best leather goods on the planet), Palermo Viejo is a district that exudes the youthful vigor and style of SoHo, and book lovers simply must visit El Ateneo, a theater-cum-bookstore that has been lauded as one of the most beautiful shops of its kind in the world.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – The City’s Environs and an Evening at a Milonga
dayInfo.description: Today, you head out to the surrounding countryside for a visit to a village that will transport you to a different place, a different time and, seemingly, a completely different world. Board the picturesque Tren de la Costa as you wind your way along the Rio de la Plata, cruising past areas of supreme natural splendor and cultural significance before alighting in the town of Tigre, where you’ll encounter some of the most gorgeous architecture in the country. Marvel at the incredible opulence of the Tigre Municipal Museum of Fine Art, the imposing and impeccable La Marina Regata Club, and the Bavarian-inspired Argentine rowing club before setting to the waves on board a sleek and beautiful sailboat. With the mid-morning sun shining serenely off the dazzling waters of the river, the entire area is basked in color and light, making for a truly memorable scene. Return to the city for the afternoon for lunch and a scenic walk before continuing your tango lessons in the heat of the night and the smoky haze of a famed milonga , a Buenos Aires dance hall that is one of the great social meeting places in the city. Novices and experts alike glide across the floor in poise and practiced grace, swaying to the tandas of the tango and the milonga, the atmosphere replete with the aching demands of the rhythm and the ceaseless joys of the dance.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – Practice Makes Perfect
dayInfo.description: The morning sees you back at the studio and ready for more, inspired by your spectacular evening at the milonga and the promises of continued improvement. You’ll find yourself falling easily into the flow of the tango, improvising steps in true Argentine passion, dipping and tapping and retreating and twirling with the acquired ease brought by skilled supervision. The warmth of familiarity is sure to draw you even deeper into the tango’s inescapable web of allure, and you’re sure to leave your lessons with a spring in your step. The afternoon is yours to your leisure – perhaps set out for the serene and scenic barrio of Recoleta, where the wide and verdant expanse of city parks mingles with the mansions and townhomes of the city’s elite – before an evening packed with adventure and excitement. Don your concert clothes and head out to another of the city’s renowned tango clubs, where you’ll enjoy a perfectly grilled cut of the finest steak in the world and the faultless flawless movements of some of the city’s greatest tango artists. From the pulsing beat of the tango band to the succulent finish of an Argentine wine, this evening is an exercise in excess.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – Feeling the Passion of Argentina’s National Dance
dayInfo.description: Another morning, another practice session as you find yourself getting better and more confident by the minute. You’ll find the advanced moves of the tango challenging and rewarding, testing your newfound skills and your innate creativity as you gradually discover how to move your body in the sure and supple ways the creator intended. You’ll draw motivation from the moves you’ve seen over the past few days, and you’ll notice yourself growing bolder and more adventurous with each new tune. This afternoon, head to the renewed and refurbished port of Buenos Aires, the Puerto Madero, where you’ll find upscale restaurants and hotels, daring and delightful architecture, and the beautiful Reserva Ecologica Costanera Sur, a must-see destination for any and all nature lovers. The evening sees you back at one of Buenos Aires’s celebrated milongas , where you’ll dance the night away in true porteno style.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – Graduation and a Grand Evening
dayInfo.description: Your final day of lessons concludes this morning in grand fashion, as you’ll set out to apply everything you’ve learned these past five days to music and dance as you’ve never danced before. The end of your lessons are punctuated by a celebration of all of your hard work, reminiscences on the setbacks and successes of the past few days, and even a personalized diploma documenting your unforgettable journey from tango novice to tango master. This evening, celebrate your last evening in Argentina in high style as you visit one of the city’s very best restaurants. Puerto Madero offers a number of excellent establishments specializing in cuisines all across the culinary spectrum, highlighted by Restaurantino & Cafetino, an elegant Italian spot where the quality of the service is exceeded only by the quality of the fare. You might also consider a visit to Rodizio, widely acknowledged as the very best place to get a steak in the city: the restaurant has three prime locations, with its Costanera Norte branch offering truly awe-inspiring views to the coast of the river.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – Saying Goodbye to Buenos Aires
dayInfo.description: This afternoon, after one final morning of leisure in Buenos Aires, you’ll be transferred to the airport in plenty of time to board the flight that will take you back home. You’ll be filled with the lessons you’ve learned and the memories you’ve made, charmed by the people you’ve met and all of the many places you’ve visited, and driven by plans to return to this captivating country.

tourName: Lovers' Escape to Argentina & Chile: Breathtaking Moments to Romantic Seclusions
placesVisited: Buenos Aires, Iguazu, Bariloche, Puerto Varas, Puerto Natales
generalInfo: You deserve a romantic getaway to breathtaking landscapes and unforgettable passion embodied in the majesty of Argentina and Chile. Your custom tailored tour whisks you away on an exotic escape to the elegant streets of Buenos Aires and the remote beauty of Patagonia. Traverse the landscape to discover hanging glaciers. Kayak on the reflective waters of a sapphire-colored lake. Bask in the flavors of decadent chocolate and the passionate rhythm of tango. From the woods of Bariloche to the shores of the Strait of Magellan, you will indulge in a decadent romance with Argentina and Chile.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – Beauty in Buenos Aires
dayInfo.description: Buenos Aires is a city of passion with romance emanating from the colonial buildings and echoing the sounds of tango. Oak and sycamore trees shade the quiet boulevards of the Recoleta district and artists capture the movement of the bustling cobbled promenades in the neighborhood of La Boca. Your flight lands at Ministro Pistarini International Airport. Your private transfer greets you and your loved one upon your arrival, escorting you to a luxurious hotel situated in a renovated palace originally constructed in the 1930s. The comforts of your room offer modern amenities with a secluded view over the blossoming garden. The remainder of the day is yours to enjoy the remarkable streets of the city, from the cobbled lanes and antique shops in the San Telmo neighborhood to the dramatic window displays of the boutiques on Calle Florida. In the evening, the aroma of slow-cooked duck confit and beef slowly braised in sugar cane and coffee grounds emanates from an isolated restaurant. The captivating ambiance and decadent cuisine fusing traditional Argentine flavors with South American flair keep locals returning and visitors eager to bask in the restaurant’s hidden charms.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – Splendors of South America’s Paris
dayInfo.description: The sunlight washes over the mixture of art nouveau and neo-classical architecture decorating the city streets. The aroma of freshly brewed coffee emanates from a popular café located inside a former theater. The grand interior contains a gorgeous bookshop offering rows of hidden niches settled amongst gilded moldings as the café sits on the vintage stage overlooking the gallery. Your guide greets you in the hotel lobby after breakfast and eagerly escorts you on an unforgettable tour of Buenos Aires, which is often referred to as the “Paris of South America.” The Presidential Palace known as Casa Rosada frames the edge of the Plaza de Mayo. The square was established in the 16th century and connects to the grand shopping arcades of Calle Florida and Calle Lavalle. The rosy hue of the president’s home glimmers in the sunlight. You can easily imagine Eva Perón, a popular former First Lady of Argentina also known as Evita, addressing large crowds from the arched terrace along the second-story. In the evening, you meet your private tango instructor, keen on learning the movements of the renowned dance of love. Your instructor guides you both through the movements, focusing on the importance of the rhythm, the embrace, and the understanding of each other’s bodies.

dayInfo.title: Iguazu – Verdant Parks to Jade Jungles
dayInfo.description: The artistry of Buenos Aires spreads from the museums to the open parks offering comfortable spaces for locals to escape the bustling urbanity. Modern sculptures adorn the verdant grasses resembling flowers in bloom against a backdrop of neo-baroque fountains. Porteños , Buenos Aires locals, wander along the 19th-century Botanic Gardens, which houses more than 5,000 different floral species spread across 20 acres of French, Italian, and Japanese-styled gardens. The aroma of buttery, browned dough emanates from cafes and restaurants across the city, with each displaying fresh empanadas in the windows. Your private transfer greets you at the hotel and escorts you to the airport for your flight north to Iguazu. The rainforest teems around the city with lush trees, colorful orchids, vibrant underbrush, and active wildlife. Your flight descends into Cataratas del Iguazu International Airport, and you can see plumes of mist rising from the edges of Iguazu Falls. Your private transfer meets you both at baggage claim and escorts you to the comforts of your gorgeous hotel. Settle into views of the splendid Iguazu Falls from your window. The greenery along the forest canopy shimmers with jade and emerald hues. The remainder of the day is at your leisure to relax in the refreshing pool or venture out to Triple Frontier, the tri-border between Argentina, Brazil, and Paraguay located near the confluence of the Iguazu and Parana Rivers.

dayInfo.title: Iguazu – Dramatic Views of the Waterfalls
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, you sample a traditional Argentinian breakfast of a light and flaky medialuna , which is similar to a croissant, accompanied by a creamy fresh-brewed cappuccino. You make your way to the entrance of Iguazu Falls National Park, which encompasses nearly 260 square miles. Parakeets twitter in the canopy against the background sound of endlessly splashing water. The parakeet has a lime-colored plumage allowing it to blend into the dangling leaves of the encircling forest. After wandering along the trails and passing a curious coati , a furry and small mammal resembling a raccoon, you board the train to reach the Upper Circuit of the falls. The walkways offer a semicircular view of the waterfall chain trundling over the cliffs. The sound of rushing water crescendoes, becoming an echoing roar. The Upper Circuit takes you along the top of the waterfalls and their edge, allowing you a thrilling and energetic view of the second largest single falls in the park, San Martin Waterfall. You continue to Devil’s Throat, into which nearly half of the entire water flow runs. A cloud of mist rises upwards from the mouth below. Flowers and trees thrive in the environment nearly flooded with spray. Toucans rest on the treetops with their colorful beaks contrasting the surrounding foliage. Butterflies flutter along the rails. You step up to the edge of the falls and bask in the refreshing mist spreading over the walkway. When the moisture clears, you have a stunning view of nature’s raw, dramatic power.

dayInfo.title: Bariloche – Jungles of the North to Arctic Southern Forests
dayInfo.description: Toucans perch in the trees outside of your room, enjoying the early morning breeze and collection of nuts harvested amongst the canopy. They can grow up to 11.5 inches tall and are known for the rich yellow, sage, and crimson colors glowing along their bills. After breakfast, your private transfer escorts you to the airport for your flight south to the gateway to Patagonia, Bariloche. The nearby peak of Cerro Catedral reaches an elevation of nearly 7,900 feet above sea level. The town overlooks the shimmering, reflective waters of Nahuel Huapi Lake, which has a surface area of more than 200 square miles. Your private transfer collects you at San Carlos de Bariloche Airport and escorts you to the seclusion of your resort, which blends the charm of a 1940s chateau with the comforts of modern luxury, and is nestled on the shores of Lake Moreno and Lake Nahuel Huapi. The remainder of the day is at your leisure to luxuriate in the beauty of your resort-style accommodation. Get acquainted with the beauty of Bariloche by venturing out onto the rippling waters of the lake in a tandem kayak. The cool air offers a refreshing contrast to the jungle ambiance of the earlier day. The mountains soar above the lakeshores, and the tall grass along the marsh rustles in the passing breeze.

dayInfo.title: Bariloche – The Best of Bariloche
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the aroma of decadent chocolate emanates from the boutique shop of Rapa Nui, located on the main shopping avenue of Bariloche. The chocolaterie offers tasty treats produced daily, from elegant truffles to a traditional Argentine alfajores , dulce de leche sandwiched between shortbread cookies. Locals enjoy a morning of dipping fruits into chocolate fondue for a fun and romantic treat to start the day. Your private guide greets you in the morning ready for you to linger in the romance of the surrounding landscape. You take to the trails leading away from your resort, making your way into a majestic fjord nestled between the foothills of Cerro Capilla and Cerro Lopez. The spiced scent of pine emanates from the evergreen trees. The enchanting hardwood of Central European architecture has faded behind the forest and granite precipices. You continue to follow the walkways leading upwards along Cerro Tronador. You can see Castaño Overo Glacier looming above the limestone cliff. The iridescent blue hues contrast the silver striations along the edges of the bluff. A series of thin, streaming waterfalls caused by the melting glacier clings to the mountain, cascading from more than 6,500 feet above sea level.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Varas – Splendor between Argentina and Chile
dayInfo.description: You wake early in the morning and enjoy the sweet and rich flavors of a freshly brewed cappuccino. The dining room at your resort offers a romantic view of the rippling waters of the lake and the reflection of the surrounding mountains. You both take the time to enjoy the simple pleasures of sharing in a quiet moment before meeting your private transfer. Today you set out on a scenic adventure through the Lakes District of Argentine Patagonia to cross into Chile. The journey begins as you board a catamaran to Puerto Blest. The gorgeous panorama along the edges of the lake fills with images of towering limestone cliffs, snowcapped peaks, and rippling turquoise waters. You can step onto the upper deck of the catamaran to feel the fresh air and refreshing breeze. The scent of pine emanates from the sweeping evergreen forests. Your guide explains one of the larch trees in the distance is more than 1,500 years old. You reach Chilean customs after passing through the Vicente Perez Rosales Pass. The dramatic foothills along Fish River hide the towns of La Poza and the Cliffs. Lush vegetation overtakes the view of turquoise waterfalls filtering into the riverbanks. You continue to the town of Puerto Varas, which stands between the snowcapped volcanic peaks of Osorno and Calbuco. The gorgeous waters of Lake Llanquihue frame the whitewashed buildings and soaring red spires of the 19th-century church, the Sacred Heart of Jesus Christ.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Natales – The Waters of Patagonia
dayInfo.description: The morning light washes over the sapphire blue waters of Lake Llanquihue. The snowcapped peaks of the flanking volcanoes shimmer against the open blue sky. The aroma of the freshwater fades beneath the scent of pine from the evergreen trees bordering the town and lining the avenues. At breakfast, you find the aroma of fresh pastries topped with orange marmalade accompanied by decadent coffee. Your private transfer greets you in the lobby and escorts you to El Tepual International Airport for your flight to Punta Arenas. The short, verdant grass spreads across the Patagonian steppe. Pebbled beaches line the shores along the Strait of Magellan. Colorful homes represent the fishing tradition and mansions from the wool boom in the city now known for its port filled with ships traveling around Cape Horn. The city of Punta Arenas maintains a relaxed ambiance beneath the nearby peak of Cerro la Cruz. The lookout point offers a panorama of the city and sea, from the tall structures and wide boulevards to the distant landscape of Tierra del Fuego. Your private transfer escorts you through Punta Arenas to reach the secluded comforts of your resort outside Puerto Natales. Indulge in the rich history of the region with locals eager to share their culture or bask in the beauty of the isolated shores of the Pacific inlet.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Natales – The Luxury of Patagonian Leisure
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you enjoy an inviting cup of hot chocolate while watching the gentle waves of the Pacific lap against the pebbled shoreline outside the dining room. The scent of ripe berries adds a delightful sweetness to the air. The day is yours to embrace adventure and romance, leisure and relaxation at your preferred pace. Enjoy a cycling excursion around Puerto Natales or relish the romance of a horseback-riding journey around Sofia Lagoon. For an unforgettable exploration of the landscape, you both meet your guide in the lobby before beginning your adventure through Bernardo O’Higgins National Park, located 31 miles outside of Puerto Natales. You take a boat along the strait and watch as the water splashes along the hull. Native forests of beech and evergreen trees overtake the landscape until the woods separate for a view of Serrano Glacier. Icebergs bob along the waterway glistening with iridescent blue hues. You can take a zodiac to shore and walk along the grainy black sands leading to the edges of the receding glacier. The ice field slips between the slopes of the surrounding foothills resembling a river frozen in motion. From up close, you can view the texture of the glacial surface, indented from the water flow spanning thousands of years.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Natales – The Lovers’ Return
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the waters of the strait glisten with sapphire hues. The fishermen from Puerto Natales return to the marina with brimming nets ready for market. Corrugated houses continue to squeeze against one another along the shoreline in the tradition of the fishermen homes of the past. The relaxed pace allows visitors to enjoy the boutique shops, sensual aromas of the sea, and the views of the mountains across the water. At breakfast, you can’t help but remember the exploits of the previous day, getting close enough to the glacier to nearly touch the steep ice walls. You have traversed the isolated landscape of Patagonia on a luxury getaway filled with delightful surprises and unforgettable romance. Your private transfer greets you at the hotel and escorts you to Teniente Julio Gallardo Airport for your flight home.

tourName: Luxury Tour of Argentina’s Wine Country
placesVisited: Mendoza, Salta, Uco Valley, Cafayate, Colomé
generalInfo: Uncover the iconic culinary treasures and delights during your custom-tailored Argentina wine tour. The heritage of European vintners blends with the ingenuity of the Argentine spirit in the landscape of the northwest featuring lush vines growing out of the arid climate. Moonlit Andean peaks, wide leafy avenues, and the world’s highest vineyards reflect the diverse splendor shaping the divine characteristics of Argentina’s devotion to culinary tradition and discovery. Whether from international influence or highlighting properties specific to local micro-regions, you will bask in the luxuries and celebrated flavors of Argentina. Begin planning your dream Argentina vacation by visiting the best Argentina itineraries page on Zicasso.

dayInfo.title: Mendoza – Arrive in Mendoza, Argentina’s Charming Winegrowing City
dayInfo.description: Mendoza has become a panorama of Argentina’s wine country displaying the dynamic flavors and distinct characteristics of an entire region along the shady streets and charming café-culture the city proudly cultivates. Your flight lands at Governor Francisco Gabrielli International Airport, where your private transfer greets you upon arrival. The sunlight betrays the region’s dry climate juxtaposed by the crisscrossing network of irrigation channels bordering the wide streets. Fountains trickle at the heart of the public plazas and students relax on the lush grasses of the Parque General San Martin at the edges of the glistening lake. After settling into the comforts of your luxurious hotel at the heart of the city, the remaining day is yours to explore the relaxed pace and quiet charms of a city only 600 miles away from Buenos Aires but encompassing an entirely different world. The best introduction to Mendoza’s obsession with flavorful treats revolves around a tasting at an artisanal chocolate factory. Your guide walks you through the facilities amidst the aroma of confectionary sugar and caramel. The family-owned business gives you access to their secret recipes as they produce some of the city’s favorite desserts, from buttery alfajores cookies to the rich flavors of hand-rolled dark chocolate truffles. Biting into the treat immerses you in the iconic flavors of a city in which taste and accentuating flavor matter.

dayInfo.title: Mendoza – Discover the Fabulous Wineries and Vines of the Primera Zona
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the cafes set out tables along the plazas and wide sidewalks offer a space for locals to enjoy their breakfast while watching the city pass by. The scent of dark-roast coffee spills out of the café doors carrying familiar hints of caramel reminding you of the chocolate tour from the previous day. After breakfast, your guide greets you at the hotel eager to introduce you to the fascinating world of wines produced within the Primera Zona , the area in which the main grapes of Argentine wine are produced. The majority of Argentine wines produced remained in the country until 2001 when the plunging peso caused producers to open to the global market resulting in Argentina becoming one of the top wine-producing countries in the world. You stop at a family-run winery devoted to crafting divine wines from the iconic grape of Argentina, Malbec. The different wines produced on the property showcase the variety of flavors the grape can contain, from smoky to fruity, as well a great range of hues spreading from the opaque to a deep purple. The dry soil, warm days, cold nights, and pure waters provide a natural environment in which the grape thrives. You run your fingers along the tender, plump grapes noticing the thick skin caused by the harsher conditions forcing the crop to fortify its flavor. You touch the sandy surface of the soil, notice the drip irrigation system, and even sample one of the grapes and taste the sweet juice. In the tasting room, you see hints of blackberry emanating from the glass. A black pepper spice lingers on your palate with touches of dark berries that balances the intense finish.

dayInfo.title: Mendoza – Sample the Flavorful Wines and Cuisine of the Uco Valley
dayInfo.description: The Andean foothills become a lingering presence on the outskirts of Mendoza. The snowcapped peaks drip with melted snow bringing ample water to the city and surrounding vineyards contrasting the dull arid landscapes with bright, verdant vines. At breakfast, you have your choice of international cuisine but enjoy dining like the locals, choosing to sip a frothy cappuccino accompanied by the buttery, flaky crust of a media luna , a croissant-like pastry. You make your way to the Uco Valley where lush vines spread across the vale and along the foothills. You visit a winery blending old traditions with contemporary ideas on an estancia first established in the 17th century. Trout swim in the large pond supporting an active trout farm and orchards grow across the harmonious landscape. The combination of soils, irrigation systems sourcing the pristine mountain water, and high elevation create the distinct characteristics of the wines produced in the area, amounting to great success with Semillon, Bonarda, and Barbera grapes. Your guide pours a sample of the Chardonnay. The clean golden yellow hue glistens in the glass. Layers of tropical fruit aromas and honey drift out of the glass. You find flavors of pineapple and citrus fruit in the full-bodied, balanced wine with a long and smooth finish. In the evening, you visit a restaurant highlighting the influence of European culture on the local cuisine during a six-course tasting menu. Instead of focusing on the regional dishes of the European influence, the chef takes care by showcasing the wines and pairings of the Uco Valley, beginning with your first course of baked brie with a Malbec sauce. You bask in a view of the Andes as the sun sets behind the undulating peaks. The meltingly creamy cheese coats your tongue allowing the sweet flavors of the dark fruits to permeate the glaze.

dayInfo.title: Mendoza - Traverse the Rugged Andean Foothills on an Immersive Hike
dayInfo.description: You meet your guide at the hotel lobby in the cool, early hours of the morning before venturing outside of Mendoza for a day in the Andes. The terrain forms the longest mountain range in the world reaching 4,500 miles across the South American continent-crossing through seven countries. Your guide offers you a gourd of mate, the favorite tea of Argentina. The high caffeine content adds to the herbaceous flavor best revealed when steeped for up to five minutes in hot water. The beauty and untamed drama of the Andes are quickly visible as you exit the city and reach the base of the soaring foothills at the Cordon del Plata range nearly 50 miles west of Mendoza. You step up the rocky terrain gripping tight to your walking poles. Pebbles and sand shift beneath your walking shoes as you labor towards the peak of Mount Lomas Blancas at 11,975 feet above sea level, the tallest summit of the range. The panoramic view from the top of the peak spreads across the valley and over the surrounding crests. A make-shift cross left by climbers blesses the space, the view, and those who never made it to the point. You take a deep breath in the thin air and enjoy the peaceful moment in the breeze with the sporadic patches of clouds rolling over the foothills below.

dayInfo.title: Cafayate – Fly to Salta and continue to Cafayate on a Scenic, Delicious Drive
dayInfo.description: The city of Salta reflects the history of Argentina beyond the fight for independence, blending the indigenous heritage of the northwest with the preserved colonial culture brought by the Spanish. You fly from Mendoza to Salta and arrive at Marine Miguel de Güemes International Airport. Your private transfer escorts you through the city on a brief but immersive tour of the cobblestone streets, plazas brimming with cafes, and vibrant folk music scene. The Museo de Arqueologia de Alta Montaña has exhibits focusing on Inca culture and the child sacrifices left on the Andean peaks. Iglesia San Francisco glows with an exuberant yellow and magenta façade hiding while the Museo de Arte Étnico Americano highlights the historic and contemporary artwork of Andean culture juxtaposing archeological finds with contemporary Latin American art galleries. Before leaving the city, you stop at a restaurant considered an empanada mega-market to sample what many consider the best empanadas in Argentina. Vendors line the walls and hustle for your attention, calling you over with vibrant colors, enthusiastic waves, or the promise of a sample. Residents and visitors to Salta sit on the patio enjoying their giant portions of a variety of empanadas while sipping Torrontes wine in the warm mid-morning light. You order a traditional carne empanada and bite into the crunchy, flaky exterior revealing a savory filling of ground beef, onions, and potato. You continue towards Cafayate enjoying the view nestled between the striated cliffs of the nearly vertical walls of Shell Gorge or Quebrada del Rio de las Conchas . The bright orange hues shimmer against the bright light around the rock formation known as the Amphitheater. An ancient waterfall carved and smoothed the rock in the landscape now void of free-flowing water. The walls carry your voice around towering rock formation accounting for its name.

dayInfo.title: Cafayate – Explore the Landscape Before Sampling Iconic Regional Wine
dayInfo.description: The wines of the Cafayate are renowned for their particular characteristics, as well as their ability to grow in the high-altitude terrain of the Andean plateau at 5,522 feet above sea level. You travel to a bodega located on a mountain slope offering spectacular views over the town. The family-owned winery has created an impressive facility. Trees on the property provide plenty of nuts during harvest time and goats roaming the landscape offer milk from which the family makes delicious cheese. An organic garden produces ample vegetables and greens like spinach, and the vineyard not only helps produce the wine but also provides the family with an abundance of raisins. During the harvest, workers handpick the bushels before aging the wine in French oak barrels. The cellar fills with the aroma of old oak in the cool, climate-controlled room. Your guide pours a sample of the famous regional white grape of Torrontes. The harsh conditions of the region cause the grape’s skin to thicken resulting in a fortified flavor. The white wine rests in unoaked barrels resulting in an aroma of jasmine and rose petals. The white pepper lingers on the palate from the tannins rounding out the flavor of soft citrus fruits.

dayInfo.title: Colomé – Travel to Secluded Colomé to Visit a Historical Hacienda
dayInfo.description: History provides the layers of charm at the historic estancia in Colomé reflecting the rebirth of a region known for wine, cuisine, ranching, and seclusion. The refuge remains a working ranch with gauchos roaming across the pampas out of view of the homestead’s Spanish colonial architecture symbolizing its 180-year history. Beyond the wine, the estate possesses the James Turrell Museum as part of the Hess Art Collection. The gallery opened in 2009 featuring the contemporary artist’s ability to bend light and space. Nine outfitted rooms include the largest “skyspace” exhibit in the world situated in the inner courtyard. The piece becomes intense at sunrise and sunset when the natural light bathes the canopy in gold and turquoise, shifting to lavender, and finally to black. A guided visit leads you around the biodynamic garden producing the ingredients for the restaurant on the property whether for dairy or produce. The kitchen makes all jams, bread, and pasta from ingredients sourced from the farm.

dayInfo.title: Colomé – Enjoy a Tranquil Horseback Ride and Afternoon at Leisure
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the scent of maté accentuates the secluded position of the estancia coupled with the sensational views of the jagged Andean peaks. You set out with one of the gauchos on an early horseback ride through the pampas noticing how the cowboy’s horse responds to his relaxed body language. You ride a Peruvian horse, which is known for its easy, smooth gait absent from the bounce indicative of riding horses, even at a trot. Upon returning to the ranch, your guide takes you north to tour the world’s highest vineyards located at 10,000 feet above sea level. The vines at altitude grow mainly Torrontes and Malbec. The cold air keeps the grapes struggling for survival accounting for their stronger flavor. When your guide pours a sample of the Torrontes and Riesling blend, you notice hints of citrus with flavors of lemon sorbet and honeysuckle. Malbec has an aroma of strawberry, ripe raspberries, and white pepper giving way to a bouquet of vanilla with smoked bacon and Indian spice.

dayInfo.title: Colomé – Return to Salta and Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you return to the dining room and sip a refreshingly frothy cappuccino in view of the towering Andean plateau. The scent of sizzling sausages emanates from the kitchen, but the delicious flavor of buttery media lunas accentuates the layered flavors of the coffee. Your private transfer greets you in the hotel lobby after breakfast ready to escort you back to Salta and the Martin Miguel de Güemes International Airport. You can travel home ending your wine exploration of Argentina or continue to Chile discovering the sensational bodegas of the Chilean wine region of the Rapel or Colchagua valleys.

tourName: Luxury Villas in Bariloche Vacation Tour
placesVisited: The Lakes Region, Bariloche, Patagonia, Nahuel Huapi National Park, Colonia Suiza, Black Glacier, Cerro Tronador
generalInfo: Bariloche blends the luxury and charm of an alpine village with the enchanting landscape of unadulterated forests, mountains, and glacial lakes. Your custom tailored tour takes you on a continuous adventure of endless hiking trails, marvelous lake cruises, and unforgettable chocolate shops. Glaciers glisten in the sunlight with pristine white ice and unique black hues. A subterranean lake hides in the depths of a cave located in an extinct volcano. Waterfalls cascade down granite slopes. Wild horses graze on secluded plains. You will discover the natural majesty of Argentina’s Lake Region and the luxurious accommodation of Bariloche luxury villas in this sensational tour to Patagonia .

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - City of Style and Luxury
dayInfo.description: Buenos Aires marches to the beat of the tango. The pulse of the city is captivating at all hours of the day. The 47 barrios (neighborhoods) have their own distinct personalities that have grown and evolved with the traditions of the culture. The city was founded in the 16th century by Spanish conquistadors and maintains a connection to its European roots, seamlessly blending with Latin American flair. Your private transfer greets you at Ministro Pistarini International Airport upon your arrival in the city. You easily settle into the comforts of your hotel situated in the charming neighborhood of Recoleta. Trees with emerald leaves shade the wide avenues. Locals, known as porteños , sit in cafes sipping a glass of wine and watching passersby. The stunning former theater of El Ateneo Grand Splendid now houses a celebrated bookshop and coffee house. Tables stand on the former stage and books wrap around the upper balconies. Various antique shops fill the streets of Defensa in the historic neighborhood of San Telmo. Window displays create a Bohemian ambiance, depicting vintage clothing and hand carved tables and chairs. People stroll along Plaza de Mayo, the central square bordered by the pink façade of the Presidential Mansion, referred to locally as the Casa Rosada. The structure was erected in the 19th century, but the plaza was founded in the 16th century, making it one of the oldest squares in the city. The city moves quickly and highlights its captivating qualities around every corner. Consider reading some of our travelers' travel reviews of Patagonia to gain inspiration to further refine and perfect your personalized Patagonia trip of a lifetime.

dayInfo.title: Alpine Attire
dayInfo.description: In the morning, artists set out to capture the lifestyle and vivacious colors of La Boca. Tango dancers perform on the street with vibrant corrugated homes rising behind them. Music echoes throughout the cobblestone plaza overlooking the daily life of porteños and filled with café tables. At breakfast, you indulge in a rich coffee and a flaky, buttery medialuna , a croissant-like pastry. Your private transfer greets you at the hotel and escorts you to the airport for your flight south to the stunning town of Bariloche. The Andean Lakes District has gorgeous scenery all year round, whether blanketed in opulent snow or bathed in sunlight and emerald trees. The region is known as the “Switzerland of the Americas” due to his alpine ambiance. Bariloche maintains a remarkably European quality commensurate with the German and Swiss émigrés after World War II. The scent of German chocolate drifts out of the celebrated chocolaterie of Rapanui and onto the cobblestone streets. The shop was opened in 1939 and continues its rich tradition of producing European-style sweets. Exceptional mountain peaks encircle the town, rising more than 6,561 feet above sea level and creating a picturesque skyline from any angle. During winter, the slopes transform into a wonderland. In summer, trails for trekking, mountain biking, and horseback riding take precedence. Local hardwood and unique honey-hued stone are the foundations of the main structures inside the town center.

dayInfo.title: Nahuel Huapi National Park - Exploring the Lakes District
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the chocolate shops of Bariloche open their doors. The scent of rich and thick hot chocolate fills each shop. Their window displays highlight the creative ways the seductive treats can be used to captivate imaginations and taste buds. After breakfast, your guide meets you at your luxurious hotel and escorts you to the banks of Lake Nahuel Huapi. The water surface encompasses more than 250 square miles and reaches a depth of 1,489 feet. Lenga forests line the shores. Spindly red flowers glow against the lush leaves. The flowers are known as notros, and were named “the firebush” by the aboriginals who once roamed Patagonia. You board a boat and set sail across the water. The pristine scenery is astounding. You travel deeper into Nahuel Huapi National Park, which was established in the early 20th century and covers 1,742,092 acres. The boat is comfortable and large. The aroma of fresh coffee lingers around the café at the back. Seagulls circle the shores. The milky green color of the lake perfectly reflects the trees swaying in the alpine breeze. You disembark the boat at Puerto Blest and make your way into the woods. The trees are centuries old, including a range of forest more than 1,500 years old. You follow the wooden staircase ascending the mountain. You can hear the thundering sound of water echoing beneath the forest canopy. You reach the main viewpoint and can see the rushing whitewater of Cascada de los Cántaros cascading between the outcrops of boulders.

dayInfo.title: Nahuel Huapi National Park - Returning to the Park
dayInfo.description: The morning sunlight washes over the city center and brings the stone and wooden frames of the mountain village to life. After breakfast, your guide escorts you through the winding mountain road to the small town of Pampa Linda. You have your first view of Cerro Tronador, a mountaintop rising 11,660 feet above sea level. Wild horses graze on the open prairies. Chucao tapaculo, an indigenous bird with a bright orange breast and orange streaks around its eyes nests in the trees. Tronador is an extinct volcano with an impressive outcropping of stone breaking through the snow. Your guide explains the natural history of the region as you journey to Ventisquero Negro. The summit of Tronador disappears behind the foothills. In its place, you see the 328 feet of ice rising above the black frame. The radiant white ice above the black crags of the glacier creates an enticing contrast. The dark coloration of the ice stems from a history of sediment picked up by the glacial movement, fed by the Rio Manso Glacier above. Chunks of ice sporadically break away from the ice wall. The rumble echoes through the mountain pass, which is why the towering summit of Cerro Tronador is named “Mount Thunder.” The sound reaches you after the ice has already calved. You catch the remaining moments of the pieces of glacier falling before splashing into the lake.

dayInfo.title: Nahuel Huapi National Park - Ancient Visions
dayInfo.description: The cafes fill with locals enjoying a bittersweet cappuccino in the morning air. The sunlight blankets the cobblestone streets and glints off the surface of the lakes interspersed across the region. After breakfast, you make your way to Parque Cerro Leones for a guided hike up the ancient volcano. Wildflowers and lupines blossom over the grassy hills. Trees shade the landscape. The trail up the volcano is rugged and steep. The summit stands 2,624 feet above sea level. Your guide leads you to the three caverns carved into the mountain. The third cavern is nearly 100 feet wide and 426 feet deep. A hidden spring forms an underground lake. You can hear the water rippling in the darkness before the guide shines a light on the surface. The cool temperature fills the cavern. The area was inhabited 8,000 years ago. Cave paintings on the outside of the cave were created more than a millennium ago. You feel as though you have stepped back in time to an age before industrialization. You exit the cave and continue to the summit of the extinct volcano. When you reach the top, you have a perfect 360-degree view of the rolling hills, staggering peaks, and radiant lakes.

dayInfo.title: Bariloche - Leisure in Bariloche
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the cool air drifts along the city streets. The scent of pine sweeps from the hillsides to the lakeshores. Chocolateries once again set up their window displays to entice passersby. At breakfast, you relish a hot cup of fresh coffee and enjoy the view of the shimmering lake. The remainder of the day is yours to enjoy Bariloche and its surroundings, as you desire. Revel in the view of Volcan Lanin, the volcanic peak standing at 12,388 feet above sea level and overtaking the skyline beside the Chilean border. Stroll along the cobblestone walkways of the city’s historic center. For a unique adventure, you choose to go whitewater rafting. Your guide meets you at the hotel and takes you along the scenic roadway of Route 40 to the riverbanks in Velvet Canyon. The emerald green waters splash against the meandering walls. The river is cold when it splashes against your cheeks. The current continues at an easy pace, allowing you to enjoy the encircling scenery. Trees sweep over the walls. Granite boulders rise out of the water. You can hear the rapids in the distance before you see them. The whitewater splashes into the air, accompanied by the thunderous sound of the rushing river. Your guide tells you to paddle. The raft picks up speed. You move with the current. The rapids propel the raft sideways. Sunken boulders push you upwards before the raft splashes back into the water. The rapids fade and return to the calm river current. The thrill of the journey remains with the exciting beating of your heart.

dayInfo.title: Bariloche - The Luxuries of Home
dayInfo.description: In the morning, visitors of Bariloche set sail for the mystic shores of Victoria Island. Lush forest overtakes the landscape. Old trees maintain a cold layer of bark, shining a bright cinnamon color. White flowers blossom against the purple sheen of wild fruit. Deer wander beneath the forest canopy and feed on the underbrush. A chairlift leads to the summit of Cerro Bella Vista and offers a spectacular view of Lake Nahuel Huapi. Outside of Bariloche is Colonia Suiza, the Swiss Colony, which has preserved the buildings from the original settlement. The town rests on the shores of Perito Moreno Lake. Fruit orchards blossom at the edge of town. On Wednesdays and Sundays, a market fills the 19th-century streets. The village takes visitors away from Argentina and seemingly transports them to a secluded region of Switzerland. The aroma of chocolate fills the entire village. Homemade cheeses entice visitors to stroll along the streets. On the weekends, traditions of aboriginal tribes are celebrated in the form of cooking curanto (Chilean meat feast). Large pits are dug and filled with hot river stones to create a roaring fire. Meats and vegetables top beds of leaves and are cooked in the natural heat and pressure of the pit. Today your private transfer meets you in the hotel lobby whenever you are ready and escorts you to the airport in Bariloche. You fly to Buenos Aires to meet your connecting flight home.

tourName: Patagonia Adventure Tour: Thrilling Activities, Serene Nature, Marvelous Luxuries
placesVisited: Patagonia, San Martín de los Andes, Puerto Fuy, Junín de Los Andes, Villa la Angostura, Bariloche
generalInfo: Composed of verdant forests, crystalline lakes, and soaring mountain peaks, Argentina and Chile’s Patagonian regions are yours to adventure within on this action-packed 12-day tour across the lake district of Patagonia. From the bewitching woodlands of San Martín de Los Andes to the marvelous shorelines of Bariloche, discover what makes South America’s picturesque Patagonian lands one of the most sought-after destinations in the world.

dayInfo.title: San Martín de Los Andes - Picturesque Images of Patagonia
dayInfo.description: Closing in on Patagonia, you will catch a glimpse of Argentina’s soaring snow-capped mountains from your plane, a sight you will soon admire up close after landing and transferring to your accommodation nestled in the charming town of San Martín de Los Andes. Today, you will join your guide for a mountain biking tour of the surrounding region, cycling through the overgrown Araucaria Forest to the base of the colossal Lonquimay Volcano. With dramatic spectacles of the mountains and rolling emerald landscape backdropping your ride, you will be at a loss for words on your first day in Argentina.

dayInfo.title: San Martín de Los Andes - Cruising through Conguillio National Park
dayInfo.description: You will see more of Patagonia by bicycle today as you enjoy a full day cycling tour from your accommodation after breakfast. You will enter the luxuriant Conguillio National Park and whizz across its charcoal gravel paths to the foot of Llaima Volcano, before continuing beneath the shaded viridian canopy en route to the quaint village of Melipeuco. During the trip, you will have plenty of opportunities to hop off your bikes and inspect the flourishing flora blooming between the thicket and witness the fascinating animals that reside within this diverse forest ecosystem.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Fuy - Whisked Away to Chile
dayInfo.description: You will enjoy a deserved break from the arduous gravel roads today as you cycle from Argentina, through the Chilean border, downhill towards a stunning private resort hemmed into the proliferating forests of Panguipulli in Chile’s Patagonian Forest. With access to a divine spa on-site and scenes of the staggering unspoiled wildlife circling your accommodation, you will luxuriate in the splendors of this great retreat. You may partake in a light stroll around the grounds to acclimate to the atmosphere of the forest before tucking into a sumptuous supper later this evening.

dayInfo.title: Puerto Fuy - Living Wild in the Forests of Panguipulli
dayInfo.description: The untouched nature reserve enwreathing your accommodation is yours to explore at your pace today, whether slowly wandering through the shamrock-colored forest or finding refuge beneath the gushing waterfalls that flow over its craggy cliffs. All the while, you will capture images of the native creatures waddling through the forest as leaves drop from the trees and birds hop from branch to branch, whistling melodic songs to soundtrack your day discovering more of Panguipulli. You may take a swim in the natural pool formed at the foot of the waterfall before returning to your resort later in the day.

dayInfo.title: Junín de Los Andes - Cabin in the Wilds
dayInfo.description: You will return to Argentina today, this time crossing the border stationed on the other end of Lake Pirihueico after a short ferry trip across its sparkling waters. Your guide and bikes await your arrival on the other side of customs, and you will hop on for a delightful trip along the coast of Lake Lacar. The glimmering lake and towering mountains will surround the paths on which you ride, ushering you closer with each passing minute to your spectacular cabin built on the banks of the Chimehuin River Valley with a commanding view of Lanin Volcano.

dayInfo.title: Junín de Los Andes - Stars Lighting Up Nahuel Mapi Canyon
dayInfo.description: After a short drive, you will arrive at a meeting point where you will be greeted by your guide accompanied by horses. You will mount up and head for the hills, trotting along flower-dotted fields beneath the looming mountains. Marvelous rock formations litter the Alumine River Valley and the crest of Lanin Volcano overlooks your trails, a brilliant backdrop for your journey to your campsite stationed in Nahuel Mapi Canyon. You may crack open a cold beverage upon arrival and share stories around the campfire as the sunset burns the sky orange and the stars twinkle from above.

dayInfo.title: Junín de Los Andes - The Wooded Landscape of Patagonia
dayInfo.description: You will ride further up the Nahuel Mapi Canyon today, passing through the Patagonian woodlands beneath the breathtaking Andes Mountains, towards crystal clear lakes and balmy springs peppering this idyllic wilderness paradise. Arriving at the banks of one of the lakes veiling the landscape, you may relish a vitalizing dip in the refreshing waters before tucking into a delectable picnic lunch and continuing to lofty mountain peaks where the postcard-perfect scenes of Patagonia stretch off to meet the horizon. Every inch of this dreamy destination will be something to behold.

dayInfo.title: Villa la Angostura - Drifting along the Seven Lakes Road
dayInfo.description: Your travels deeper into Patagonia will begin this morning, as you set course for the bendy avenues of the Seven Lakes Road, given its nickname as it weaves past the coast of several mesmerizing lakes, including Espejo, Correntoso, Escondido, Falkner, Villarino, Machonico, and Lacar. The adventure, revealing alluring scenes of the spectacular lakeside environments, will lead you to Villa la Angostura, where you will check into a charming resort tucked away in the forests spreading in all directions beneath the Andes.

dayInfo.title: Villa la Angostura - Sunny Moments on the Crystal Shores
dayInfo.description: You will head out from town this morning to the banks of Lake Espejo, hopping into a kayak with professional equipment and paddling out across the crystalline waters to take in the scenic splendors from a unique vantage point. You will cross to the mouth of a river that connects Lake Espejo Chico to Lake Espejo, the ideal spot to dive into the water on a snorkeling excursion to see what lives below the surface. You may also fly-fish from the softy, velvety shores of a nearby beach before paddling back to your vehicle and making your way back home.

dayInfo.title: Villa la Angostura - One Last Paddle across Lake Espejo
dayInfo.description: Today, you will lap up more of the luxurious scenery by kayak as you paddle further across Lake Espejo, this time gliding in new directions to see what else lies along its shimmering coast. You will stumble upon hideaway beaches where you may find refuge beneath the shade of trees hugging the shore and jump off between the thicket to capture images of dazzling birds soaring overhead and catch the wafts of fragrant flowers blossoming from behind the dense vegetation.

dayInfo.title: Bariloche - Untouched Woodlands of Arrayanes National Park
dayInfo.description: You will leave the beautiful Villa La Angostura by private boat this morning, sailing across the shimmering sapphire water of Nahuel Huapi Lake towards Arrayanes National Park. Hopping off of the boat, you will begin your stroll through the forested grounds speckled with millennial trees and teeming with colorful creatures. Viewpoints positioned across Anchorena Port will share the remarkable scenery en route to the soft sands of the sun-soaked beaches, before you arrive at Bariloche port for an evening spent on the woodland-fringed shores of Lake Nahuel Huapí.

dayInfo.title: Bariloche - Birdsong Brings Your Journey to a Close
dayInfo.description: The sunshine will glimmer off of the crystalline lake as birdsong signals the beginning of your final few hours in South America. Sipping on a bold brew of coffee, you may watch the morning slowly breeze by from your balcony before savoring your last breakfast at your accommodation. With many memories of your thrilling adventures across Argentina and Chile made during your tour, you will return feeling completely besotted with the wonders of this part of the world. Shortly after breakfast, you will join your private transfer and make your way to the international airport.

tourName: Patagonia and Tango Adventure in Argentina
placesVisited: Buenos Aires, El Calafate
generalInfo: The romantic tango scene seduces travelers and the frozen Patagonian peaks dazzle visitors during your 13-day Argentina trip that will day you from the capital city of Buenos Aires to the charming town of El Calafate. Learn to move to the enticing rhythms and explore the icy glaciers feeding glistening lagoons on this extravagant adventure of culture and nature that showcases Argentina’s diversity across the picturesque landscapes.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - Argentinian Asado on Arrival
dayInfo.description: The capital of Argentina moves to its unique rhythm and invites visitors to immerse themselves in the storied culture and bubbly atmosphere that oozes from old neighborhoods and dashing districts. Arriving at the international airport, you will meet your private transfer and head for the boho barrio of Palermo. Eclectic food stalls, lush botanical gardens, and Latin American museums will be on the doorstep of your accommodation should you wish to explore the neighborhood after you arrive. For dinner, make your way to a local steakhouse for authentic Argentinian Asado to experience the country’s famous barbecue tradition.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - City Tour and Tango Class
dayInfo.description: Buenos Aires is a big city with plenty to see and do during your stay. After breakfast, you will begin your discovery of the magnificent metropolitan with a tour guide at the sparkling steel petals of the Floralis Genérica. Continuing to Parque de la Memoria, or Memory Park, you will unpack the country’s dramatic history and then visit the resting place of Eva Perón in the affluent neighborhood of Recoleta. Your guide will then usher you to several significant sites before you learn to twist and turn to Argentinian music during a private tango class.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - Traditional Argentine Dinner Party
dayInfo.description: Your morning is left open for you to explore Buenos Aires at your pace, choosing from a variety of activities around the city. You may stroll the colorful streets of La Boca and browse eccentric boutiques, indulge in regional cuisine, or watch street performers twirl their partners to the tango rhythms. The performances will inspire you, and you will improve your moves during your second tango class this evening. Following your romantic dance, you will enjoy a traditional Argentine Dinner Party, learning to fold empanadas , South American pastries, prepare mate , a South American herbal blend, and the Argentinian Asado ritual.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - El Cabaret at Cafe de Los Angelitos
dayInfo.description: With another day free to wander Buenos Aires, you may take your time relishing every moment this morning from the quiet breakfast on your balcony overlooking Palermo to a stroll around historic sites and architectural landmarks. In the afternoon, you will begin to master tango at another class teaching you more advanced tango techniques. Your intimate lesson will be followed by a riveting El Cabaret show at Cafe de Los Angelitos featuring a live orchestra, talented dancers, authentic Argentinian cuisine, and prestigious local wines set within a grand music and performance venue.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - Enjoy the Finer Things
dayInfo.description: With a day to explore Buenos Aires freely, you can take your time indulging in the finer things the city has to offer. You can wander the affluent boulevards of Recoleta, discover gourmet eateries down narrow alleys, uncover the city’s best-kept secrets at beloved districts, and sit beneath the shady trees at tranquil parks peppering the cityscape. You may also visit the many historical museums and landmarks that riddle Buenos Aire’s treasure trove of eclectic neighborhoods before devouring a delicious dinner paired with sumptuous local wines.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - Last Chance to Tango
dayInfo.description: Enjoy a hearty Argentine breakfast this morning as you savor your final moments in the exuberant capital city of Buenos Aires. Having learned so much about Argentina’s thriving tango culture and scene, you will be thrilled to wrap up your adventure in Buenos Aires with a cultural tango class this evening. You will showcase all that you have learned as you twist and turn to the sultry music in a ravishing club, dancing the night away with your partner and the talented local performers and toasting a splendid stay.

dayInfo.title: El Calafate - Transfer to the Patagonian Ice Fields
dayInfo.description: Your Argentine adventure will continue in El Calafate at an accommodation nestled in an icy Patagonian reserve, around the corner from Perito Moreno Glacier. Natural ice sculptures, frosty lakes, and frozen water walls dominate the remarkable Patagonian scenery that surrounds El Calafate. During your stay, you will enjoy the luxury of traversing the ice-capped landscape, crossing the frigid waterways, and witnessing the curious creatures that inhabit the winter wonderland circling El Calafate. Be sure to take a short walk to Laguna Nimez reserve when you arrive to acclimate to your scenic home away from home.

dayInfo.title: El Calafate - Perusing Perito Moreno Glacier
dayInfo.description: You will enjoy a warm and hearty breakfast this morning and then explore the majestic icy region on a Perito Moreno Glacier tour. Tours of the immense ice fields typically begin with a short boat cruise across azure lagoons of the Los Glaciares National Park, where you will capture idyllic landscape photography of the frozen Patagonian ice fields. The boat will anchor on the glacier, and you will hop off onto walkways that weave across the blinding white ice and through frost-covered forests to panoramic viewpoints showing off the surreal backdrop.

dayInfo.title: El Calafate - Uncover the Upsala Glacier
dayInfo.description: The Upsala Glacier is another iconic ice landscape to explore during your stay in El Calafate. An experienced guide will join you this morning and lead the way to a boat setting sail across the sparkling waters of Lago Argentino. Your first stop will be the historic Estancia Cristina ranch, stationed on the glacier, where you will delve into the region’s folklore and wander to a cascading sapphire waterfall nearby. The mountain trail will continue to an observation point overlooking Lake William, the Patagonian ice field, and the Andes mountains.

dayInfo.title: El Calafate - Hiking to El Chalten and Mount Fitz Roy
dayInfo.description: There are few better ways to embrace the beauty of Patagonia than on a hike from the village of El Chalten across the Los Glaciares National Park to Mount Fitz Roy. After breakfast, you will slip into comfortable trekking shoes and set off along the iconic Route 40 highway to La Leona River, past an ancient hotel nearby Cañadón La Leona where you can embrace the distinctive scenery. The trail will take you to several scenic viewpoints showcasing the enrapturing Patagonian peaks, the tranquil Andean village of El Chalten, and the miradors of Mount Fitz Roy and Mount Torre.

dayInfo.title: El Calafate - Embrace the Pleasures of Patagonia
dayInfo.description: You will wake up and enjoy breakfast to views of the shimmering lagoon, distant snowy peaks, and wildlife exploring the plains of El Calafate. Birds chirping will soundtrack your morning munch, and you will slowly soak up the Patagonian splendors during your free day in El Calafate. Today, you can explore the frosted national park or wander around town to discover what makes this modest village in the magnificent region so special. You can chat with locals about the wildlife and extraordinary environment, tuck into regional dishes at humble eateries, and treat yourself to spa therapies before you turn in.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - A Docile Day in the Capital City
dayInfo.description: You will return to Buenos Aires after breakfast and spend the day freely absorbing the spirited atmosphere as you choose how to spend your final moments in Argentina. You can sit back in style at a gourmet café, peruse the curiosities of local boutiques, stroll through the fragrant flower fields of landscaped parks, and gaze upon the historical works at museums and art galleries. Buenos Aires boasts many marvelous experiences to entertain you during your final free day in Argentina’s bustling capital city.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires - One Last Morning of City Exploring
dayInfo.description: Your last morning in Buenos Aires is your last opportunity to savor the stirring atmosphere at Argentinian cafés or markets and South American traditions preserved in century-old quarters. After breakfast, you may wander the neighborhood and veer down beautiful boulevards to landmarks left unexplored. The Santisimo Sacramento Basilica and Obelisco de Buenos Aires are among the city’s historical icons worth visiting before you pack your bags, check out of your accommodation, meet your private transfer, and travel to the airport for your flight home.

tourName: Perfect One Week Argentina Tour for 50 Plus Aged Travelers
placesVisited: Buenos Aires, Mendoza City, Bariloche
generalInfo: On this luxurious 7-day adventure, you will experience Argentina’s finest destinations in complete luxury. From the magnificent features of the Lake District of Bariloche to the gorgeous vineyards of wine country in Mendoza, Argentina is a land whose spectacular beauty astounds all its visitors. Indulge in a glass of world-class Argentine Malbec wine, attend a spellbinding tango performance in the heart of Buenos Aires, listen to stories of local winemakers in Mendoza, and delight in the glacial waters of Bariloche.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – Show at Teatro Colon Opera House
dayInfo.description: You will arrive at one of the city’s two international airports, where you will meet your private driver and be transferred to your luxurious accommodation in the heart of Buenos Aires’ Palermo neighborhood. After settling in, when you are ready, you will be transferred to the heart of the city. Here, you will attend a world-class performance at Buenos Aires’ illustrious Teatro Colon Opera House. After the performance, you will be guided to the upscale neighborhood of Puerto Madero, where you will enjoy an exquisite dinner in true Argentine fashion at one of the area’s finest restaurants.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – Live Tango Show and Dinner
dayInfo.description: When you are ready to begin your day’s events, you will be led on a specially curated tour of the city’s most noteworthy sites and neighborhoods. Your first stop will be Palermo, which is characterized by its vibrant street-art, charming boutiques, shops, bars, and restaurants. You will then be transferred to the upscale neighborhood of Recoleta, where you will visit the Recoleta Cemetery. You will then visit the gorgeous Casa Rosada, which is the President of Argentina’s executive mansion, located beside the historic neighborhood of San Telmo. In the afternoon, you will have time to relax and recharge before connecting with your guide to begin the evening’s activities. This evening, you will attend a live tango show, where you will indulge in a traditional Argentine dinner and regional wine pairing.

dayInfo.title: Buenos Aires – Exploring the Streets of La Boca
dayInfo.description: Today, you will indulge in an Argentine breakfast before meeting your guide before being transferred via private coach to the dynamic neighborhood of La Boca. In the afternoon, you will be returned to the heart of Palermo, where you will have the opportunity to explore the luscious Bosques de Palermo, which is Buenos Aires’ largest park. During your time in the park, you can stroll along the footpaths, stopping to admire the rose gardens and sculptures. You can even rent a rowboat to float along the river. In the evening, your guide will provide you with dining recommendations, so you can enjoy your final dinner in Buenos Aires while sipping on world-class wine.

dayInfo.title: Mendoza – Argentina’s Best Boutique Bodegas
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will fly to Mendoza, which is located in the heart of Argentina’s wine country. Once you have collected your belongings, you will be met by your driver and transferred to your luxury wine lodge and spa accommodation in the foothills of the Andes Mountains. When you are ready, you will embark on a private tour of the region’s top wineries, many of which have been owned by the same families for generations. During your tour, you will experience the winemaking process and speak with the local vintners about their craft. In the afternoon, you will participate in an exquisite wine tasting of Mendoza’s top vintages. After your tasting concludes, you can stroll through the winery grounds before returning to your accommodation, where you will have the remainder of the evening to spend at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Mendoza – Dining with a Local Family
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will spend the morning on your own. If you desire, you can partake in one of Mendoza’s many available activities that will be discussed with you by your guide. If you are in the mood to go shopping, you may venture into Mendoza’s city center, but if you want to relax and take it easy, then you can indulge in a luxurious massage or spa treatment at your hotel. In the evening, you will be transferred to the home of a lovely local family, where you will be treated to an exquisite Argentine meal that will be paired with Argentine wine. This will be an evening of cultural immersion, and you will learn more about the heritage and customs of Argentina. After dinner, you will be returned to your accommodation to enjoy your final evening in Mendoza.

dayInfo.title: Bariloche – Cruise through the Lake District
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will fly to Bariloche. Upon your arrival in Argentina’s Lake District, you will be met by your driver and transferred to your opulent mountain lodge accommodation that overlooks one of the region’s most spectacular lakes. When you are ready, you will board a private yacht and spend the day touring the remarkable Lake District. Your expert guide will share information with you about the history of the region and will point out the unique flora and fauna that inhabit the region. On the yacht, you will enjoy a gourmet lunch prepared for you by the yacht’s private chef. After lunch, you will disembark for a leisurely trek through the region. Then, in the afternoon, you will be transferred to the town center of Bariloche, where you will witness the unique German and Swiss-inspired architecture that characterizes the city center.

dayInfo.title: Bariloche – Farewell to Argentina
dayInfo.description: Today will be your final day in Argentina. You will enjoy breakfast at your luxurious accommodation before having a few hours to indulge in some self-exploration should you wish. You will be able to relax beside the serene waters of the region’s many lakes or roam through Bariloche’s lovely town. As you gaze upon the snow-capped mountain peaks that characterize the area, you will begin to reminisce on your splendid vacation thus far. The moments may fade quicker than they did during the beginning of your trip, and soon you will return to your hotel for your transfer to the airport.

tourName: Renowned 10-Day Argentina Cuisine and Culture Tour
placesVisited: Bariloche, Mendoza, Buenos Aires, Salta, Jujuy
generalInfo: From discovering the origins of the rich, creamy chocolates of Bariloche in Patagonia to learning how to emulate the spellbinding motions of Buenos Aires’ alluring tango, be prepared to experience the cultures and flavors of Argentina like never before. Delight in a curated wine tasting set against the perfect backdrop of Mendoza’s picturesque wine region, and traverse the mountainous terrain of Argentina’s rugged Northern region, immersing yourself in the rich culture of its indigenous inhabitants. On this luxurious, 10-day tour through Argentina, you will uncover all of the cultural and gastronomic treasures that this wonderful country has to offer.

dayInfo.title: Bariloche – Arrive at Bariloche and Enjoy a Chocolate Making Class
dayInfo.description: A country that is world-renowned for its rich culture and delectable gastronomy, Argentina is home to a variety of eclectic landscapes, cities, and traditions. You will arrive in the mountainous town of Bariloche and be met at the airport by your private tour guide who will transfer you to your luxurious mountain lodge accommodation and spa in the heart of Bariloche’s Lake District. As you gaze out on the immense, snow-capped Andes mountains, you can breathe in the crisp, mountain air and bask in the phenomenal views of the lakes for which this region is famous. Once you have had time to settle in, you will meet your guide once again in your hotel’s lobby for your transfer into the center of Bariloche’s charming town. Here, you will be led on a tour by your expert guide, learning of the city’s history and the large population of German and Swiss immigrants that have influenced the culture and style of the area. You will then delight in a private chocolate-making class for your first introduction to this wonderful country. This is where you will learn how some of the local delicacies are crafted. You will have the opportunity to sample your work and some of the other sweet, delicious flavors of Argentine chocolate that have been made by professionals. Afterward, you will be returned to your luxurious accommodation where the rest of the evening will be at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Bariloche – Tour the Gorgeous Lake District by Boat
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will enjoy a traditional breakfast of facturas, which are delicious Argentine pastries that are typically coated with sweet powdered sugar and filled with luscious dulce de leche. To accompany your pleasurable breakfast, you can delight in a coffee or mate, which is a traditional, highly-caffeinated Argentine tea that is an acquired taste. Then, you will meet your guide in the hotel lobby to begin the day’s adventures of exploring the gorgeous Lake District of Patagonia. There is no more memorable way to explore the illustrious Lake District than up close, so you will spend the day cruising through its serene waters. Your guide will transfer you to the picturesque port in which you will board a luxurious boat and embark on a day trip through the Andean chain of lakes, crossing the border into Chile. Cruising through several of the region’s remarkable lakes, you can bask in the beauty that surrounds you. From natural wonders like glaciers, volcanic peaks, and luscious forests, you can listen as your guide provides thoughtful commentary on the region, its peoples, cultures, nature, and gastronomy. At the end of the day, you will return to Bariloche to unwind in the hotel’s tranquil spa before enjoying the rest of the evening at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Mendoza – Arrive at Mendoza for a Gourmet Lunch with Wine Pairing
dayInfo.description: Today, you will need to have an early start for your transfer to the airport. By meeting your private guide in the lobby, you will transfer to the world-famous winemaking region of Mendoza, which is located just to the north of Patagonia. Upon your arrival in this pleasant town, you will be transferred to your boutique, wine lodge, hotel, and spa, which will be perfectly situated at the foot of the Andes mountains. Once you have had time to freshen up, you will meet your expert guide in the lobby for your transfer to a local bodega or winery for a multi-course gourmet lunch that will be accompanied by a fantastic wine pairing. Here, you will delight in the flavors of traditional Argentine cuisine as you savor the taste of thick-cut beef that is perfectly complemented by delicious chimichurri sauce and the fruity, full-bodied flavors of a finely-aged Malbec. For dessert, you will indulge in the heavenly sweetness of alfajores, a delectable Argentine cookie that is held together by thick, creamy dulce de leche . Once your gourmet meal has concluded, you can enjoy the afternoon at your leisure, taking in the phenomenal views of the charming Argentine vineyards that are set against the backdrop of the infinite snowy-peaks of the Andes mountains. If you prefer to relax in comfort, then you can luxuriate in a spa treatment or massage or sit with a glass of fine wine on your hotel’s refreshing terrace to enjoy the fantastic views.

dayInfo.title: Mendoza – Privately Tour the Top Bodegas and Enjoy a Curated Wine Tasting
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will enjoy breakfast before meeting your private guide in the lobby to begin your day. Today, you will be led on an extensive tour of Mendoza’s best bodegas and will uncover the intricacies of a unique winemaking process in the very region where it occurs.
